loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth I. is from Eguafo Village, which is situated close to the fishing town Elmina. Her husband is a farmer and they have four children. For the past 8 years, Elizabeth has made a living selling kenkey, a favourite Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and usually served with fish and pepper sauce.  Her income helps pay for her children’s school fees and utility bills. 

Elizabeth needs a loan from Kiva to grow her business. It will be used to purchase more maize and more firewood to produce larger quantities of kenkey.

Elizabeth plans to save any additional earnings for her children’s future university education.

loans.use: to buy more maize and firewood

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 59 years old.  She is a widow with five children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.
She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production and more stock to sell in her store.

Marina has borrowed and paid 11 previous loans from NWTF before this one. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is from Mayors Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling fashion accessories and cosmetics. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fashion accessories and cosmetics to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilibeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion accessories and cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El señor Rafael se dedica a la construcción de viviendas o remodelaciones de ambientes, su única hermana es de profesión arquitecto ella consigue los contratos y emplea los servicios de su hermano en la supervisión y control de la obra el señor se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años sus padres son de edad avanzada y no viven con el, con esta actividad el genera ingresos para su manutención y manutención de sus papas por que su hermana es casada y tiene otras obligaciones el señor es soltero. Indica que por la demanda de sus servicios necesita otro guinche por que tiene otra obra en curso y no puede dejar de emplear esta herramienta por este motivo solicito su crédito, esta agradecido de la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Rafael builds houses and performs remodeling jobs. His only sister is an architect by profession. When she gets contracts, she employs her brother to supervise and control the work. Rafael has been in business for four years. His parents are elderly and do not live with him. The income from his business not only supports Rafael, but it also provides for the needs of his parents. His sister is married and has other obligations. However, Sr. Rafael is single.

Due to the demand for his services, Rafael needs another winch for a job that is in progress. He is not able to acquire this piece of equipment, so he is requesting a loan. He thanks Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a winch for his construction business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Formación del comité fue a iniciativa de la Sra. Carmen, quien vive en Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas, comentándole acerca del grupo de mujeres emprendedora y decidieron formar el comité en la zona. Actualmente el comité cuenta con 16 integrantes de los cuales todos participan de forma activa y responsable.
La Sra Carmen es la Directora General del comité, y se define así misma como una mujer luchadora, responsable y humilde, que desde siempre ha asumido responsabilidades de este tipo por lo que esta tarea no le es para nada ajena.
Las miembros se dedican a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, es por eso que solicitan el crédito para el aumento de la variedad de sus productos, para poder así acceder a las prendas de todas las estaciones, para poder de esa manera atraer a mas clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The formation of this committee was an initiative of Mrs. Carmen, who lives in Ciudad del Este. She got in touch with her neighbours and friends, telling them about this group of enterprising women, and they decided to form the committee in their zone. The committee currently has 16 members, of whom all participate actively and responsibly. 
Mrs. Carmen is the General Director of the committee, and describes herself as a hard-working, responsible and modest woman who has always taken on this kind of responsibility--so this work is not new for her.
The group members sell all types of clothing. They are requesting this loan to increase the variety of their products, in order to be able to obtain garments for every season. This way they will be able to attract more customers, thus increasing their income.

loans.use: to purchase all types of clothing for stock.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 34 años, convive con Américo, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, un varón y una niña recién nacida. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Se encuentra muy feliz, hace poco recibió la llegada de su última hija; en este tiempo se mantuvo en cama por problemas de salud. A pesar de ello está valiente mujer continua trabajando para poder brindarle a su hija todo lo necesario. El Trabajo al que se dedica está hermosa mujer, es la compra y venta de verduras, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad durante los días miércoles, viernes y domingos, en un puesto que arrendó en la sección de verduras. Estos días de feria, todos los pobladores compran alimentos para la semana, Lidia, mueve un capital de 3 mil a 4 mi nuevos soles, generando una ganancia del 10%, en los mejores días. Pero como buena administradora de sus ganancias ella invirtió todos sus ahorros en la compra de un camión, para trasladar lo que ha cosechado a la ciudad. Además se dedica en la siembra de papa y arveja, cuyo cultivo cuida y fertiliza los fines de semana. Le va muy bien en su trabajo ya que, vendiendo al menudeo ella misma, sin intermediarios, genera más ganancias en sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para concretar sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Lidia de recibir su apoyo, comprará con el dinero solicitado en varios sacos verduras, legumbres y hortalizas; para surtir su negocio y si le alcanza el dinero piensa comprar semilla de arveja para comenzar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 34 years old and lives together with Américo who is 36 years old. They both have two children, one boy and one newborn girl. They live as a family in a rented house located in the city of Tarma. She is very happy given the recent arrival of her last daughter. Recently she has been bedridden due to health problems. Despite this, she is a very courageous woman, continuing to work to be able to provide her daughter with the necessities. 

The work that this lovely woman makes a living at is the purchase and sale of vegetables. She sells them at the wholesale market in her city on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays in a stall she rented in the vegetable section. On market days everyone in town buys food for the week. Lidia moves between 3,000 and 4,000 nuevos soles worth, generating a 10% profit on the best days. However, as a good manager of her profits, she invests all of her savings in the purchase of a truck to transport her harvest to the city. Additionally, she earns money by planting potatoes and peas. She tends to and fertilizes her crops on weekends. 

Her work is going well. Selling her product at retail herself, without middlemen, generates more profits on her crops. She belongs to the “Integra” community bank and this is her seventh loan with MFP where she awaits financial support to realize her objectives. She is committed to making her payments with punctuality. Upon receiving this support, Lidia will use the money requested to buy several sacks of vegetables, legumes and greens to supply her business. If there is enough money left over she will buy pea seeds to start the next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables, legumes and greens as well as pea seeds.

loans.name: 21 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Điệp operates a food stall selling sweet rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Điệp is 40 years old and is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 21 Điện Biên solidarity group. 
Điệp lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Điệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Điệp has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Điệp has been involved in this business for 4 years.
The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Điệp hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a vegetable and spice sales business in the Philippines. 

Julieta requested a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Julieta has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kafuro_Fish Farmers Group

texts.en:
Hawa, age 52, has been selling maize, beans, and coffee for the past five years at the Bushenyi food market. She tells us that her friends encouraged her to engage this business. Hawa is not only honest but also hard-working, and plans to expand her business in future to cover a bigger market. She also engages in farming as a side business in order to bring her an additional income.

Hawa has many regular customers. They are residents and traders from nearby places.
 
Hawa and her husband have five children, three of whom are still enrolled in school. 

With her Kiva loan, Hawa plans to buy more beans, coffee, and maize to offer for sale. She is confident that this will increase her profits and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans, coffee, and maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is 43 years old and married with three children in Iraq. He owns a store that sells structural materials and, based on the region’s needs, he added foodstuffs to his store in 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $3,000 loan in order to pay his annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can one day open a new store to make the food market separate from his other work and to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay his annual rent and add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: Larry de 34 años de edad soltero, labora para un ministerio desde hace 14 años como Conductor. Esta solicitando su 7mo.  credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda realizando la construccion de un cuarto y asi brindarle a su familia mejores comodidades.  Cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para mejorar su casa poniendole el piso y fue beneficiado por kiva, ahora espera que nuevamente le apoye para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Larry is 34 years old, single, and has worked for 14 years as a driver.  He is requesting his seventh loan so that he can make an improvement to his home.  Larry will build a room so that he can provide more comfortable conditions for his family.  

It should be noted that his previous loan was used to improve his home by installing a floor, which was a benefit of being funded by Kiva.  Now he hopes to renew this support so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for the past 15 years.

Teresa is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat engine

loans.name: Elephant Group

texts.en:
Bufu, who is in his mid 40s, is married with four children: two of them are independent and two of them are still going to school. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business for two years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy missing items he needed. He took care of his family and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase his stock of fruit and  vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to buy a car for transporting his fruit and vegetables from the market place.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Elephant" who has a total of 26 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora que no le gusta depender de cualquier persona, si no valerse por si misma, por tal motivo trabaja para una maquiladora  10 horas diarias y para tener mas ingreso vende gelatinas de mosaicos que misma prepara para vender en su área para así obtener mayor ingreso. Desde hace 2 años que se cambio a su casa no la hecho ninguna mejora a la vivienda por tal motivo quiere remodelarla por dentro  y fuera para que este en mejores condiciones. Las paredes de enfrente la pintura ya se esta deteriorando por lo que da un mal aspecto para ella, por tal motivo quiere comprar cemento, arena y pintura.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a very hardworking woman, who does not like to be dependent on anyone if she can manage on her own. Because of this she works in a factory 10 hours a day, and also brings in extra income by making and selling "gelatinas de mosaicos" - colourful jelly desserts that are popular in Mexico.

Ever since she moved house 2 years ago she has not made any improvements to her home, and for that reason she now wishes to remodel and improve the interior. The condition of the paint on the front of the house is also deteriorating, which doesn't look good, so she wants to buy cement, sand, and paint.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and pay for labour.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
el sr. Victor tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 2 hijos, es Caficultor y Agricultor y tiene una experiencia de 3 años en el manejo de la tierra, estas actividades productivas son la fuente de ingresos con las cuales ha logrado salir adelante,  brindando estudio a sus hijos y suplir los demás gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos.  
Don Víctor utilizara el credito para comprar un sistema solar y poder gozar de el servicio de energia en su casa de habitacion, todo el tiempo su familia se ha alumbrado con candiles y ocote perjudicando la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 33 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and is the father of two children. He is a coffee grower and farmer, and has three years of experience working the land. These productive activities are his source of income, with which he has managed to survive, offer schooling to his children, and provide for other family expenses and obligations. 

Victor will use this loan to buy a solar energy system, in order to enjoy electricity in his home. Until now his family has used oil lamps and ocote wood for lighting, which is detrimental to his family's health.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Anouolouwa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ANOUOLOUWA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Rafiath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rafiath est âgée de 34 ans. Rafiath a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Rafiath est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Bernard. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus des deux enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge.  Rafiath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Rafiath vend depuis quatre ans, divers produits (lait, savons, sucre, etc.) et des liqueurs dans sa région. Rafiath achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Rafiath sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ANOUOLOUWA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
ANOUOLOUWA Group is made up of three persons who live in the same area. They are seeking their fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Rafiath, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She dropped out of middle school. She's 34 years old and married to a reseller named Bernard.

The couple has two school-attending children. In addition, they have another kid to support. The couple takes care of the family expenses together.

To help with the family expenses, Rafiath has been selling various products (milk, soaps, sugar, etc) and liquors in her region for four years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

Eager to satisfy her clientele and increase her revenue, Rafiath, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy various products (boxes of milk, soaps, and sugar)

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is requesting a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy spices, cooking oil, and other grocery items to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and increase his profits.  He is very fair in his rates and has been operating his business for the past many years. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will be helpful for her husband and it will grow his business.

She is a housewife and spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She is the mother of 4 children. One of them works, while the others are getting their education from a nearby school.  She is very hopeful that her family will be able to live a better financial life as a result of her husband's improved business

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, spices, etc, for grocery store business

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег использовал предыдущий кредит для разведения цыплят и смог неплохо заработать.
В этот раз кредит в 7 000 гривен ему необходим для того, чтобы отремонтировать автомобиль и приобрести зимние колеса и все необходимое для предоставления транспортных услуг зимой. Когда наступают холода, этот бизнес становится главным источником дохода для Олега и его семьи. 
Олег надеется, что, получив кредит от Кива, он сможет без проблем работать на своем транспортном средстве на протяжении холодов, тем самым стабильно обеспечивая свою семью.
texts.en: Oleg used his previous loan for breeding chickens and earned good money. This time, he is requesting a loan of 7,000 hryvnia to repair his car and put on winter tires and do everything necessary in order to be able to offer winter transportation services. When the cold season begins, this business becomes a major source of income for Oleg and his family. Oleg hopes that by receiving a Kiva loan, he can easily work on his car during cold weather, therefore providing a stable income for his family.

loans.use: repair his car, put on winter tires and do everything necessary in order to be able to offer winter transportation services

loans.name: Nteteyia

texts.en:
Nteteyia is 42 years-old and has five children. To earn a living, she makes and sells traditional beaded jewellery.  She also sells fabric.  Previously, she used to sell milk.  Through Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her business well because she has been trained on business management skills.

Nteteyia has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy beads.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de huit personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adodo Jeanne celle qui a la main levée sur la photo n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Adodo Jeanne est âgée de 32 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Adodo Jeanne est mariée à un agent de sécurité du nom de Mathias. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adodo Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Adodo Jeanne vend depuis quinze ans divers produits et des fruits de saison. Adodo Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adodo Jeanne ensemble avec les membres du groupe la DIEU EST GRAND, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits et des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en: Haron, 30 years old, is married and supports a family of 8 members. He has been practicing farming for the last 8 years and earns KES 10,000 per month. Haron has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farming tools for high production. He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand his business. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy farming tools for high production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PARA TRATAMIENTO OFTALMICO

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina E.,53,lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is married and has three children. After her retirement in 1999, she began selling cosmetics to help with the family expenses and to invest her time in a productive activity. After seven years, Guillermina obtained very good results and now she has a good number of clients; this helped her household\\\\\\\'s economy a lot. She has been able to maintain her business because of her perseverance, her effort, and her desire to work, as well as the great support from her children and her husband.

To be able to continue with her business and make it grow, Guillermina needs a $650 USD loan to be repayed within five months. This way she\'ll be able to acquire merchandise, supply her pending orders and have a greater inventory. Help her go on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas vive Guillermina E.. Tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos. Después de su jubilación en 1999, ella decidió comenzar a vender cosméticos para ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares e invertir su tiempo en una actividad productiva. Luego de siete años, Guillermina ha logrado muy buenos resultados y ahora tiene un buen número de clientes, esto ha ayudado mucho a la economía de su hogar. La perseverancia, el esfuerzo, las ganas de trabajar y el gran apoyo de sus hijos y su esposo es lo que le ha permitido mantener su negocio.

Para poder continuar y hacer crecer su negocio, Guillermina necesita un préstamo de $650 USD con un plazo de cinco meses y así poder adquirir mercancía, cubrir pedidos pendientes y tener un mayor inventario. Ayúdala a continuar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Patricia Wanjiru intends to purchase cloth, sewing threads and other tools needed to make this business a success

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Mrs. D. is 55 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom passed away. Her child is married and works, and she also takes care of one additional child in her home. She is separated from her husband, and therefore is the sole income earner for the family. She currently works in rice agriculture and also makes and sells “gari” (a food derived from the cassava root that is often eaten with beans) and palm oil.

With this loan, Mrs. D. will be able to hire people to help her with the very intensive tasks of agriculture and “gari” production. Although she is illiterate and was never able to attend school, Mrs. D. is currently able to send the child in her charge to school and to pay for the school fees. They live in her uncle’s home, however, and cannot afford to go to the doctor or to eat substantial meals. With an easier workload, Mrs. D. hopes to be able to eventually improve her living situation. She will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Mrs. Danyo is requesting a loan of $200 for cultivating rice and cassava and to purchase additional cassava to make the “gari.”

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two children. Her husband is a day laborer, a job which is not particularly stable. Indeed, he is often unemployed and thus cannot pay for household expenses. Consequently, in order to support her husband, Maria decided to start a business selling snacks. She began by only selling one to two types of products. As she added more products, though, her business began to grow.

Maria is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase merchandise to resupply her business and thus help it continue to grow. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Maria and her family would appreciate your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y tiene dos hijos, un hombre y una mujer, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, y es un trabajo que no es estable, por eso en muchas temporadas él no tiene empleo y no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello, María decidió poner su negocio de venta de frituras, para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo muy pocas cosas hace un año atrás, empezó vendiendo de 1 a 2 tipos de productos y poco a poco fue surtiéndose de más productos y comenzó a crecer con su negocio.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $200 para comprar mercaderías para abastecer y surtir su negocio y continuar con el crecimiento del mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali I. is 23 years old. He was born in Sumqayıt City in Azerbaijan. Sumqayıt is situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. Right now Ali is living in Sumgayit City, with his family. A dentist, Ali is the only breadwinner for his family. He began his profession 5 years ago.

Ali is a good dentist, but this job is very hard. He would like to purchase new equipment for his dental office. He had already managed to save some money but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money. He wants to improve his business by increasing the number of his clients so as to increase the income from his practice.

Now, Ali needs $500 to buy the necessary equipment. He thinks that this expansion of his dental clinic will improve living conditions for his family. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his dental practice

loans.name: Nurwiti

texts.en: Nurwiti is 29 years old and married. She sells sandals on credit. She travels to other villages besides her own village to find customers.  Her earnings from this business total around $20 per week. She is a new member of MBK and would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to buy more sandals and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her sandal business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 22 years old and is the mother of a child aged 1. She sells clothes and sandals on credit and usually earns about US$ 10 per day. Her husband, A., is a motorcycle driver and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Hilda is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Turaboev

texts.en: Turaboev M. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast) Tajikistan. Turaboev M. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. The business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, the previous loan and to improve his business situation. Mr. Turaboev M. is experienced in the business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because he  has been engaged in the livestock business from his early years when he helped his father to raise and sell  cows and sheep. Besides he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation. It is the family business  He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull for further livestock breeding. Now Mr. Turaboev M. requests a loan of $300 for  business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increase significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Asha's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with 4 children, ages15, 12, 9, and 5 years old. Asha owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending and soft drink selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working mother dedicated to her family. She works alongside her husband on farmland sowing corn, potatoes, and barley in order to support her beloved children. She has the aim of working more enthusiastically at harvest time and, with the next planting, gradually improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una madre muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Se desempeña en compañía de su esposo en sus tierras agrícolas sembrando maíz, papa y cebada para el sostén de sus queridos hijos.Tiene el propósito de laborar con mayor ahínco en la cosecha y próxima siembra con el objetivo de mejorar paulatinamente la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en: Abdul Sabor is a young father. He is a very hard worker and has video caste shop in a crowded shopping area in Kabul. He is requesting a loan to import more CDs and DVDs for his shop. This will improve his business and create a better financial condition for his family.

loans.use: To export more CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe works as a security guard in the mayor's office in La Paz. He also works as a cross-province driver. His wife works selling children's clothes (their main source of income) and it is with all these occupations that they support their three kids; an eleven year old and 2 and a half year old twins. The family lives in San Jose de Yunguyo in the city of El Alto.

They will use this credit to buy construction materials to fortify their front wall.

This is their first loan with Impro and the results of their evaluation mean that the company approve of their loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Felipe trabaja como en Gendarme en la Alcaldía de La Paz, igualmente, tiene otro trabajo como transportista interprovincial. Su esposa es comerciante de ropa de niños (su principal fuente de ingresos), con dichas ocupaciones mantienen a sus tres hijos de 11 años de edad y una parejita de gemelos de 2 años y medio. La familia vive en San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito será destinado para comprar materiales de construcción para edificar una muralla frontal. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, los resultados de la evaluación nos permiten aprobar esta solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials/ADQUISICIÓN DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCIÓN

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna N. (shown in the picture on the right with her group members) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. The group members all live on an island on the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh:

1-Mrs. Vanna N., 34, and her husband, Mr. Mov Say, were married in 1992 and have three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are in local school. Vanna has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt, while Mr. Mov has practiced the trade for 16 years. Now Vanna is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

2-Mrs. Sinkhoeun S., 33, and her husband, Mr. Rin Bophea, were married in 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in local school. Sinkhoeun has been a silk weaver since she was 12 years old, a skill she learned from her parents, while Mr. Rin is a construction worker. Sinkhoeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase silk material for weaving.

3-Miss Channy C., 32, is single and lives with her elderly father. She has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is 30 years old. She is married and she has 5 children. She became a fish seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 3 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

Mayasa now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in products and materials for her small beauty salon.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар  у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zamira R., 24, lives in Tursun-zade. Zamira is married with three children and has a high school education. For over five years, Zamira has been in business retailing women's clothing. She has a stall at the local market. Zamira's business helps her support her family, as her husband is away in Russia. Currently, Zamira wants to purchase more goods from wholesalers. She plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
For one year, Mwanajuma A. has been selling food and firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $360 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her shop, like rice, sugar, and firewood. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to pay her children's school fees and get more food for her family.

Mwanajuma is 36 years old, married, and has three children, aged 1, 3, and 13.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and other goods

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea P. is a 34-year-old widow who lives in Preak Ta Tean village in Kandal Province. She has a four-year-old child.  She is a grocer who runs a small store from her home. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables to earn her living. She faces a problem because she does not have bean seeds to plant.  So Mrs. Sophea P. decided to request a loan to buy bean seeds; she will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is 29 years old, married, with four children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She also wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory.

Mavis hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education. Mavis belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. Mavis does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Sakina Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is a 53-year-old widow who has resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house in this city and has been living with her family for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady. The reason she gives is that in her time people gave importance to skills than to education. "My husband died at age 45 of a heart attack. But he gave to me a very precious gift, my son, which helped me to lead a normal life or I would have totally lost my senses. My son has a business which he has run since before his father’s death. I am applying for a loan to expand my son’s poultry business by buying more chicks." She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khursheed Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Allah Rakhi Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Riaz Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Parveen Baji and Sobia Baji both want loans to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their three children. He has been familiar with agriculture since he was young. Thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from potato production. He works all day cleaning, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked cleaning his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. Yuldosh wants to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, with the aim to have the best production in his community in a few months. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier médina Koura  de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent  plusieurs  activités notamment la restauration, la vente de jus  de boissons de fabrication locale et de fruits.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son huitième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  des sacs de riz, de sucre et divers condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent en fruits dans les vergers et en condiments au marché. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans leurs gargotes où les clients en se restaurant achètent les fruits et les jus, en détail au comptant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Benkadi are all married and average 29 years of age and 3 children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Médina Koura district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another by neighborhood ties, and they work in the same fields, notably the restaurant business and selling locally-made fruit beverages.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The women plan to use this loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and various condiments. Supplies of fruit are gotten from orchards, and the condiments are gotten from the marketplace. Sales are made retail through their eateries, where customers pay cash and buy fruit and juices.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, condiments, fruit, and ingredients drinks

loans.name: Bulya Rose Group

texts.en:
Bulya R. is 30 years of age; she is married with four children, ages 11 to three years. She rents a single-roomed house and that’s where she stays with her family. Her house has neither water nor electricity. She also takes care of additional family members in her house. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is for food.

Bulya R. sells necklaces and she does her business door-to-door. She works six days a week. She gets about 20 customers a day; she mainly sells to women and she sells on a retail basis. She started her business selling vegetables but later on, changed to selling necklaces.

The main challenge she faces in her business is that since she has to walk, she gets very tired at the end of the day. She has worked with MCDT for 4 years and she has received loans for 8 years now. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it was the only institution that could lend her money without collateral. She has worked with her group for one year now. And she wants to use this loan to increase her stock.

Bulya R.'s aspiration is to expand in her business and be able to rent a room to sell her necklaces.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is involved in a whole nuts buying and selling business. She is positive that this business endeavor will give a good return since copra buying is currently stable. She is also engaged in selling okay-okay (used clothes from other nations).

Ricarda is living in Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is already a widow and all her children are married. She was recognized as a Coop member in September 2002. She is a member in good standing. She is now on her 12th loan cycle and presently requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional business capital.

She hopes that her present businesses become stable so that she can set aside enough savings for her old age, just as she is doing now.

loans.use: To buy whole coconuts for sale

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos.

La idea de un negocio propio surgio despues de que se quedo sin empleo, y la venta de tacos le parecio rentable, su padre le comento que podria poner un carrito de tacos y con la liquidacion y todos sus ahorros, comenzo comprando lo mas indispensable.

ahora ya tiene 2 años con el carrito y este se ha hido deteriorando, asi que ahora quiere pintarlo para, proyectar una mejor imagen y asi tener mayores ventas.

solicita el apoyo para la compra de pintura y otros detalles para remodelar el carrito de tacos, ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacerlo.

apoyemos el caso de esta señora, ya que estos ingresos son parte fundamental para al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Berta is married and has three children. The idea of having her own business came to her losing her job, and selling tacos seemed lucrative. Her father commented to her that she could start a taco cart by selling some things and using all her saving, and she started buying what was most needed for the business. Now she has had the cart for two years and it has already deteriorated, so she now needs to paint it to protect her image and have better sales. She is requesting the loan to purchase the paint and other items to remodel the taco cart since she does not have the sufficient funds to do it. We are support this woman's cause because the income are a fundamental part of her family's sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint and remodel taco cart

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU M. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE COMMERCEDE DETAIL DE SAVON EN POUDRE.VU LA FAIBLESSE DE SES REVENUS ELLE DESIRE ACCROITRE SON FOND DE ROULEMENT.
texts.en:
Fatou has been a member for several years. She retails detergent. In view of how little she earns, she would like to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group comprised of five borrowers, all of whom live in the province of Siem Reap. Its leader, Mrs. B. is a 46-year-old widowed mother who has two children. One of them is single and the other is married and has ready started a new family home.

At present, B. has a job as a community consultant adviser in the village. Beside her civil seven work, she also sells both food and wine to the customers who come to eat and drink at her home. From this investment, she can generate approximately $4 each day.

Since 2007, B. has been facing difficulty with transportation - she always took a taxi at the highest price. To reduce the transportation costs, B. is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that she can use it to support her business operations.

The other borrowers who have joined this loan:

Mrs. S., a staff member for a hotel, is asking for a loan to pay an electricity bill.
Mr. C. will use the loan to replace his old motorbike taxi. 
Mr. K. requests a loan in order to buy a motor to replace a broken one.
Mrs. S. will be using a loan to purchase additional fruit to better meet her customer's requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to reduce her transportation costs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 44 years old, is divorced and has three children who are currently in school. She trades in clothes: kente, lace, jewelery, women slippers and dressing bags. She normally buys her supplies on credit and pays back when the goods are sold. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to purchase clothes in bulk, slippers and dressing bags to enable her to reduce her cost to raise good income. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her shop and also support her household, especially her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, slippers and dressing bags in bulk.

loans.name: Sanatillo

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is a leading microfinance organization, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sought to transform into a microloan deposit-taking organization. Therefore, in October of 2008, MLF “MicroInvest,” together with LLC “Frontiers,” founded the limited liability company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.”

“Arvand,” being the assignee of “MicroInvest,” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

E. Sanatillo is 39 years old. He lives in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Sanatillo first applied to "MicroInvest" in 2006 for a business development loan. Thanks to the loan, he was able to buy a car and to start a business as a taxi driver. Sanatillo works as a taxi driver, and it is his general income. He applies to KIVA with the request of a business support loan of 1,000 TJS for 10 months for the purpose of car repairing. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Capital for car repairing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly K., 38, was married with his new wife, Mrs. Phanny Un, 29. He has eight children: five sons and three daughters. Five of them attend school and other three are still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ly has been driving Tuk Tuk in Phnom Penh for four years. His wife has been selling Phak Lov in front of garment factory for two years. Phak Lov is a meal that cooked with pork. He is applying for his first loan of US$300 help capital is wife to purchase chicken and pork to make Phak Lov for sale.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and pork for resale.

loans.name: Ericka Liseth

texts.es:
Ericka tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus padres en el Centro Poblado Menor Larán, en el distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un pequeño restaurante que atiende junto a su madre, este establecimiento está ubicado en la carretera Panamericana (la principal vía terrestre del país), lo que le permite atender a todo tipo de turistas y transportistas que pasan por el lugar, este negocio constituye la principal fuente de ingreso económico de la familia por lo que madre e hija se levantan todos los días muy temprano para iniciar las ventas y atender a sus clientes habituales.

Su restaurante sufrió un robo el pasado mes de Enero y desde entonces ha luchado por seguir manteniéndolo a pesar de contar con pocos productos que ofrecer, por lo que desea invertir en la compra de más bebidas e instalarle un circuito de luz eléctrica  y poder atender durante la noche, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.

Debido a que su padre ya es de edad avanzada y no puede trabajar ella desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, por otro lado desea asegurarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor por lo que piensa ofrecerles una educación de calidad. 

Ella trabajó con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado tener la responsabilidad y la capacidad suficiente para relanzar su negocio y a la vez cumplir con nuestra Institución, su puntualidad le ha permitido ser considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Ericka is a 26-year-old married mother with two children, ages 8 and 2. She lives with her husband and parents in the Menor Larán community of the Monsefú district, located 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years, she has owned a small restaurant that she and her mother run. The restaurant is located near the Panamericana highway—the country’s main road—which allows her to attend to many tourists and drivers who pass through. This business is the family’s main source of income, which is why mother and daughter get up very early every day to start serving their usual customers.

They were robbed this past January, and ever since then, they have struggled to maintain the business with what few products they offer. For this reason, she would like to invest in purchasing more beverages and installing electricity so that they can open at night. She is requesting 2,000.00 PEN from our institute in order to achieve her goals.

Because her father is elderly and can no longer work, she wishes to give him a better quality of life. Furthermore, she hopes to secure a better future for her children by providing them with a quality education.

She has previously worked with us and has demonstrated enough responsibility and aptitude to re-launch her business while fulfilling her obligations with our institute. Her punctuality qualifies her as an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette vit à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Pierrette est mère de quatre enfants. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Pierrette vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des mèches et des produits de coiffure  que Pierrette vend. C’est au Nigeria, Etat voisin du Bénin ainsi qu’à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Pierrette achète ses produits. Pierrette a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité.  Pour  continuer de développer son activité, Pierrette demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is the mother of four children.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, she comes to the aid of her husband in meeting family expenses.  Pierrette sells hair extensions and haircare products.  She purchases her products in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin, as well as in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has already had three loans with ALIDé and has repaid them.  She was able to use those loans to raise her level of business.  To continue developing her business, Pierrette is asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, wigs, and hair care products (shampoos, straighteners, ointments…)

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sabali sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 1enfant et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents  se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font  comme activité l”achat et la vente d’atiecké, de savons modernes, de médicaments, de chaussures,  de cosmétiques, d’encens, etc. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 100kg d’atiecké, 4 emballages de pommades cosmétiques, 30 paires de chaussures (talons) et 15kg des graines de (mangnon + guénin) + 5 types de parfums pour préparer de l’encens. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: C5523 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
V. Tuyambaze is married with 3 children and one dependent that the family cares for, all are aged 3 - 15 years old.  The family live in Gisenyi in the Rubavu District about 3 hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  

V. and her group own and operate a successful, popular gathering place that is licensed to serve beer, wine and spirits as well as soft drinks, juices and water along with snacks and locally prepared finger foods like samosas and boiled eggs.  V. employs 4 people in her business which has been in operation for 12 years.  She makes approximately 100,000 RWF / month from the establishment.   

This is V.'s first loan from VFC and she hopes that it will allow her to buy more inventory and a variety of products to sell to her existing customers and hopefully attract new ones.  With the expected profits, she will provide additional food for her family and set aside money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: More merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Demin Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Demin sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec en moyenne  35 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles monogames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles font  généralement la vente  des  poissons fumés et de fruits.    
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  35 kg de poissons fumés et 4 chargements de charrette en orange. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages avoisinants  KAMALEN SIRAKORO auprès des producteurs.
Elles vendent dans les  différents marchés de Sikasso ville et à domicile, au comptant à clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent emprunter plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin pour leur vente.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Demin are essentially married women who average 35 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in monogamous families in KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the villages of the Sikasso area (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women are collaborating for the first time with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  The group members generally sell fruit and smoked fish.  With their new loan, they intend to buy 35 kg of smoked fish and four cart-loads of oranges.  Supplies are gotten from neighboring villages of KAMALEN SIRAKORO from producers.  Sales are made in cash to customers composed of men and women at the different market places of Sikasso City and in homes. They each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA.  A portion of the profit will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other portion will be invested in the businesses.  Their ambition is to borrow more capital to satisfy their customers further and to be able to fix up a corner for their sales. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Mrs. Teodora C. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. Teodora owns and operates a hog-raising business, earning 2,500 PHP monthly net income. In 2004, Teodora joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 8th loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used for cocoland (coconut tree plantation) redemption. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem a parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Boris

texts.es:
Boris, trabaja como radiólogo en la clínica petrolera y  requiere el crédito para la compra de una computadora, que podrá ayudarle en el desempeño de su trabajo y algunos seminarios que realiza
Vive en la zona de tembladerani  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajar y superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Boris works as a radiologist at the oil company clinic and requests the loan to buy a computer to help him carry out his work and some seminars.

He lives in the zone of Tembladerani of the City of La Paz at his parents' house.

It is the first time he requests a loan with Impro, his desire to really want to work and improve has given him the opportunity to gain access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to prepare his work as an radiologist and seminars.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 30 years old, married and has two children. She is very resourceful and works hard so that she and her husband can pay for their children’s education and provide them with good opportunities in the future. She is a food vendor who sells cooked rice with stew, and has applied for a loan to buy bags of rice and more of the raw materials she needs to increase her production. She believes that with your support, she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Gregoria's Group

texts.en: Gregoria B. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Gregoria is from the village of Villa Nuesa. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Gregoria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Gregoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gregoria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Bacilio tiene 20 años de edad nació y creció en la comunidad de Pakai Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz.

El Sr. Basilio es soltero, muy trabajador y responsable desea muy pronto formar una familia tener hijos   

Su actividad principal es la agricultura cuenta con su propias tierras que son de su propiedad  el trabaja ya 5 años independiente de sus padres el la agricultura, el siembra maíz, yuca y poroto, para luego comercializar sus productos en el mercado de su comunidad

El señor esta agradecido con la institución por brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 20 years old. He was born in and grew up in the community of Pakai Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz. He is single, very hardworking and responsible. He wishes to have a family with children soon. His main business activity is agriculture. He has his own lands, which are his property. He has worked independently from his parents for five years already. He plants corn, yucca, and beans. He then sells his produce in the community market. He is grateful for the institution for supporting him.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise capital for work

loans.name: Jesuna's Group

texts.en: Jesuna T. is from the village of Barucboc. She is 36 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jesuna is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jesuna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Jesuna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina V. is 75 years of age. Despite her age, the woman still possesses strength and determination to change her standard of living, along with her husband, who is as old as she is. Avelina and her husband Angel are blessed with a child whom they cherished, nurtured, and loved when he was still young. Now that their child has his own family, Avelina has to think about herself and her husband so that their child will not to worry so much about them being poor but will be able to focus on growing his own family, especially in attending to the needs of his children.

Therefore, Avelina and her husband agreed to become a member of ASHI, Kiva's field partner in the Philippines, in order to have access to loans. Since joining ASHI in 2006, Avelina has taken out three loans. Those loans were managed well and enabled Avelina and her husband have a business which is their source of income.

The primary income-generating activity for Avelina and her husband is selling food such as boiled peanuts, sweetened banana and sweetened potato. They also buy and sell fresh agricultural crops in the public market of the neighboring municipalities. Being in this business for three-going-on-four years now, Aveline and her husband have gained customers from different municipalities and villages.

To increase the volume of the products they sell, and to supply the demand of their increasing number customers, Avelina is requesting a much larger loan. Through her business proceeds, she hopes to make her dreams come true and help her grandchild’s education in college, taking up nursing.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and variety of agricultural crops to sell

loans.name: Mech

texts.en: Mrs. Mech S. is a 36 year-old married woman who lives in Kor village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces a problem because her field has infertile soil and is a long way from the irrigation system. Mrs. Mech S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to get to the water she needs for her farm. Mrs. Mech S. is a widow with three children, a student in the local school and three-year twins.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La Sra. F. E.  es una profesora que trabaja en la Esc. Santa María de la Merced que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para poner el piso de su casa ya que esta recién hecha y le faltan algunos detalles.

Ella es madre soltera de 2 niños pequeños ya que los demás ya son mayores de edad y gracias a su trabajo a podido salir adelante con ellos y educarlos, además vende nacatamales los fines de semana en su casa para tener mayores ingresos.

Este es tercer  crédito que tiene con la Institución los cuales  siempre los han pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y dice estar muy agradecida por ayudarla y brindarle apoyo cuando ella necesita.
texts.en:
Ms. F. is a teacher at the “Santa María de la Merced” located in Viejo. She will use the money from this loan to install a floor in her home, which is newly built but missing a few details. She is the single mother of two small children. The others are fully grown. Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead and provide them with an education. She also sells nacatamales out of her home on the weekend for extra income. This is the third loan she has gotten through the institution and she has always been timely with her payments. She is very grateful for the assistance and support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Omran

texts.en: Omran is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with one young child. He opened a blacksmith shop in 2008 and has nine years of experience in this occupation. He is the only provider for his family, and his business is his source of income. He works hard to satisfy the needs of his baby. He has a great demand for his shop, and he wants to buy more tools in order to be able to do the work his clients request. He wants to take out a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools and enlarge his shop to meet his clients' requirements and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
El   Señor. Jorge Manuel González V., Labora como Auxiliar Contable en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: arena y cemento para  embaldosar   su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. Jorge Manuel González V., Labora como Auxiliar Contable en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua. El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: arena y cemento para embaldosar su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He has been baking and selling cakes to earn a living. He has been in this business for the past four years. He also makes artwork that he sells.

He was introduced to Kiambu Victory Group by a friend. In this group, he is able to save his money on weekly basis. The group members can also guarantee him in case he takes out a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of Kes. 50, 000 to buy an oven for baking cakes. He hopes to grow his business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an oven for baking cakes

loans.name: Wenefrida

texts.en:
Wenefrida A. is from the village of Mibantang, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Wenefrida owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Wenefrida has been involved in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Wenefrida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenefrida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional materials needed in her food stall, such as food containers and plates. Wenefrida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Wenefrida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married Lebanese man who is the father of five children. Since 1995, he has made a living raising livestock, and he is now able to produce enough milk from his cattle to sell much of it to his customers. Ali is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a cow so that he an increase his production of milk. This is his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy a cow to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 38 years old. He is married and has one child. 

He is a tailor. He will use this loan to develop his tailoring shop and to purchase a new sewing machine and cloth. He has been working in this field for ten years and has acquired a great deal of experience. Many clients pay a visit to his shop.
