He has a modern style and a good reputation in the market, so he has a good income.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machine and clothes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn J. is a married woman who lives in Poblacion Taloot, Sibonga, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: an Internet cafe, a general store, and a fishing business.Her husband Elmer J., who is 50 years old, works as a seaman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 20 to 25 years old. 

Evelyn  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to purchase another computer so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children. Evelyn J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: buying a computer

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van P. currently cultivates various crops to earn a living. She is 52 years old and a resident of Battambang province, located about 280 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She is a single mother, with seven children who are all single. Van P. also relies on the income from her daughter who mends and sews clothes in the village. Van P. wishes to have more income to ensure that her family can meet their current expenses with more stability. To achieve her goal, Van P. would like to invest in a new business of buying and selling mature rice in bulk, but she is concerned that she doesn’t have enough money yet to begin the process. Therefore, Van P. is humbly requesting a loan in order to buy 2000 kg of rice to store for a while before selling it at a profit. Mrs. Van P. was not available when the photograph was taken, so her daughter is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy 2000 kg of rice for resale.

loans.name: Blessed Hands Group

texts.en:
Kumba H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Blessed Hands'. Kumba is 40 years old, married, and has three children who range from 17 to 24 years old. She cares for one sibling. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 4 years, she has been selling slippers in Logan Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more slippers. She describes herself as determined.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more slippers

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en: Delgertsetseg S. lives with her husband and one son in their own ger (a traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son works for a construction company. Delgertsetseg's husband, Buyanjargal, receives a government retirement pension. She sells consumer goods at the biggest market in Narantuul. She started her business in 1999, purchasing various products from wholesale stores in Narantuul and reselling at retail prices. Her business earnings have enabled her to buy her own house. She plans to purchase more products to resell during the peak season for sales. Delgertsetseg works hard to grow her business and hopes to expand in the near future. She is a very modest and intelligent businesswoman who says, "All I want is to improve my household's quality of life." She is requesting a 500,000 tugrik loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man living in Lebanon. He has two young children. He is an experienced furniture carpenter. He has owned his shop for almost seven years. He works closely with some galleries in his area and also upon request of the clients. He has catalogs where the customers can choose different designs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his work. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open his own gallery shop and presents his products.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his work.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen P. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like maize flour, beans etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more current goods to sell.  Hellen is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more current goods to sell.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey G. is 25 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He is from the village of Barangay Tucal in the municipality of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya province on the Luzon islands. Jeffrey raises pigs for breeding. He has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase piglets. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan, his second from ASKI, of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice G. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alice owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alice is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the third loan that Alice has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou S. is a 51-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, in an area known for a pre-Angkorean temple. Thou raises cows and sells fish, earning a daily income of about 4 USD. Every month, Thou has to spend 50 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water, and 55 USD on other necessary expenses.

Thou is therefore requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more fish to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, Thou will use her profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Dinora tiene 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tostadas, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad, ellos le ayudan a hacer las tostadas.
Este negocio nació por el apoyo de una de sus hermanas quien siempre le ayudo a emprender dicho negocio, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, y en este momento solicita un préstamo para  la compra de plátanos, aceite, leña y gas, con esta inversión ella espera darle fortalecimiento a sus ventas, ayudándole a crecer y mejorar las condiciones económicas para el hogar.
Sueña con tener un negocio grande y producir grandes cantidades de tostadas de plátano para atender a más clientes y de esta manera desarrollar mejores oportunidades para la familia.
texts.en:
Dinorah is 46 years old and works selling tostadas. She lives with her husband and two children (18 and 12 years old) in El Tránsito, located in the department of San Miguel. They help her to make the tostadas.

The business began with the support of one of her sisters who always helped her in launching the business. She does not have a fixed work schedule and she is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of bananas, oil, firewood and gas. With this investment, she hopes to strengthen her sales, helping her to grow and improve her household financial conditions.

She dreams of having a large business and making large amounts of tostadas from banana to serve more customers and this way, create better opportunities for the family.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oil, firewood and gas

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor  Alejandro A. S. tiene 56 años de edad casado con la señora Paulina Aguayo de A.  mas de 30 años, tienen 1 hijo dependiente que no estudia por razones económicos, la familia vive sobre la carretera Cbba-Santa Cruz km 46 Comunidad Chullpani Grande hacia el sud de Colomi zona rural hace 33 años atrás, se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba y oca, tienen 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los utilizan en las faenas agrícolas, aparte la esposa realiza comercio de verduras.

El señor Alejandro A. S. y su esposa necesitan un préstamo urgente para comprar abono orgánico, forraje (avena) para su ganado y productos agroquímicos, por esta razón se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a visitar a la zona para otorgarle el crédito, finalmente el señor Alejandro nos dice que de esta forma va poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Alejandro A. S. is 56 years old and has been married to Miss Paulina Aguayo de A. for 30 years. Together they have one child economically dependent on them who cannot go to school because they cannot afford it. The family has lived on the Cbba-Santa Cruz km 46 Comunidad Chullpani Grande, towards the south of Colomi, in Zona Rural, for the past 33 years. They have a farm with potatoes, beans, and geese. They have five heads of cattle that they use to help with the farm work. As a side project, Paulina is working on a business selling vegetables. 

Alejandro and his wife urgently need a loan so they can buy organic fertilizer, fodder (i.e. oats) for their cattle and agrochemical products. For this reason, Alejandro took the initiative to go visit the area in order to get his loan granted. Finally, Alejandro tells us that in this way, he is going to be able to improve his economic revenue.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his agriculture.

loans.name: Solidario Flores De Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es:
GRUPO FLORES  D. CRUZ BLANCA
La señora Felisa P. es la representante del este Grupo D. Mujeres, ella se dedica a  la crianza D. pollos, pero también todos los días viaja para poder vender sus pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, también ella compra y revenD. estos animales,  su esposo  trabaja D. piloto D. buses y no gana mucho dinero por lo que ella cuenta que con su negocio ella ha sido un apoyo para  sus hijos por lo que  desD. muy temprano se levanta.Solicita el credito para compra y venta D. animales.   Ángela P. se dedica a la venta D. tortillas  el crédito lo necesita para poder comprar maíz y leña para su tortillería, por su parte Mercedes M. venD. ropa típica y  ella quiere aprovechar las fechas D. fin D. año que es cuando sus clientes quieren variedad D. ropa. Las tres señoras están muy contentas D. poder tener acceso a un crédito ya que les permite poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Flores D. Cruz Blanca group

Felisa P. is the representative of this Women's Group.  She raises chickens but also every day she travels to sell her chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys.  She also buys and resells these animals.  Her husband is a bus driver but doesn't earn very much money so Felisa needs her business.  She has been a support for her children so that's why she gets going very early.  She is requesting a loan to buy and sell animals.  Angela P. sells tortillas and she will use the loan to buy corn and firewood for the tortilla shop.  Mercedes M. sells typical clothing and she wants to take advantage of the time at year's end when her customers want a variety of clothes.  The three women are very happy that they have access to a loan that helps them continue working.

loans.use: To buy and sell animals.  To buy corn, firewood, and to buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
Maria Eusebia L. O. tiene 46 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria Eusebia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder remodelar la casa.

Le gusta conversar con las amigas.
texts.en:
Maria Eusebia L. O. is 46. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Maria Eusebia has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to be able to remodel her home.

She enjoys chatting with her friends.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Doeur

texts.en:
Mrs. Doeur Y. and her husband, Mr. Hean Koev, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She breeds pigs as well. They both live in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province.

They have a problem with the rice field, because the soil is infertile, it is far away from irrigation, and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production of rice, Mrs. Doeur Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and to hire farm laborers to do farming. She is raising four children, three of whom are studying in the local public school, but the youngest one is only 2 years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wood furniture to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating fish vending and fishing businesses. Her husband Jory, who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are between 1 and 28 years old. Remy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Remy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 27,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 to buy a new fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Remy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is an ambitious married woman living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She longs to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. For thirty years she has been farming and reaping tangible benefits, despite the changes in the weather pattern. Grace needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang is married to Mr. Sothy.  They have three children -- one is a student and the others are still too young to work or study.  

Mrs. Hang is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to eat.   Her husband owns an agricultural machine and rents them to farmers to earn money to support his family.  

In the rice field, Mrs. Hang has some problems because her field has infertile soil and a lot of insects.  To improve her rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.   

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan M. W. is a member of the Joyland Group in Faulu, Kenya. He sells household items to earn a living. He has been running the business for two years with two employees. He was previously working in a studio before he went into business.

Through Faulu Kenya, Allan has been trained in financial management. This has helped him to run his business smoothly for two years. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy secondhand furniture, TVs and DVDs to sell.

loans.use: To buy secondhand furniture, TVs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa B. is divorced and has five children. As the sole provider, she earns her money by making and selling kenkey. Kenkey is a favourite Ghanaian staple, made from fermented corn dough and usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. She would like to expand her business by producing more kenkey for sale. A Kiva loan will allow her to purchase more corn and oil to make a larger quantity of kenkey. She plans to reinvest into her business and, ultimately, her long-term goal is to provide her children with a university education and also to purchase a piece of land, so that she can build a home of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and oil to make a larger quantity of kenkey.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie B. works hard to support  two children. She is married and has a sari-sari store and a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Emilie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings.

Emilie is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: Andranik is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is the proud father of three children – a nine-year-old daughter and two sons (seventeen and nineteen).  For eighteen years, Andranik and his wife have been working on the family farm.  He dreams for all his children to receive a university education.  Andranik would like a loan to purchase potato seeds and livestock.  He expects the family income to increase by twelve percent with the investment.  In Haritch, Andranik is surrounded by relatives and good friends.  He is pleased that he is able to make loan payments in his village.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and livestock

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La  señora Dionisia, es  casada con el señor Manuel,  con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Ciro de veinte un años, y María Antonia de  diesi nueve años de edad.

     Ella se dedica a  la compra   y venta de ropas hechas por mantas bordadas, en lo que lleva practicando  desde hace treinta años ya que es con que es con ello  que logro sacar adelante a sus hijos  y con la bendición de Dios lo ha logrado.

     Dice  que con  su familia fue quien la enseño a bordar para  que con el tiempo se casara  tuviera una actividad en la cual dedicar su tiempo  y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.

     Su más grande deseo es que pueda seguir trabajando con su actividad y así lograr seguir apoyando sus  hijos a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Dionicia is married to Manuel and they have two children who are still in their care: 21 year-old Ciro and 19 year-old María Antonia.  

Dionicia buys and sells blankets which she embroiders.  She has been in this business for thirty years and, through her business and with God's blessing, she has managed to get her children ahead in life.

Dionicia says that it was her family who taught her how to embroider so that when she got married she would have an activity to spend her time on and through which she could support her husband with their household expenses.

Dionicia's greatest wish is to continue working in her business and continue supporting her children in getting ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy blankets to embroider and then sell in her town

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
El Señor Fabio de 25 años de edad, soltero, se dedica a la venta y reparación de artículos electrónicos llámese celulares, auto radios, etc. Logro montar su pequeño negocio gracias a la ayuda de su madre y con mucho esfuerzo está logrando conseguir buena clientela, su local está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad lo cual le ayuda a aumentar cada día su clientela por la buena ubicación.
El se considera una persona humilde pero trabajadora, cumplidora de sus responsabilidades. Sueña con poder tener mas herramientas para poder seguir trabajando.
El solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para los aparatos electrónicos, además de eso pretende comprar unas herramientas que podrán facilitarle su tarea. Cree que el credito le sera de mucha ayuda para cumplir sus expectativas.
texts.en:
Fabio, 25, is single.  He works selling and repairing electronic equipment like cell phones, automobile audio systems, etc.  He managed to set up his small business thanks to his mother and with much effort he’s managing to acquire a good customer base.  His locale is located downtown which helps him increase his number of customers every day thanks to the good location.

He considers himself to be a humble, but hard working person who keeps his commitments.  He dreams with having more tools to continue working.


He asks for the loan to buy some replacement parts for the electronic equipment and he also intends to buy some tools that will make his work easier.  He believes that the loan will be of much use to his reaching his goals.

loans.use: to buy electronics spare parts as well as some tools that will facilitate his work.

loans.name: Cinthya Marina

texts.es:
La señora Cinthya es socia del banco comunal La Positiva, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 24 Años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.  Su esposo es docente (maestro).
Recién lleva 4 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y ya tiene un negocio rentable, ella brinda servicios telefónicos, cuenta con dos cabinas telefónicas donde pueden hacer llamadas de larga distancia local, nacional e internacional.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, comprará una cabina mas, 3 banquitos de madera, comprará recargas telefónicas y 20 tarjetas telefónicas.
Cinthya y su esposo decidieron poner este negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que sus hijos demmandan otros gastos y este pequeño negoico permite cubrir algunos gastos.

Manuela Ramos brinda la ayuda necesaria para que las mujeres puedan tener sus propios negocios  y puedan brindar a sus hijos la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Cinthya is a member of the Communal Bank “La Positiva” (The Positive) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 24 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a teacher.

Cinthya has recently participated in four loan cycle with Manuela Ramos. She already has a profitable business providing telephone services. Cinthya has two phone booths where people can place local calls, as well as national and international long distance calls.

With this new loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy another phone booth, three wooden tables, rechargeable phone plans, and 20 calling cards. Cinthya and her husband decided to establish this business so that they can improve their income. Their child requires a lot of expenses and this small business allows them to cover some of them.

Manuela Ramos provides the necessary assistance to women so that they can have their own businesses and provide their children the support they need.

loans.use: to purchase another phone booth, three wooden tables, rechargeable phone plans, and 20 calling cards.

loans.name: Chynara's Group

texts.en:
Chynara is the leader of this group. She is 36 and is married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she brings up three sons and a daughter; the two older sons study at school and the other two children are preschool age (under seven). Since the collapse of the Soviet Union, Chynara has been earning money by cultivating and selling agricultural products. In this way she earns 3000 soms per month. With the profits Chynara purchased seven goats and repaired the house. With the loan she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes. In the future Chynara wishes to build a new house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and married with 6 children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Eremina

texts.en:
Eremina is 24 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Eremina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order charcoal to sell with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for building and buying a plot in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lab

texts.en: Lab, 49 years old, is selling gruel fish. Her husband is a motorbike repairer; their income is $15 per day. She has four children; three are studying and one more is working as a construction worker with $5 income per day. Every month, she has to spend $165 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy motorbike stuff for her husband's career. If her husband's career can move on well, she wants to get a shop for selling bicycles at home. For her children, she wants to support thE. to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy motorbike stuff for her husband's career.

loans.name: Juan Edwin

texts.es: El Señor Juan es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene su negocio en el mercado que existe por la zona, que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (verduras, papa, cebolla, tomate), entre otros, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos, para así abastecer mejor su negocio y a sus clientes. Su gran su gran sueño es culminar sus estudios en la universidad la carrera de Ingenieria de Alimentos que viene estudiando, y a la vez tener su local propio para implementar mejor su puesto de trabajo. El Señor Juan está muy agradecido por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is single and lives at the home of his parents. He has a business at the local market where he sells basic staples (vegetables, potatoes, onions, tomatoes) and other products.

The loan is he is requesting will be used to buy more of these products so that he can restock his business and serve his customers. His greatest wish is to finish his studies at the university where he is obtaining a degree in Food Science. He hopes to have his own location where he can better operate his business. Sr. Juan is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions in order to restock his business.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: Ángela Mercedes y María Concepción conforman el grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía. Ángela tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de dulces. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. Uno de sus desafíos es que los precios de los productos necesaR. para la elaboración de los diferentes dulces son muy caros. Pero le resulta beneficioso, para las ganancias necesarias de su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra leche, coco, dulce, azúcar, maní, entre otros.
texts.en: Ángela Mercedes and María Concepción make up the communal bank "Dios Nos Guia."  Angela is 32 years old, and she has a business making and selling sweets.  She has had this business for more than 6 years.  One of her challenges is that the products that she needs to make her various sweets are very expensive.  But her business gives her good results; it gives her the earnings she needs for her household.  This loan will be used to buy milk, cocoa, candy, sugar, peanuts and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk, cocoa, candy, sugar, peanuts and other ingredients

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Mary’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling firewood.  Mary runs her business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she operates a food stall for additional income.  Mary faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business as the demand for firewood is lower during the rainy season.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Mary wants to use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of firewood and food supplies for her food stall.  She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood to sell and food supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, a 43-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Lordjim, an overseas contract worker, and a mother of three children. She and her husband manage the household while operating the business. At this time, Julieta is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Julieta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with the group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is married and has two children. She is 49 years old, residing in Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Maridel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to make a living. She has had this business for more than 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more products to sell.
 
She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. Maridel hopes to finish the education of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima de 44 años ella trabaja como docente, desde hace varios años quiere realizar estas mejoras pero debido al poco salario que obtiene no había podido hacerlo, es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de pintura pues actualmente el precio está muy caro. Así puede seguir mejorando su vivienda día a día para sus hijos. Fátima con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su a su familia adelante y a que se superen en la vida.
texts.en: Fátima is 44 years old and works as a teacher. For several years she has wanted to do some improvements, but due to her small salary, she hasn't been able to do it. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy paint, because at present, the price is very high. In this way, she will be able to improve her home little by little for her children. With a lot of effort and hard work, Fátima has been able to get her family ahead so they can do well in life.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old and single.  He has four years of experience sells various goods like: cosmetics, African clothes, shoes etc.  He currently employs two people and his business is open from 6 am to 8.30 pm daily, except Saturday.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods to sell.  With the profits, Emmanuel would satisfy his basic needs, reinvest in his business and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: cosmetics, African clothes etc to sell.

loans.name: Tangati Women Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Tangati Women group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tangati Women group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira lives with her husband and children. She has been engaged in agriculture for already eleven years. Naira is currently renovating her house to improve her family's living conditions, and the current income she gets is not enough to cover agricultural costs. Thus Naira has applied for a loan. With the requested loan Naira plans to purchase fuel and polyethylene coating for the glasshouse. Naira will develop agriculture to insure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and polyethylene coating

loans.name: Sayidjafar

texts.ru: Сайдчафар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Уже четыре года как занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Sayidjafar lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 52 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Sayidjafar is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is 25 years of age and single with one child. 

Silia owns & operates a business baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.  Silia needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional ingredients to increase production. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Silia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Silia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Exaltacion Group

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene 28 años de edad ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ella tiene 3 hijas 2 de sus hijas estudian la primaria y otra esta pequeña no estudia, ella vende tortas y tacos de bistec, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar servilletas, bolsas, manteles de plástico, verduras, carnes, jitomates, cebolla, queso chiles, mayonesa, pepinos,  rábanos, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, era de su mama y se lo dejo, su negocio es importante porque tiene un ingreso extra, ella se siente orgullosa de vender y que ya no le da pena vender y se sabe valer por ella misma, ella saca su puesto los sábados y domingos sus clientes son los turistas ya que su comunidad es un lugar bonito hay artesanías y elaboran el barro hacen ollas, cazuelas y adornos de barro, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar cosas para su casa y para comprarles a sus hijas zapatos y ropa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir ampliando su negocio hasta donde ella pueda, que sus hijas sigan estudiando de su negocio lo puede lograr aprovechar, ahorrar y no mal gastar. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad "gracias por sus prestamos, por confiar en nosotros y lo vamos a aprovechar para crecer los negocios, para el futuro de la familia y no les vamos a defraudar, muchas gracias".
texts.en:
Señora Elizabeth is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and she has 3 daughters. Two of her daughters are in primary school and the other is small and doesn’t go to school. Elizabeth sells steak sandwiches and tacos. She is requesting a loan to buy napkins, bags, plastic tablecloths, vegetables, meat, tomatoes, onions, cheese, mayonnaise, cucumbers and radishes. She started her business 2 years ago. It was her mother’s and she left it to her. Her business is important because it provides extra income. She is proud of selling, that it comes easier now and that she can look after herself. She takes her stall out on Saturdays and Sundays. Her customers are tourists as her community is a beautiful place, where clay is produced and pots, casserole dishes and ornaments are made out of clay. She uses her profits to buy things for her house and to buy clothes and shoes for her daughters. Her hopes and dreams are to continue expanding her business as much as she can, that her daughters continue studying and that she will make the most of her business, save and spend wisely.

The members of the group would like to say the following to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you for the loans,  and for trusting us. We are going to make the most of the loans in order to grow our businesses for the future of our families and we will not disappoint you. Thank you very much”.

loans.use: to buy napkins, bags, plastic tablecloths, vegetables, meat, tomatoes, onions, cheese, mayonnaise, cucumbers and radishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Salome started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kianjai, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, banana, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart; every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a better time milking her cow and also feeding. 

A modern dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Salome believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Salome waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Digna Maria

texts.en:
Mi nombre es Digna H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para la produccion de las mismas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi puesto de venta esta ubicado en una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y venta de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia y darle un estudio mejor a mi hija que esta por ingresar a la universidad.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

My name is Digna H.. I work in the production and sales of tortillas. I´ve had my business for 4 years. I have lots of good clients since my tortilla stand is located in a bus station. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my production and sales of tortillas and with the earnings that I obtain to be able to support my family and give a better education to my daughter who will be enrolling in the university.

loans.use:
Compra de Harina de Maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Purchase of corn flour, salt, lime, water, firewood, matches and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes Wanjiru intends to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.en:
Hello my name is Maria Consuelo, my primary activity is commerce. For several years I have run a grocery store situated in the center of my community. This provides my family with extra income, which thankfully has increased our standard of living.

Hola Mi nombre es Maria Consuelo, mi actividad principal es el Comercio, cuento con un negocio de pulperia, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente gracias hemos mejorado los ingresos familiares, ofreciendo un mejor nivel de vida a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, butter, soap, dairy, sodas, coffee, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
Jesus is a very responsable man. He is originally from Creel, Chihuahua, north of Mexico. He is divorced and he has full custody of his 3 children who are his main reason and motivation to work hard every day. He has a truck that he uses to transport wood. His great customer service has helped him in getting more clients and making his business grow.

Fortunately, he has already schedule many trips, but he needs to repair his truck in order to avoid any type of accidents. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD. He commits to repay this amount in 2 months. Today you can help someone who trully needs it. This family appreciates your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús es un hombre muy responsable, originario de la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua, al norte de México, es divorciado y tiene a su cuidado a sus tres hijos, los cuales son el motivo por el que sale a trabajar y a esforzarse más cada día. Tiene un camión en el que se dedica a transportar madera, el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a incrementar sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente tiene muchos viajes programados por hacer pero le hace falta comprar refacciones para reparar su camión y evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera presentarse por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en solo 2 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, esta familia agradece mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
I am a mother of five and I have been living in Vehari for the last four years, in the heart of Punjab, Pakistan's most populated province. My eldest daughter is a teacher and one of my sons works in the local market --- the others are in school. I would like them to complete their education and have promising careers.

My husband runs a canteen in a local hospital in Vehari. He has been in this business for the past four years. He pays a lot of money to rent the canteen and purchase the stock on credit. Both expenses have reduced our profits. My husband wants to expand his business and requires cash to purchase more stock for his canteen store. For this purpose, we need a loan. I would be extremely grateful if you could help us out.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a school canteen

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang S. has been farming cornish hens for a while. In the beginning she only has several chickens in the farm. Those chickens were allowed to roam around and seek their own food. Feeding is only done once a day, in the morning. She couldn't make enough money by just selling eggs. After joining DINARI Foundation, Komang S. obtained funding and training assistance on proper chicken farming techniques. Ni Komang is trying to apply her learning. The loan she obtains will be used to repair and expand the pen, so she can farm more chicken and feed more. At this time she has 50 egg producing hens and 5 roosters. She spends about $1.70 for feeds that consists of rice, corn and concentrate. She earns $4.44 a day by selling eggs. She may earn net profit of 2.75 per day. From this profit, Ni Komang S. can supplement income from her husband, Gusti Ketut Sumantri, and pay her 2 children's tuition. She plans to buy more chicken so she may increase her profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang S. sudah terbiasa dengan memelihara ayam kampung. Semula hanya memelihara beberapa ekor saja. Ayam-ayam tersebut dibiarkan hidup bebas untuk mencari makan sendiri. Pemberian pakan hanya diberikan waktu pagi hari saja. Hasil telurnya pun masih belum maksimal. Dengan bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI Ni Komang S. mendapat bantuan dana dan pembinaan budidaya ternak ayam secara baik. Ni Komang S. mencoba menerapkan apa yang sudah didapatkan dalam pembinaan dari Yayasan DINARI. Dengan dana tersebut kandang mulai diperbaiki dan diperbesar lagi, jumlah ayam diperbanyak , pemberian pakan pun dilakukan secara teratur. Saat ini jumlah ayam petelur sudah mencapai 50 ekor dan ayam pejantan 5 ekor. Biaya pakan dalam sehari mencapai Rp.15.000,-. Pakan ayam terdiri dedak padi, jagung dan konsetrat. Hasil penjulan telur dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 40.000,- Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp. 25.000,-. Dari keuntungan inilah Ni Komang S. dapat membantu penghasilan suaminya, Gusti Ketut Sumantri, dan dapat membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya. Rencana kedepannya akan memperbanyak jumlah ayam peliharaanya, sehingga keuntungan dapat lebih meningkat lagi.

loans.use: Purchase Chicks to be Grown

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 47 year old mother of four children. Fatima is a very serious and committed microentrepreneur.  She lives in South Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Fatima works with her husband cooking falafel, chickpeas and beans. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy a new chickpea processor and provisions for the business. This is the sixth time Fatima is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy a chickpeas, a processor and provisions

loans.name: Kazinga C (Ii) Group

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and married with four children. Her current business is cultivation (farming). She grows various crops and vegetables which include tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, cassava and matooke. With the extra business profits, Mary intends to rent more land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Elia María

texts.en:
Elia María is a multi-faceted and successful entrepreneur.  She lives with her three sons in Altagracia community of Santo Domingo.  Elia María sells an assortment of coco candies in her sister-in-law’s restaurant.  In the afternoon, she visits her friends and other neighbors to offer shirts, pants and shoes. She explains that she has to work hard in order to support her children’s studies and cover the household expenses.
She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy clothing in bulk to sell.  She will invest a small part of the money in the purchase of raw materials to produce her candies.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk and other goods for another small business.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Makoma Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Grace is 31 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 1500 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Grace is joined in her small group by Nalongo O., Salimati N., Jane A., and Jennifer T.. Nalongo O. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock. Salimati N. is currently operating a business in mat weaving and selling and wants a loan to expand business. Jane A. operates a business selling mats and wants to add to her business. Jennifer T. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more commodities.

loans.use: To re-stock her shop with more commodities

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra have belonged to the Community Bank of Love and Truth for two years, eight months, and eight years respectively.

Silvia is twenty-nine years old and married with two children. She works as an artisan with a loom, completing jobs such as making blankets in different sizes which she sells in the market F. Vivanco. Silvia and her husband also go to fairs where they sell agrochemicals, chemicals that improve the production of crops.

On the other hand, Eva is 35 years old, in a long-term relationship, and has three children. With her partner she has a workshop where they make wool “buzos,” baby clothes that cover the whole body and close with a central zipper. Eva and her partner sell their handiwork in different fairs in the Ayacucho region. Eva also sells assorted fabrics at the fairs.

Alejandra is 60 years old, married, and has 10 children, five of which live with her. She is a walking vendor who sells meat at the Nery Garcia market.

Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra need loans of 450 soles (approx. $167 US), 1250 soles (approx. $463 US), and 1000 soles (approx. $370 US) respectively. They will use the money to buy yarn, dye, wool, padlocks, batteries, sheep, and hogs.

The dreams of Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra are to improve their businesses, to increase their capital, and to see their children become skilled professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alyssa Sanow, Anna Bevington, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers

Silvia, Eva y Alejandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 2 años, 8 meses, 8 años, respectivamente.

Silvia es casada, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Silvia es artesana, realiza trabajos en telar como frazadas en diferentes tamaños y lo venD. en el mercado F. Vivanco. Además Silvia junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias donD. venden agroquímicos.

Por otro lado Eva es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Eva junto a su esposo tienen un taller donD. confeccionan buzos D. lana y los venden en las diferentes ferias D. la región D. Ayacucho. Además Eva venD. mercerías en las ferias.

Mientras que Alejandra es casada, tiene 60 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 5 viven con ella, Alejandra venD. carne en el mercado Nery García D. manera ambulatoria.

Silvia, Eva y Alejandra necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 1250 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. hilo, tinte, lana, candado, pila, carnero y cerdo.

Los sueños D. Silvia, Eva y Alejandra son mejorar sus negocios, tener más capital y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra need loans of 450 soles (approx. $167 US), 1250 soles (approx. $463 US), and 1000 soles (approx. $370 US) respectively. They will use the money to buy yarn, dye, wool, padlocks, batteries, sheep, and hogs.

loans.name: Osarumwense

texts.en: Osarumwense O. is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, and she has been in the business of selling cooked food and drinks for 4 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for 4 years. Osarumwese is an energetic woman. Her business requires human energy and financial support. Her numerous customers are increasing day by day because she cooks well. She needs a loan of $450 to buy foodstuffs and a generator to enable her cool the drinks for her customers, as an alterative to when the power supply fails.

loans.use: To buy a generator and foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is very grateful to Kiva for the last loan of $3,050. She was able to purchase enough palm oil and caustic soda for continuous production. With the income, she assisted her husband to complete construction of the family house and established a grocery shop. Because she can purchase sufficient materials for soap making, she hired more youth and trained them in soap making and earned income from the training. She is thankful to all her lenders who have improved her soap-making business, and she has become one of the major soap wholesalers in Kabala town and the surrounding villages. Musu is requesting more loans to purchase palm oil and store it for use during the off season. This will enable Musu to continue production. She needs Le. 3,426,000.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil for soap production during the off season

loans.name: Gulnoro

texts.ru:
Gulnoro V. lives in a village of the Rudaki district, Tajikistan called Dzui Bodom. She works as a nurse in a hospital. Her salary is not very large. There was a very happy event that has just recently occurred in her family - her granddaughter was born, which is why she wants to buy a cow. This will give her the opportunity to feed her granddaughter fresh milk. But to be able to buy the cow, she needs a loan that she plans on repaying within 12 months. Gulnoro is married and has 4 children.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Вазирова Гулноро проживает в районе Рудаки в поселке Джуи Бодом. Работает медсестрой в роддоме. Получает небольшую заработную плату. Сейчас в ее семье произошло радостное событие . У нее родилась внучкав и поэтому Гулноро хочет купить корову. Это даст возможность кормить младенца свежим молоком. Но для того , чтобы купить корову ей необходимо получить кредит, сроком на 12 месяцев. Гулноро замужем и имеет четверых детй.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Hija

texts.en:
Hija is 32 years old. She is married and she has 5 children. She became a fish seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business.

Hija now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han C., 46, is an entrepreneur who buys cloth from the garment factory and makes it into gloves to sell to the store near the market to earn approximately $2 of profit per day. She is aided by her children who work as garment workers as well. Her husband, Chan Mony, 49, operates a motor-taxi business and is able to make $5 of profit per day. This couple told a loan officer that they spend around $70 on food and $5 on utilities. Mrs. Han would like a loan  to purchase more cloth to make gloves and also to start a new business to double the family income. She wants to purchase used clothes to sell in front of the garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es agricultor, todas las mañanas sale muy alegremente con su burrito hacia sus terrenos de cultivo, donde pasa el mayor tiempo posible, cuidando y abonando sus plantas de papa y maíz.Como padre, no deja de responsabilizarse por el cuidado de sus hijos, quienes requieren de su apoyo, no tan solo en lo económico, sino en lo afectivo, y a pesar de su recargada labor trata de dedicarles un tiempo para pasar junto a ellos.Don Jorge tiene pensado incrementar su producción, para ello solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles, para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, indispensables para sus cultivos.Si usted esta en la capacidad de ayudarlo, él estará sumamente agradecido y lo retribuirá con su pago puntual y su trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer. Every day he leaves happily with his donkey toward his crops, where he spends as much time as possible taking care of, and fertilizing his potato and corn crops. As a father, he knows he's reponsible for the care of his children who need his support not only economically, but also affectionately. Despite his work overload, he tries to dedicate some time to be with his children. Jorge wants to increase production and is asking for a loan of 1500 soles ($1US = 3 soles, approx.) for fertilizers, necessary for his crops. If you are in a position to help him, he'll be very grateful and pay back the loan punctually and work constantly.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Yayo's Group

texts.en:
Yayo B. has been selling charcoal and firewood in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business and so that she can open a small cosmetics shop. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Yayo is 34 years old, married, and has 8 children, aged 4, 9, 12, 14, 15, 16, 18, and 19. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Siti, Asia, Zainab, Maryam, and Zena. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Davlatkhuja

texts.en:
D. Davlatkhuja is 37 years old and is married with two children. Davlatkhuja is a market vendor. He has been selling fruits for the past three years. 

During these years, Davlatkhuja has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits to maintain their marketable conditions and to not lose the taste and their useful properties. He sells fruits such as: apples, pears and pomegranates in the central, local market. 

Davlatkhuja begins his workday early morning - at 5:00 a.m. Buying vegetables and fruits from the local farmers, he sells them at the market. In the market, he is well-known because of his attractive prices and friendly customer service feature. All this allows Davlatkhuja’s business to generate a stable and considerable income stream for his family. 

Due to the current season, Davlatkhuja’s goods are in high demand. For this reason, he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits to sell. Today, he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 US Dollars) that will allow him to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months and thanks everyone for supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell during the high-demand season

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, en la capital de Managua estado civil soltero, sus hijos son independientes. Sus planes para el futuro es terminar la construcción de su casa y comprar otro vehículo para trabajarlo. Don Pablo se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de perecedero como chiltoma, tomate, ayote entre otras verduras  y además es proveedor de una empresa privada desde hace quince años tiene su negocio, lo inicio con préstamos de micro financieras. Sus objetivos a corto plazo para su negocio es la expansión a nuevos canales de comercialización de su producto. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograr la comprar de producto para ampliarle y extenderse a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Pablo is 50 years old, living in the North Laureles neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is single; his sons are grown. His plans for the future are to finish building his house and buy another vehicle for work. Pablo has a small business of selling perishable goods such as sweet peppers, tomatoes, ayote and other vegetables. He is also a supplier for a private company. He has had his business for 15 years, which he started with microfinance loans. His short-term goal for his business is to market his products to new audiences. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy products to expand his business and reach out to other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and other products to expand the business

loans.name: Naseem M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 32 year old married woman and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan is famous for its many shrines and handmade things and Naseem baji feels lucky to live in this city. Due to her family’s low financial resources, Naseem was not able to receive an education. Her husband's name is M. J. who makes and sells steel bangles for a living. He learned this art from his father who had 40 years of experience and has become an expert in this work. Naseem baji has five children: four daughters and one son. Their two oldest daughters learned the family trade and began making bangles for sale on their own. The other kids are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education. Naseem baji has successfully repaid her two prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy steel rods and tools to expand her family business.

Naseem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Naseem baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap plastic bottles and waste papers for her scrap business. Nazia baji and Shabana baji each are requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Kalsoom mai baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business. Kosar baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy steel rods and tools for making bangles

loans.name: George

texts.en: George K. sells agricultural chemicals at the Amoabin lorry park near Cape Coast. George has completed an education up to the junior high level. He is now married and has five dependants. His wife is a trader. George has been selling agricultural chemicals for about two years now. He is responsible for supporting his wife in paying the rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. George's loan will be used to increase his capital to enable him to increase the quantities of agricultural chemicals he sells. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest in the expansion of his trade in agricultural chemicals.

loans.use: To increase his capital to enable him increase the quantities of agricultural chemicals he sells

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie G. runs a hog raising business in her village of Sitio Anguapan.  With the assistance of her husband, Dominador, who is a farmer, she has been able to maintain the business for a year already.  

Elvie is already 34 years old and has been blessed with three children: Rachel - 10 years old, Rebecca - 8 years old, and the youngest child, Ruth - 6 years old who are all in their primary level of education in Barangay Sto. Nińo, 2-3 kilometers away from the town proper.

After raising a pig for 4 months, Elvie then butchers the animal and sells the meat in kilos at retail price.  Elvie has observed that her business strategy is good, so she plans to add at least one or two piglets to raise.  To fulfill this, she needs to borrow PHP6,000. 

Her business helps her a lot in sending her children to school and in providing for their needs at home including financial assistance for their farm.  As such, she really wants to maintain the business for sustainability. 

Elvie is looking forward for the success of her business in the future and, if that happens, she will no longer have problems in sending her children to school, for there will be enough assistance coming from her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en: Vitaliy is a single man who has been selling fishing supplies at the central market in Nikopol for the last five years. There is high demand for his goods and low competition in this area of business. Vitaliy enjoys selling his goods and serving his customers. He is a responsible and honest man, whose customers speak well of him. Spring is the high season for fishing and Vitaliy would like to offer a larger variety of stock to his customers. He would therefore like a loan of 13000 UAH to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Mrs. Loreta A. is 45 years old, is married, and is a resident of Punta Sulong Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She has four children. The couple engage in fishpond fishing as their source of income.

She was one of the active members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative under the micro-finance program called PDP-LP at their Barangay. She was recognized by the co-op in July 2005 and has availed herself six times of the credit service offered by the program. Now she has applied for an amount of Php 14,900.00, to be used to pay for labor in repairing and cultivating an extension of the fishpond.

Before Loreta became a member of Paglaum, her family suffered financially. Their only source of living comes from fishing, and earnings are unpredictable because they use only a fishing net. After having accessed the credit services as a Paglaum member, Loreta reports significant financial improvements in her family’s well-being. She is grateful for the help she has received from Paglaum because it has contributed so much to her family.

The couple is hoping that they will always experience a good and abundant harvest and that all of their children can eventually finish a college course.

loans.use: Repair and extension of fishpond.

loans.name: Xz's Group

texts.en: sadasdadsasd

loans.use: as

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: MR moussa D. est un maitre coranique qui habite aux parcelles assainies de thies;il est marié et est père de trois enfants;avec l'approche de l'hivernage ,il veut terminer les travaux de constrution qu'il a entamé chez lui c'est pour satisfaire ce besoin qu'il a sollicité ce pret
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D. lives in Parcelles Assainies district in Thies and teaches the Koran. He is married and the father of three children. With the approach of the rainy season, he wants to finish doing the construction that he has begun at home. This is why he is asking for this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Senor in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 56 years old. Evangeline is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Evangeline grows and sells corn. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to purchase seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise, and to pay for services rendered to increase yield.

Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP that she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Evangeline's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Daniel Ezequiel N. de 34 anos de idade, nasceu na provincia de Sofala, cidade da Beira (centro dos pais a 1.200km de Maputo), casado e pai de dois filhos menores de idade escolar.
Concluiu a formação media de docência e encontra se a trabalhar neste distrito a mais de oito anos. Sustenta seus pais que ficaram na província de origem, enviando lhes dinheiro. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 5.100,00MT.

Chegou a boane a procura de emprego na cidade de maputo e já vive em casa própria com sua esposa.

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 15.00,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. Os primeiros créditos foram de 10.000,00MT; e 7.000,00MT, respectivamente. Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos.

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para no futuro mais breve concluir a sua casa e construir um centro de negócios.
texts.en:
Daniel Ezequiel N. is 34 years old and was born in the province of Sofala, in Beira, a city in the middle of the country,1200 km from Maputo. He is married and has two young children of school age. He is trained as a teacher and has been working in the district for more than eight years. He supports his parents, who still live in their home province, by sending them money. He earns a monthly salary of 5100 MT. He arrived in Boane looking for work in Maputo, and now lives in his own home with his wife. This is his third loan, in the amount of 15,000 MT, which he will use to purchase construction materials. His first loans were 10,000 MT and 7000 MT respectively. He learned about Hluvuku through friends and has never had loans through other banks. He intends to pay off his loan in accordance with the loan schedule, and in the near future to be able to finish his house and build a commercial center.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Hursandi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хурсанди  – мужчина, который занимается продажей оргтехники. Свои товары он покупает с Оптового рынка «Корвон».  Для увеличения товарооборота он хочет получить повторный кредит. Хурсанди заметил, что с периода первого займа у него увеличился оборотный капитал и прибыль.
texts.en:
