Hursandi is a man, who sells office equipment. He buys his merchandise at the Korvon wholesale market. He wants to obtain another loan in order to increase his goods turnover. Hursandi noticed that his working capital and profit increased since the time of his first loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a pub

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en: A most admirable struggling woman from the far-away village of Pursat province, Cambodia, S. is a 60-year-old widow who lives in a house 12 poles tall with hundreds of thin red bricks as the roof, strong wooden sides as the the walls, and strong wooden stairs. She is a local farmer who has spent almost her whole life in the field, though she seems too old, she is a woman who can manage. The members of her house always appreciate and help her work. She can hire her neighbors to plow her field and grow the rice for a cheap and suitable fee. Recently, S. is requesting a loan of $100 to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kaindi

texts.en:
Kaindi is a 35-year-old mother of two children. She operates a grocery business in Nairobi, and has requested her first loan of 20,000 KES in order to start the same business in another location. She plans to purchase a pick-up truck in two years for transporting and supplying onions and tomatoes. Kaindi hopes to educate her children and have a good and comfortable life. She describes herself as faithful, obedient, polite and loving.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To set up another grocery business

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Z. Parviz is 28 years old. He is married but has no children yet. Parviz is a jack of all trades in the sphere of construction and repair. He is working as a foreman in the team providing the services on minor and major repair of the houses and apartments. At the same time he is a very good carpenter. Parviz is dreaming to have many children and to build the house for each of them. Knowing all this Parviz is working really hard in order to make the business successful and generating the stable incomes for his large family. Now he is planning to purchase the construction equipment. Being loaned for the first time Parviz promises to work harder thus to be able to repay the loan in time.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the construction equipment.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Jesusa Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tupac Amaru, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y su hijo.
La señora Jesusa es comerciante de frutas en un puesto de venta y su esposo trabaja como conductor en el transporte urbano de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina y la instalación de gas domiciliario.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.

loans.use: Costo de construcción de una cocina en su casa y costo de instalación de gas a domicilio.

loans.name: Cica Bernadette

texts.fr: G. Cica Bernadette est née en 1959 à Allada dans le Département de l’Atlantique. Cica Bernadette est mariée à ALALE Julien. Cica Bernadette et Julien ont huit enfants dont sept sont encore à leur charge. Tous les enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont. La famille vit à Dowa à Porto-Novo. Cica Bernadette et Julien assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Cica Bernadette vend au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo : des tissus, des chaussures, des glacières et des bols. C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin que Cica Bernadette va s’approvisionner en ces différents articles. Cica Bernadette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Cica Bernadette sollicite ce troisième crédit pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
G. Cica Bernadette was born in 1959 in Allada in Atlantique County. She is married to ALALE Julien. Cica Bernadette and Julien have eight children, of whom seven are still in their care. All the school-aged children are in school. The family lives in Dowa in Porto-Novo. She and Julien together ensure that family expenses are covered. At the Ouando market, Cica Bernadette sells cloth, shoes, insulated containers, and bowls. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, is where she goes to stock up on these different items. She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. She is requesting this third loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and handbags

loans.name: Gloria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Alejandra D. L. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos que ya son adolescentes. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar un equipo D. cómputo, para que sus hijos puedan hacer la tarea, sin salir D. la casa ya que tiene miedo que les pueda pasar algo y si ella pueD. estar al pendiente D. ellos. 
Doña Gloria Alejandra trabaja cuidando una persona ya mayor D. edad, por las mañana y así esta al pendiente D. sus niños. Este es el ingreso que tiene, para darles lo mejor a sus hijos y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.  Ya a tenido un préstamo con FVP al cual lo pago puntual mente, es por eso que nueva mente nos esta solicitando este crédito para que sus hijos tengan una buena herramienta estudiar y salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Gloria Alejandra is a single mother and is responsible for three children who are now teenagers. She is requesting this loan to buy computer equipment so that her kids can do their homework without having to leave the house because she is afraid that something might happen to them and she wants to be able to keep an eye on them.

Gloria Alejandra works caring for an elderly lady in the morning, and looks out for her children this way. She uses this income to give the best to her children and she will use it to pay back the loan. She has already had one loan from FVP which she paid back punctually. She is requesting a new loan from us so that her children will have a good tool for studying and can advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for her children

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian A. is from Pagadian City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lillian owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lillian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Lillian is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Tukwatire Wamu Twaha Zaina Group

texts.en:
Zaina T. is thirty years old, married with five children, four of whom are schooling. She is a creative business woman who designs table mats and floor mats. She  has been doing this for over four years. She will use the loan to add materials for table mats, floor mats, etc for sale. Zaina is a hardworking business lady who is working very hard to obtain enough savings so that she can stand on her own.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To add materials for table mats, floor mats, etc for sale.

loans.name: Mayema Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Mayema' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and in quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school-going children in terms of feeding and clothing them and meeting school expenses.

Alie K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Alie was born in a place called Makuri, in northern Sierra Leone. He is approximately fifty-two years of age, married to three wives and with twelve children. Alie is a carpenter; he has been in this profession for three years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy boards, polish, nails, locks, and other working material.

loans.use: Buy boards, polish, nails, locks, and other working materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is from the town of Gud, San Isidro. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Esther owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a week. In 2009, Esther joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is single. She lives in Berdyansk. Natalya sells children’s clothing in one of the biggest markets of her hometown. She offers trendy merchandise at affordable prices, which has always been main attraction for her customers. Natalya has been in this business for eight years. Currently, she has 20,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,500 Grivnyas.  

Natalya is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise at wholesale prices for further retail sale in her kiosk. Natalya can be characterized as a hard-working entrepreneur with a clear vision and integrity. She is talented and knowledgeable in business management. We believe Natalya’s business will benefit from her current loan and will continue growing in the future.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita J. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, a widow, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Amecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang Y., age 59, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of approximately $0.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1979. 

Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of $4 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Y.’s husband began this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand his business. Y. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike with a compartment attached for her husband to start a new a business as a tuk-tuk driver. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (Y. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike with a compartment attached (tuk tuk)

loans.name: Rizo

texts.ru: Назаров Ризо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ризо имеет среднее образование. Более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает топливо. Закупает топливо и продает в районах по выгодной ему цене. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Rizo N. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 46 years, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Rizo has a secondary education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 15 years. He mainly sells fuel. Rizo buys the fuel and sells it in the districts at more profitable prices. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover. He wants to expand his business and improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria de 49 años, vive en su casa propia  al lado de su esposo Máximo (47) y sus hijas Mónica (28) y Erika (17).Se dedica a la venta de comida en su carrito salchipapero (especial para freír), trabaja durante las noches y durante las mañanas también vende comida en su restaurante, que  esta ubicado en su  casa. Hilaria se dedica 7 años a este rubro, y su sazón atrae el gusto de muchos comensales a diario. Siempre le ha gustado cocinar pues aprendió desde muy joven todos lo secretos para la preparación de las diferentes comidas, por eso esta muy orgullosa por lo logrado ya que cuando comenzó no tenía nada, y poco a poco fue mejorando  su negocio. Hilaria se esfuerza mucho por progresar  cada día y en el futuro tiene planeado instalar un  restaurante bien equipado y cómodo para el bienestar de su clientela.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Hilaria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  arroz y  azúcar, al por mayor, también contratara personal para la refacción  de algunos espacios de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Maximo, who is 47 and her daughters Monica (28) and Erika (17). She works selling sausages and fried potatoes from a food cart at night. In the mornings she sells food from her restaurant, which is located in her home. Hilaria has worked in this area for 7 years and her special seasoning attracts many customers daily. She has always enjoyed cooking and learned from a very young age all the secrets of preparing different foods. For this reason she is very proud to have achieved this, when she started from nothing and little by little she improved her business. Hilaria makes an effort to progress every day and in the future she has plans to install a well-equipped and comfortable restaurant for the well-being of her customers. This is the second loan she has applied for and she is very grateful to all the people that have made it possible to obtain credit to permit her to continue working. Hilaria has plans to invest the money in the purchase of rice and sugar wholesale and also to recruit staff for the refurbishment of some areas in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory and make improvements to the place of business

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio G. tiene un taller en donde elabora todo tipo de Sandalias, el tiene tres hijos menores que están en edad escolar y su esposa, el les provee con la ganancia de su negocio el sustento diario a su familia. Él se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para la compra de tiras de baquetas que es el material con el que elabora sus sandalias y así suplir las necesidades que tienen sus clientes y poder tener un poco más de utilidades y darle un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia, además de que con la ganancia del primer crédito le hizo mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
El señor Oscar Antonio G. tiene un taller en donde elabora todo tipo de Sandalias, el tiene tres hijos menores que están en edad escolar y su esposa, el les provee con la ganancia de su negocio el sustento diario a su familia. Él se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para la compra de tiras de baquetas que es el material con el que elabora sus sandalias y así suplir las necesidades que tienen sus clientes y poder tener un poco más de utilidades y darle un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia, además de que con la ganancia del primer crédito le hizo mejoras a su casa.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de tiras de baquetas.

loans.name: Yamilet Del Socorro

texts.es:
La   Señora. Yamileth del Socorro López López, Labora como Asistente de Recursos Humanos en el  Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán  CECNA.
Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos ya que piensa cambiar el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación ya que los cables se encuentran en mal estado y esto puede ocasionar algún incendio en la vivienda.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
La Señora. Yamileth del Socorro López López, Labora como Asistente de Recursos Humanos en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA. Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos ya que piensa cambiar el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación ya que los cables se encuentran en mal estado y esto puede ocasionar algún incendio en la vivienda. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Eugenio,  él  tiene 60 años de edad es casado y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales el último tiene 13 años de edad, Nuestro socio sigue al cuidado permanente de sus tierras de cultivo, él socio tiene terrenos de cultivo de papa y en la época de heladas las deshidrata naturalmente para hacer chuño, que es un plato típico acompañado con queso fundido; Nuestros socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes de Cusco y llevarlos a su tierra que se encuentra a 4 horas y 40 minutos desde Cusco y el servicio de transporte hacia esta comunidad no es fluido por lo que el debe esperar los fines de semana para movilizarse.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate district, in the Quispicanchis province of the department of Cusco. Our member's name is Mr. Eugenio. He is 60 and married with seven children, the youngest of whom is 13 years old. He works year-round in the cultivation of his farmlands, where he grows crops of potatoes. During the winter, he dehydrates the potatoes using a natural process in order to make potato flour, a typical dish that is served with melted cheese. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers in Cusco to transport back to his farmlands, which are located 4 hours and 40 minutes away. The transport service between the two isn't frequent, so he has to wait for the weekends to make the trips. Eugenio is thankful and appreciative of the support offered through this medium and he is committed to achieving timely repayment of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in Cusco and transport them to his farmlands.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year old married man from Lebanon with a family of four. For 12 years, he has been working as a blacksmith. Since 2007, he's rented a workshop where he's actively refined his skills in many kinds of metalwork including making furniture. He is proud of his competitive prices, honesty, experience, strong reputation, and high quality products. He notes that it has been a challenge to enter the market and to advertise effectively.

He is requesting a loan of US $1000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase more iron for his business. In the future, he hopes to open his own metal factory.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50 year old married woman from Lebanon, living with her three children, who help and support her. For the past 20 years she has been working in the sales of provisions.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Alberto Afonso

texts.pt:
Alberto Afonso M. vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu canalizar para o que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra está neste momento na sua fase conclusiva, faltando apenas concluir o seu muro de vedação. Na sua vida social algo mudou para melhor e ainda teve mais 2 netos no seio da família. O presente empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros) para concluir o murro de vedação da sua casa. 
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo alcançar o objectivo que preconizou. Pretende solicitar mais crédito para outros projectos no futuro.
texts.en:
Alberto Afonso lives in Boane, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. He has been able to channel his last loan to its goal and it has been enough to fulfill it. He was able to pay his loan according to the established timeline. His construction is now in its final stage, only the bordering wall is missing for its conclusion. In his social life something has changed for the best and he has also welcomed 2 grandchildren to his family. The current loan, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, is intended to be used to buy construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others) to complete the bordering wall of his house. He is very pleased with the loan, he is managing to achieve his intended goal. In the future, he intends to request more loans for other projects.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others)

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak L., 59, is married and resides with his wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated area in the country. L. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 12 per day. His wife sells porridge for an income of USD 9 per day.

L. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to operate his business efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel P. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Raquel is married and has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, este distrito es uno de los principales productores de fruta en el norte del país, las frutas que produce suelen ser exportadas a diversos países den extranjero. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra situado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. El tiene algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno que le proveen diariamente de leche, la cual comercializa entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña extensión de terreno de cultivo en donde siembra mango y limón, las futas que suele cosechar las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran instaladas en la zona. Con estas actividades el se encarga de asumir los gastos económicos de su familia.

José desea mejorar la alimentación de sus vacas para que produzcan mas leche, de este modo el puede incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, además también desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y mejorar la producción de este. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es una persona responsable, trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
José is a 48-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in a settlement of the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This district is one of the main fruit-producing areas in the north of the country. The fruits it produces are mainly exported to a range of foreign countries. It belongs to Piura province in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. José has worked in the field of agriculture since he was young. He has some cows which provide him with milk each day, which he sells to his neighbors. In addition, he has a small plot of farmland where he grows mangos and limes. When the fruit is harvested, he offers it for sale to the processing plants located in the area. With these activities, he is responsible for covering the expenses of his family. José would like to improve the nutrition of his cows so that they will produce more milk. In this way, he will be able to increase his sales and his earnings. In addition, he would like to buy some fertilizers to provide maintenance to his fields and improve their production. To achieve his objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. José is a responsible, hard-working person who is very devoted to his family. His greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur, so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him a steady and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve the production of his dairy cows

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mr. Soung S. (pictured here) is 61 years old and his wife, Mrs. Neng Nhao, is 58 years old  They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 15 kilometers. They have been married since 1972 and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home and another one stays at home. 

Soung and his wife are vegetable farmers. The couple does not have capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their vegetables, so Soung is asking for his first loan of $150 to help his capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nou L.,  born in 1969, is the leader of a group loan having been selected by its four members. They live in Kampong Pou village, Kandal province. 
 
Mrs. Nou L. earns her living by selling vegetables in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sareoun, 40 years old, works as a laborer in a garment factory where he receives a small salary to support his family. With both occupations, they still earn only a little income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Nou L. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise and pig feed. This couple has two children, who are students in the local school and also help with their mother's business.
.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza A. is currently in the business of selling coffee and fish, and has a little bar. She is requesting a loan to improve on her small business buy stocking more fish to sell. Tereza is 45 years old and is Divorced.   She has 3 children and 2 of her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest and continue with her business

loans.use: Improve her small business by stocking more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia L. is 61 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Matusalem, a part of Roxas municipality, Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Leticia runs a retail store from which she primarily sells alcoholic beverages including beer and wine to the local community. Leticia has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional alcoholic beverages to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase new beverages to expand her inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new beverages to expand her offerings

loans.name: Kit's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people make up this village loan. They are located in Pou Thum village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Kit C. as the village bank president. The members will each use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Kit C. and her husband, Mr. Praom Kimsan, are farmers who own one-hectare of land that they use to cultivate corn and vegetables for a living. For this farm, C. would like to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed and corn seed to support her farming. She works very hard to support their two children, one of whom works in a restaurant and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and corn seed to support her farming

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny O. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Jenny is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as lotions, shampoo, cologne & also underwear from NATASHA & AVON  in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenny from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Orquídeas, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Está conformado por 4 integrantes mujeres que son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son: **Dolores B. V. va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes para dama y niño para surtir sus pedidos de venta por catalogo. **La señora María Guadalupe F. C. va a comprar pollo para vender por pieza **La señora Eva Barragán A. va a comprar sabanas y colchas para surtir sus pedidos de venta por catalogo. **La señora Graciela H. M. va a comprar refrescos, verduras para incrementar su negocio de antojitos mexicanos y ropa para su negocio de venta de ropa ambulante. La señora Graciela tiene 35 años de edad, ella estudio la secundaria abierta en 1 año obtuvo su certificado, es casada y tiene 3 hijos: René Josué tiene 14 años está estudiando la secundaria, Andrés tiene 13 años está estudiando la secundaria y Anai tiene 11 años está estudiando la primaria. La señora Graciela tiene su negocio de venta ambulante de ropa, venta de tostadas, chicharrones preparados, tamales y solicitó su préstamo para hacer más grande su negocio va a comprar refrescos y verduras para preparar sus alimentos. Ella ofrece a sus clientes zapatos, ropa, pantalones, blusas, sudaderas y faldas, inicio con el negocio hace 1 año, le enseño la señora Guadalupe que también es integrante del grupo, la invitó, le gusto y se decidió por la venta de ropa ambulante, su esposo le prestó para comprar la ropa y recuerda que cuando comenzó a vender estaba muy contenta. Su negocio es importante porque le ha ayudado, han ganado estamos mas bien y es una ayuda cuando se necesita comprar algo de ahí toma, su parte favorita de este negocio es cuando sale a ofrecer la ropa con sus clientes porque se distrae y conoce a más personas, sus clientes son sus vecinas, habitantes del mismo pueblo, atiende de 20 a 25 clientes por día. Y se siente orgullosa cuando vende y tiene dinero. Las ganancias del negocio las utiliza en mejorar su vivienda, para compara más ropa. Ella quiere comprar un triciclo para utilizarlo en transportar la mercancía y lo piensa lograr con los créditos que le proporcionan. Sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, cuando vende tostadas le ayudan a llevar a la esquina las cosas porque donde vive no pasa mucha gente. Las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda es acabar de arreglar su baño, ponerle azulejo, sus planes y esperanzas son que su familia viva mejor y agrandar el negocio. La señora Graciela está muy feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir porque va a agrandar su negocio y quiere vender refrescos. Las mejorías que desea para sus hijos son que se superen que estudien una carrera para vivir mejor, este préstamo le va a ayudar sabiéndolo aprovechar. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por confiar en nosotras y prestarnos el dinero para superarnos en nuestros negocio.” Jaloxtoc es un Pueblo bonito, tranquilo, unido, solidario, el clima es cálido
texts.en:
This community bank is called Las Orquideas (The Orchids). It is located in the community of Jaloxtoc, in the city of Ayala, which is in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of four members, who are women and are neighbors. 

The members of the group are: Dolores B. V., who is going to use her loan to buy men's and women's perfumes to fill the orders she has received from catalog sales; Señora María Guadalupe F. C. is going to buy chicken to sell by the piece; Señora Eva Barragán A. is going to buy sheets and bedspreads to fill her catalog orders; Señora Graciela H. M. is going to buy soft drinks and vegetables to increase her business, which is selling Mexican snacks and clothing through door-to-door sales. 

Señora Graciela is 35 years old. She studied in the open junior high school for one year and obtained her certificate. She is married and has 3 children: René Josué is 14 and is in secondary school; Andrés is 13 and is in secondary school; and Anai is 11 and is in primary school. Señora Graciela has two businesses; she sells clothing door-to-door and she sells snacks such as tostadas, prepared chicharrones, and tamales. She is applying for the loan to increase her business. She is going to buy soft drinks and vegetables to prepare the snacks that she sells. In her clothing business, she offers her customers shoes and clothing such as pants, blouses, handkerchiefs and skirts. She began her business a year ago. She was instructed by Señora Guadalupe, who is also a member of the group and invited her to join. Señora Graciela liked it and decided to sell clothing door-to-door. Her husband lent her the money to buy the clothing, and she remembers that when she began to sell she was very happy. Her business is important because it has helped her earn money and they are better off, and it is a help when they need to buy something. Her favorite part of her business is when she goes out to offer clothing to her customers because it is relaxing and she meets more people. She calls on 20 to 25 customers a day. In addition, she feels proud when she makes sales and has money. She uses the earnings from her business to improve her house and to buy more clothing to sell. She wants to buy a three-wheeled vehicle to use in transporting her merchandise, and she thinks she can do it with loans. Her children help her in her business. When she sells tostadas, they help her carry her things to the corner, because not many people pass by her house. The improvements that she wants to do on her house are to finish the bathroom and tile it. Her plans and hopes are that her family will live better and that her business increases. Señora Graciela is very happy with the loan that she will receive because it is going to increase her business. Her goals for her children are that they excel and that they study for careers so that they live better. This loan will help her because she knows how to make good use of it.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad (Reality Foundation) "many thanks for having confidence in us and lending us the money to excel in our businesses." Jaloxtoc is a pretty, peaceful, united, and community-minded town. The climate is warm.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and vegetables for her Mexican snacks business and buy clothing to stock her door-to-door clothing sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires and spare parts

loans.name: Nancy Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy B. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su cultura y tradiciones, la belleza de esta ciudad cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Nancy tiene 44 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 19 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija ayuda en la casa, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Nancy se dedica a la venta de comida en un kiosco que es de su propiedad, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, labora solo los fines de semana ya que los demás días de la semana se dedica al cuidado de su hogar.
 
Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Mrs. Nancy B. is a member of the Buscando el Exito ["Searching for Success"] community bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, known for its culture and traditions. The beauty of this city captivates natives and strangers; it has a large variety of gastronomy, its people are very kind and polite, and they maintain their culture and traditions. Nancy is 44 and in a common-law marriage. She has 3 children ages 23, 19 and 6. Her oldest daughter helps her in the house, her second son studies in university and her youngest daughter is in school. Nancy does not have her own home because she rents. She sells food in her own kiosk. She has been doing this for 5 years and only works on the weekends since on the other days of the week she cares for her home. She is a founding member of the community bank and she will invest her loan in the purchase of dishes and supplies for her business. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase dishes and supplies.

loans.name: Higinio Wilfrido

texts.es:
Higinio Wilfrido M. M. tiene 41 años de edad, Es casado Vive con la esposa y junto a su hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Tiene una hija.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Higinio Wilfrido se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es darle el estudio a la única hija que tiene.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Higinio Wilfrido M. M. is 41, married, and lives with his wife and daughter in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has one daughter.

The members of the V.R.C. Jesus Nos Ama ["Jesus Loves Us"] are located in the Los Amarillos district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank have long worked in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice.

Higinio Wilfrido has worked in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and cocoa for five years. He buys his products in Agripac Eicopa, and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. Through supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. They confront challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to provide an education for his only daughter.

He likes sports.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en: Leticia P. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Leticia is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Leticia is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Leticia operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rice processing to local community members. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena tiene 42 años. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decido sacar a su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ciertos productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y así iniciar este medio de vida. Debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos. Ella tiene le deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 42, has had a grocery store; she’s been in this humble activity for over five years.  She used to have a lot of difficulties so she decided to move her family forward and bought certain products like rice, beans and sugar to start this way of life because her income was insufficient to support her household.

This is why she’s asking for this loan for working capital to buy rice, corn, beans and sugar, among other products.  She wants to set up a clothing store at home.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nayanjin

texts.en:
Nayanjin, a 30-year-old hardworking young woman, is married and has a three-year-old son who attends kindergarten. The family lives in a ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband operate a business selling plastic barrels and containers at the local market called Khar Khorin.

Nayanjin started her business in 2005 with working capital of 200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). She sells plastic barrels and other kind of containers imported from Ereen or she buys products from a wholesale supplier at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Over the past few years, Nayanjin expanded her business into two stalls, one operated by her, the other by her husband, and today she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. With their business profits, they have managed to rebuild their stalls and buy a new yard for their father. They are also planning to buy a car this year.

Nayanjin is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase more products for spring and summer. She wants to establish an industry and grow to be a plastic barrel manufacturer in the future.

loans.use: To puchase plastic barrels for the upcoming seasons

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish vending businesses.  She lives in the island of Palawan. 

Sally has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Sally is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing gear and equipment.   This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sally aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy N. (pictured above) is a 35-year-old widow. She has two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village off of National Road number two, approximately twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

To earn a living, Phy is a garment factory worker. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 to build a restroom for her family to use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family

loans.name: Seyidkhanim

texts.en:
Seyidkhanim S. is from Agsu. She is a 60-year-old married woman.  Seyidkhanim is married, with two sons and one daughter, who are all married.

For the past five years, Seyidkhanim has been engaged in the poultry business. She sells to buyers in the Agsu bazaar. With this business, Seyidkhanim helps her big family pay its daily bills. She requested a loan in the amount of 900 AZN to buy more chickens. Seyidkhanim plans to use the profit from this loan to build a henhouse. This is her first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a henhouse and buy more chickens

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene la edad de 48 años, casada con una bella familia de tres hijos. De oficio modista, profesión con ocho años de experiencia, ha tenido que trabajar mucho para lograr hacer su vivienda con el cual ha venido mejorando poco a poco con ahorros de su trabajo anterior como supervisora de limpieza, y con el apoyo de su esposo el cual labora de conductor.
Su negocio lo inicio con el fin de poder tener mejore ingresos, cuidar mejor su casa, como su familia.
Hoy desea hacer un bajarte, ya que el que tiene le cubre en frente de la casa pero en el invierno se le mete el agua ya que no es cerrado y desea mejorar esta situación cerrando por completo. Lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder hacer esta mejora en el cual comprara: diez laminas de zinc, diez perlines y cemento para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, married and has a lovely family with three children.  Gloria is a dressmaker by trade, a profession in which she has eight years of experience.  She has had to work a lot to create her home.  She has been improving it little by little with earnings from her previous work as a cleaning supervisor, and with the support of her husband who works as a driver.  

She started her business for better income and to be able to take better care of her home, as well as her family.  Now Gloria would like to build a porch.  The one she has covers the front of the house but in the winter, water gets in since it's not fully closed.  She wants to improve this situation by closing it completely.  

This loan will be used to buy ten zinc sheets, ten purlins and cement to begin the work.

loans.use: purchase purlins and zinc sheets to make a porch and live in better conditions.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
To earn an income to support her family needs, Janet Cabrera has a general store where she offers different products needed by her co-villagers. With these activities, Janet usually generates 4,000 PHP, which she utilizes as rolling capital for the business and for financing her family's daily food intake.

Currently, Janet is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy products to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap. Janet hopes that her business will continuously prosper.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en:
Tseepil is 25 years old and lives with her older sister in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She manages a wool product making and trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She makes variety of wool clothes such as shirts, pants, socks and gloves for all ages. Also she rents a stall and operates trading of clothes.

Previously, she used to work at a private company that manufactures wool products. There she gained much experience and knowledge needed in starting her own business. Since 2009 she start to sale clothes, which are imports from China.  

Now she rents a stall at a trading center in order to sell her products and clothes from China. 

She is a polite woman who says, "I am planning to broaden the collection of my clothes." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from China to resell.

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, vive en la Ribera el Vergel, es casada con el señor Jesús Gerardo  y con quien procreo cuatro hijos  quienes ya están casados y la apoyan con los ingreso de la casa, a su responsabilidad tiene una nieta  de nombre Sandra patricia de diesi nueve años quien desde muy pequeña esta con ella.

     Ella se dedica  a su negocio de abarrotes, en donde lleva  catorce años y  cuatro meses y comenta que le va  bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso  en su hogar, pues con esta actividad se ha estado apoyando mucho y con la ganancias que le queda apoya a su nieta que está estudiando.

     Nos platica que desde muy joven  apoyaba su mama con la venta que ella hacía y cuando se caso se dicaba a la venta de polvillos, tascalate, pinol, que son elaborados de maíz, con ello comenzó y con el paso del tiempo decidió poner lo que es el negocio de abarrotes para que mejor sea sus ingresos.

     Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando y con la ayuda de Dios salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in La Ribera el Vergel.  She is married to Jesús Gerardo and they have four children who are already married and support her with her household income.  Bertha has a 19 year-old granddaughter called Sandra Patricia in her care.  She has been living with her since she was very young.  

Bertha has a grocery store business which she has owned for fourteen years and four months.  She says that it is doing well since it makes her a good income for her household.  This business has supported her a lot and she uses any profits she has left over to support her granddaughter who is studying.

Bertha tells us that, from a very young age, she would support her mom in making her sales.  When she got married, she started selling 'polvillos' and 'tascalate' (both types of drink), and 'pinol' (a coarse flour).  All of these products are made from corn.  Over time, she decided to set up her grocery store business so that she could improve her income.

Bertha's biggest wish is to be able to continue working with this business and her loan and, with God's help, get ahead in life with her small family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, oil, corn meal, cookies, eggs, etc. with which to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesus es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 5 años opto por poner su propio negocio, al cual él y su familia podrían atender este es denominado “Ferretería Libramiento 2” donde ofrece herramientas, material para construcción, herrería a un precio moderado, donde el local se encuentra en un buen punto de la ciudad. El señor Jesús en este momento desea que se apoye para comprar más mercancía por mayoreo porque es la forma en que puede dar a buen precio, de esta manera seguirá generando mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en: Jesus is a hard worker who decided 5 years ago to start his own business.  He and his family now run a small hardware store where they sell tools, construction materials, and reasonably priced blacksmith tools.   His shop is located in a good area of the city.  Jesus will use the loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices, since that enables him to generate the most income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices for his hardware store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 43 años, vive en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar y sus 3 queridos hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Ella se dedica a varias actividades, pero lo que más le gusta es el tejido, es así que durante el día teje chullo (prendas tejidas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, telares. Ella disfruta mucho D.  esta actividad y lo hace muy hábilmente, sus tejidos los venD. en su pequeño puesto ubicado en centro artesanal del poblado D. San Pedro D. Cajas, donD. con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Por otro lado se dedica también a la siembra D. papa y lo realiza una vez al año, esta característica hace que la tierra sea más fértil y proporcione un buen producto, por lo que obtiene buenas ganancias con ello. Asimismo recibe el apoyo D. su esposo quien tiene una pequeña radio comunal en la localidad. En adelante espera ahorrar lo suficiente para poner una tienda D. tejidos artesanales más granD., donD. pueda vender sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para continuar sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elvira D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 15 bolsas D. hilos D. diversos colores, para continuar con la elaboración D. prendas tejidas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro D. Cajas.  She is noted as being a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Cesar and her three children who she loves very much.

Elvira is engaged in several business activities but what she most enjoys is weaving.  During the day, she weaves 'chullos' (knitted hats with earflaps), scarves and gloves on her loom.  She very much enjoys this activity and does her work very skilfully.  She sells her products from her small stall which is located in a craft center in San Pedro D. Cajas.  Her customers buy her products very quickly.

Elvira also grows potatoes and does this once a year.  This means that her soil is more fertile and provides a good product which makes her good profits.  She also receives support from her husband who has a small community radio station in the town.

In the future, Elvira hopes to save up enough money to set up a bigger store selling woven handicrafts where she can sell her products more peacefully.  She is a member of the "Mujeres al Futuro" community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Elvira will invest the money that she has requested in buying 15 bags of thread in different colors so that she can continue weaving her products.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of thread

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-two year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the poultry business for eight years.  This has enabled him to provide for the family. His hardships are the high costs for feeds and the possibility of diseases. His vision is to raise at least 1000 birds.  He currently has only 220.  Wilson is in need of a loan to buy birds for poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy birds for poultry farming.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis manages his rice field business. He is married, and he is 41 years of age and blessed with three school-age children. His wife is housekeeper and the one who assists him in managing their farm. Francis dreams of a better future for his family. He is preparing for his children's education and ensuring they can finish their studies. 

He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to maintain his farming business. He will buy fertilizers and hybrid seeds for farming. He will also use the loan to pay for the labor cost in planting. Francis is looking forward to the success of his business and gaining higher income to further support his children's education and family needs as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hybrid seeds for rice farming.

loans.name: Kerima

texts.en:
Kerima is 49 years old. She is a widow with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling soft drinks in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for two years.

Kerima requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit from this loan to build a new house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks like mango juice and lemon juice to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, one boy and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a water vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in the market. Alice dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase jerrycans for water distribution. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase jerrycans for water distribution.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old. She is a widow with five children who all go to school. Her primary business, besides running a salon, is transportation. She has been in this business for twelve years. Her businesses give her a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This is her second loan from KADET; she paid off her earlier loan successfully. This loan will help her repair her bus and van. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her kids. Her dream is to expand her business by purchasing another bus.

loans.use: to repair her bus and van.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es:
A sus 61 años de edad Maria Orfilia es una luchadora incansable que desde hace 32 años tiene su propio negocio, vende comisas en las calles de la ciudad de Medellín, labor que desempeña diariamente de 4:00 a.m. 9:00 a.m. pues en este horario hay buenas ventas y ha tenido la ventaja de estar al frente del hogar en el transcurso del día lo que le permitió estar presente en la educación de sus 3 hijos.

Maria Orfilia sueña con que su negocio pase de generación en generación y que sea un ingreso fijo para el sustento de sus hijos. Sin embargo actualmente debe comprar insumos para la producción de alimentos y adicional a esto hacerle algunas adecuaciones al carro donde funciona su negocio, arreglar las llantas, comprarle una sombrilla y darle una apariencia mas agradable, por lo cual hoy solicita un préstamo, con el cual hacer esta inversión, mejorar las ventas, y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At her 61 years of age, Maria Orfilia is a tireless fighter who, for 32 years, has had her own business selling food on the streets of Medellin, work that she carries out daily from 4 a.m. until 9 a.m. since those hours are good for sales and she has had the advantage of being in front of her home during the day which permitted her to be present for her 3 children’s education.

Maria Orfilia dreams that her business will pass from one generation to the next and that it will be a fixed means of support for her children. Nevertheless, currently, she has to buy supplies to produce food and in addition make some adjustments to the cart from which she conducts her business, such as fixing the tires and buying an umbrella to give it a more pleasing appearance. Therefore she is requesting a loan with which to make this investment, increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use:
.
to buy supplies to produce food and make adjustments to the cart where she conducts her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 22 years old and has two children. She needs to work in order to provide for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy eggplants, cabbage, beans, and carrots to sell.  Though walking a distance to sell every day is difficult, Joy still has the energy to continue this business because of her children. 

Joy hopes that with her patience and diligence she will earn enough money for her dream, which is to buy a motorcycle that will serve as her transportation in her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggplants, cabbage, beans and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Francis Mwolo

texts.en:
Francis is a 42-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 15 years. He describes himself as being hardworking, patient and trustworthy.

He operates a knitting-services business where he makes and sells pullovers and sweaters for school-going children. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a slum area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonality and low purchasing power by his customers.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy yarns for making sweaters. His business goal is to to diversify into farming within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will purchase a tractor for using on his farm, buy a plot of land and put up rental houses.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarns

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than is 56 years old. She lives in the village of An Ninh. She has four children who are married. Than and her husband are farmers. Her main job is farming. Besides this she also sells popcorn to earn more money. She feels happy when she participates in SEDA because she can save money every week. She has borrowed money from SEDA since 2009. The last time she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. This time she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy corn to make popcorn.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell popcorn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy doors, windows and ceramic tiles for family hygiene and safety.

loans.name: Mungano Youth Group

texts.en:
Alex is the facilitator of the Mungano group. Alex and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alex takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alex had a good maize yield harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alex was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alex will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mungano Youth group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Alex is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou (in the photo) and her husband, Sophea, 20, live along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter.

Chanthou and her husband have full-time employment in the same company. She is now in the process of building a new house to live in, but the house is not finished yet because Chanthou lacks some money to finish it.   Hence, she decided to ask for a loan of $500 to make the finishes.

loans.use: finish building her house

loans.name: Zenona

texts.en:
Zenona is a 57-year-old widow who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living selling food to her community and she cooks and sells food items. Zenona works hard to support her children.

Zenona is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices. In the future, she hopes to have stable business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 40 years old and has been in farming for 10 years. She produces bananas, cabbages and French beans for the local market. She is married with three children aged 20, 16 and 13 years old.

Selina has requested for a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy. She says the income will be used to pay for the education of the children. She plans to buy high yield dairy cows as her business grows.

She is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo with the loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 49 years old, married to Ciriaka, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Dennis Noe

texts.en:
My name is Dennis F. and I work in the transport of people. I´ve had my business for 5 years. I have an excellent number of clients now that I am located at a taxi stop. My business generates the income I use to support my family. My goal is to do some repairs to my taxi in order to provide a better service to my clients, and, with the earnings that I obtain, to be able to buy another vehicle and feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dennis F., me dedico a transporte de personas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo dos taxis uno lo trabajo yo y el otro mi hermano, mis clientes son excelentes ya que estoy ubicado en el punto de taxis, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es hacer unas reparaciones para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otro vehiculo y alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.en:
Martha is divorced and has to take care of her two sons. The alimony her husband gives her is not enough to cover all of her and her family’s expenses. For this reason, she began to sell natural products to earn extra income and help her two sons succeed. It has been four years since she began with her sales. Now, she is getting more orders since she has gained her clients’ trust because of the good quality of the her products. To cover the meet the demands, she needs a $200 loan to buy more merchandise.

The well-being of this family is in your hands, you can be an important part of Martha and her family’s achievements. It is the moment to help those who are most in need and they are truly thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Martha es divorciada y tiene a su cargo a dos hijos, la pensión que le confiere su ex esposo es muy poca para todas las necesidades que tiene ella y su familia, por esto Martha comenzó a vender productos naturales, con la finalidad de tener un ingreso extra y sacar a adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos. Ya son cuatro años desde que ella inició con sus ventas, y ahora se han incrementado los pedidos, Martha se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes por los buenos productos que comercializa, y para poder cubrir la demanda ella necesita de un préstamo de $200 dólares que utilizara en la compra de mercancía.

El bienestar de esta familia esta en tus manos, tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Martha y su familia, es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, ellos agradecen tu apoyo sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
For nearly twelve years, Yelena has had her own business selling children’s clothing at the market in Nikopol, a city in south-central Ukraine. The business has been a good fit for Yelena. She and her husband, Vladimir, have two children. She recently had some difficulties with her business due to the birth of their second child, but she is looking forward to the future and continuing to develop her trade.
