Yelena has requested a loan for $500 to help purchase some additional clothing inventory. Being able to purchase new products in bulk can save a lot of time and money for Yelena. The lower her expenses, the higher her profits will be and the amount she can provide to help support her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Tessito 2 association, led by Madame Fatou D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Oussouye located at 40 km from the regional capital, Ziguinchor. Oussouye is a touristic village and commerce is the main livelihood of its inhabitants. The women engage in commerce by exporting local products such as dried fish, palm oil, and wild fruits such as made and tole to the cities.

Purpose: The Tessito 2 group has the purpose of improving the living conditions of our members and alleviating the housewife's burden.

Business activities: The principal business of the group is trading, which consists of purchasing and reselling seafood, fruits, and palm oil from the region of Ziguinchor. In order to succeed in this business, the Tessito 1 group sollicits a loan of 600,000 francs (about $1200) in order to undertake these activities.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : : Le projet se situe dans l’éco village de Oussouye situé à 40 km de la capitale régionale ( Ziguinchor) Oussouye est un 2co villave touristique et le commerce est la principale activité des populations Les femmes se donnent surtout au commerce en exportant vers les grandes villes des produits locaux tel que le poisson sec, l’huile de palme, des fruits sauvages comme le made, le tole etc.

Objectif : : Le groupement Téssito 2 s’est fixé entre autre objectif : D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres ; D’allégé le panier de la ménagère ;

Activités : la principale activité du groupement est : le commerce ; il s’agit d’achat et de vente de produits halieutiques, fruits, et huile de palme venant de la région de Ziguinchor. Pour réussir ce projet, le groupement Téssito 1 Sollicite un prêt de 600 000F afin de bien pouvoir mener ces activités.»

loans.use: Purchase of dried fish, palm oil and fruit from local producers; transportation to cities for sale

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.es:
Ruth is a young woman who got married recently and dreams along with her husband to have a solid marriage and be able to support the children that they are planning to have. She is a native of Huayucachi and she has decided to remain and grow professionally there, for this reason she decided to open this small grocery store a few months ago. Thanks to her perseverance and although she still is not earning a big revenue, she keeps on working with the hope to see soon the fruits of her work. In addition to this job, she supports her parents with the breeding of animals. She is getting an income from this work to support her home as well, but since the money is not completely sufficient she has decided to improve the small grocery store with more services and have a larger variety of products, for this reason is requesting for a loan of for 225 dollars. Let's help Ruth make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruth es una joven que hace poco tiempo ha contraído matrimonio y sueña junto a su esposo formar un hogar sólido que pueda sostener a los hijos que han proyectado traer al mundo, ella es natural de Huayucachi y ha decidido quedarse en su propia tierra y desarrollarse en ella es por ello que decide abrir hace pocos meses esta pequeña bodega.Gracias a su constancia y a pesar de que todavía no percibe ganancias significativas sigue perseverando con la esperanza de ver pronto los frutos de su trabajo. Además de esta labor apoya a sus padres con la crianza de animales y también de este trabajo percibe algunas ganancias para el sustento de su hogar debido a que el dinero no es del todo suficiente ha decidido acondicionar la pequeña bodega con más servicios y variedad de productos y para este propósito solicita un préstamo de 225 dólares.Hagamos que Ruth lleve a cabo sus sueños.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mrs. I. Kosal is a widow with 2 sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1980 and started her silk production in the same year. Recently, one of her sons began assisting her in weaving silk at home, while the other son works in a restaurant in Phnom Penh. After borrowing money from MAXIMA again and again, her living is getting better. Now, she plans to set up another loom for her son.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times previously. Now, she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms. She will also use the loan to set up another loom for her son.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms. Also, to set up another loom for her son.

loans.name: Sallay Papa

texts.en: Sallay was born in the Portloko district of Sierra Leone and was married to a carpenter in Magburaka.  Sally lost her husband, however, and now, as a 49-year-old widow, she is left to take care of her 6 children.  With her previous loan from SMT, Sallay managed to earn enough  income from her fish-selling business to meet her family’s expenses and start building her own capital.   She is requesting another loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: to continue the positive growth of her fish-selling business

loans.name: Kazinga B(Ii) Group

texts.en: Mary owns a small poultry farm, and supplies eggs to a nearby restaurant. She would like a loan to increase her profits and expand the range of her livestock option.

loans.use: To expand her agricultural range

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en: Anna M. is 43 years old and the mother of 2. Her main aim is to increase her working capital and provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fotil

texts.ru:
Fotil K. is 47 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He has a high school education. He works as a supervisor in the local farm called "Dyust". "Dyust" maintans an area of 23.10 hectares. He supervises a group of 15 people (which includes his family members). On the farm, the workers plant cotton, wheat, corn, and onions. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. The first credit was in the amount of 2,000 som ($575). Using that credit, Fotil planted onions on 2 hectares of land. He was able to get a profit of 5,000 som ($1450). Using that money he fixed his house. This time, he is asking for 3,000 som ($875), so he could plant onions and wheat on 1 hetare of land each.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Фотил Нодирович - 47 лет. Женат имеет 2-х детей. Имеет среде специальное образование. Председатель дехканского хозяйства «Дуст» . Дехканское хозяйство «Дуст» имеет 23,10 гектаров земли. Под его руководством работают около 15 работников (в.ч члены его семьи). Клиент сеет хлопок, пшеницу, кукурузу и лук. Кредитуется в МЗФ «Микроинвест» начиная с 2006 года. Первый кредит был в размере 2000 сом. На полученный кредит клиент посеял 1 га лука. Получил прибыль около 5000 сомони. На полученный доход отремонтировал дом. На получаемый кредит хочет посеять 1 гектар лука и 1 гектар пшеницы.

loans.use: На получаемый кредит хочет посеять 1 гектар лука и 1 гектар пшеницы.

loans.name: Rohadiah

texts.id:
Rohadiah is a used goods collector. She has been in this business for quite a while. She goes for work twice a day from 06.00 am - 09.00 am and from 03.00 p.m. - 05.30 p.m. She looks for used goods such as can, papers, glasses to be later sold at recycle centers.

She can earn money from this job and she can send money to her parents who live in Java island. She also uses the money to send her child to Junior High School.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha mengumpulkan barang bekas sudah sejak lama dilakoni oleh Rohadiah. Ia biasa berangkat 2 kali sehari, dari pukul 06.00 sampai 09.00. Setelah istrahat sebentar Ia mulai menyortir hasil krongsokannya karena harus dipisahkan antara kaleng, kertas dan gelas/botol air mineral. Sore hari Ia berangkat pukul 15.00 sampai 17.30. Dari hasil menjual rongsokan Ia bisa menyambung hidupnya di bali bahkan dikirim untuk orangtuanya yang ada di Jawa dan juga dipakai untuk biaya pendidikan anak yang sekarang duduk di bangku SMP.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Mrs. Philomena Onorunose is 42 years old, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children. She sells firewood, which she learned from her mother and started 1987. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more wood for sales. She is a trader and has been in LAPO for 4 years as a dedicated client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Sadorat

texts.en:
A. Sadorat is 43 is years old. She is a widow and has three children. Sadorat has been running her own small business for 6 years already. After the death of her husband, she was in a difficult situation and had problem with finances. She decided to apply to IMON for a loan.

After receiving the loan she opened a small store near her house. Now her business is stable and is the main source of income for her family. In her store, Sadorat is selling groceries such as sweets, sugar, canning products, soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.

She is doing all the best to ensure her children the best future and to help them be well-educated. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Now she requests for a loan of 700 $ US Dollars. Sadorat is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods, thus increasing the range of the goods. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the variety of goods.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a hard-working mother of two, resident of Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a shop selling soft drinks and freshly prepared juice and snacks in Lumo Market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Cvijeta

texts.en: Cvijeta is a woman living in the community of Strijezevica, outside the town of Doboj.  She is divorced and is raising 2 children.  She currently works as a veterinarian, earning around 600 KM ($450 USD) per month.  She also receives some small welfare support for her children.  This is her first loan through  Zene za Zene, and she has requested a loan amount of 1200 KM.  She wants to use the loan to buy some young chickens and piglets.  She will purchase some food to feed and fatten them, and then sell them for a good price when they are grown and their meat is most valuable.  She hopes that this will bring her family some extra income that can be used to meet their everyday needs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and piglets for fattening

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira B. M. is the widow of B. M. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. Saira has been living here for the last twelve years and has been married for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls. Her eldest son and daughter are married. Her youngest son is a mechanic and works in a workshop. Her youngest daughter completed her 12th standard and is ready to take college admissions. Her eldest son has a workshop where he sells spare parts. Saira B. M. is a housewife and does the household work to take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy spare parts for her son's workshop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Samia P. wants a loan to buy material (beads, cloth, sketches) to make decoratively embroidered dresses. Kosar M. Shahbaz wants a loan to buy clothing to resell. Bilquis G. R. wants a loan to buy material (beams) for her shuttering business. Elizabeth S. M. wants a loan to buy spare vehicle parts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her son's workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Carpentry work

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 30 year-old man who lives in a small village in the Bekaa Valley. Abed owns a hair salon and wants to improve his store by purchasing new hair cutting tools, new mirrors, and store decorations. For this purpose, he has requested a loan for 1000 US dollars from the Lebanese MFI, Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy new barbershop necessities and redesign his shop

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en: Shuhratjon N. is 27 years old and is married with two children. For the past 2 years, Shuhratjon provides taxi service with his car. Shuhratjon always tries to provide high quality services at an attractive price for customers. He does his best to make the business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner for his family and his parents. He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. In order to repair his car, Shuhratjon is now requesting 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 10 months . He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To make repairs to taxi

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Martha del Socorro P. Méndez tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 3 hijos sus edades son de 30 su hija mayor, su otra hija de 24 años y 20 años de edad, ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, sus propósitos son de aumentar su negocio ya que le interesa tener una variedad de productos que pueda ofrecer a los diferentes gustos que el cliente pida, sus deseos son de tener una tienda donde pueda vender mejor su mercadería para seguirle proporcionando a su familia ingresos ya que estos le proporcionan ayuda.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa en la que vende los productos como: ropa interior, camisetas y camisolas, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio vendiendo unos pocos productos y al ver que tuvo aceptación con su negocio decide realizar la inversión de mas producto y se traslada a los departamentos de telica y Chinandega, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos por lo que viaja hasta honduras y el oriental que es mas favorable para ella.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro P. M. is 52 years old and is single. She has three children - her oldest daughter is 30 and her younger daughters are 24 and 20. None of her children depend on her. Her goal is to expand her business since she is interested in having a variety of products that she can offer to her clients' different tastes. Her wish is to have a a store where she can better sell her merchandise so that she can keep providing income for her family as they also provide her with help. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the sale of clothing. She sells products such as underwear, shirts and camisoles which she sells as a traveling salesperson. She has had her business for 10 years. She started her business selling a few products and once she saw that her business was accepted she decided to invest in more products and she moved to the departments of Telica and Chinandega. She will use this loan as working capital to purchase products for which she travels to Honduras and east as the prices are more favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise for clothing sales.

loans.name: Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of A. R. and a citizen of a city named Multan, Paksitan for the past 8 years. Her husband is a driver that drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of four sons who are involved in a bangle making business. They are experts in making steel bangles and they have the ability to make different shapes including round and triangle. It is common for the ladies of Multan to wear colorful steel bangles. Najma baji helps her sons make bangles by coloring them. They all have 15 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy steel and paint to expand their bangle business.

Najma bajiis is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Shumaila baji is requesting a loan to buy a cart to sell vegetables. Bilquis baji is requesting a loan to buy material (clothes, beads and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Mussarat baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Khursheed begum baji is requesting a loan to buy various woods for her furniture making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy steel and paint for making bangles

loans.name: Rotari

texts.en: Ms. Rotari R. is 45 years old and lives in the Falesti district with her three children. Her children are in school and she pays for their school materials and clothing in addition to all of their living expenses. For the past 5 years she has sold fruit and vegetables at the wholesale market in the town of Falesti. She would like a loan of $950 to increase her sales volume. R. is a responsible and energetic businesswoman, and MicroInvest is sure that these capabilities will help her succeed.

loans.use: BLVC-08.09.PT

loans.name: Perty

texts.en:
To become a successful businesswoman who lives a wonderful life is Perty's ambition. She is 38 years old and is still single. She can be best described as a hard working woman. She believes that hard work is the key towards the development and progress of every business. She is the breadwinner of her family, thus, is very ambitious to have a better life and earn money to support her parent’s medication.

Perty runs a sari-sari store (local term for a village store) business in the village. She is requesting a loan of PHP9,000 improve her business. With this amount, Perty hopes to increase her income to satisfy her family's basic needs and medication. She believes that the amount she requested will be of great help to her business and family.

loans.use: Business Development

loans.name: Ekatte

texts.en: Ekatte O. sells engine oil and eggs. She needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell.  Ekatte is 48 years old and married with four children.  She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.  Ekatte is a LAPO client.

loans.use: Purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Kuzixon

texts.ru: Кузихон 59 лет, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Все дети взрослые и уже имеют свои семьи. Кузихон на пенсии, но дополнительно занимается предпринимательством. Продает детскую одежду на центральном рынке города Исфары. Кузихон ездит за товаром на оптовые рынки один раз в неделю, а затем в течении недели продает в розницу. Кузихон планирует увеличить ассортимент одежды для новорожденных, поэтому подает заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Kuzixon is 59 years old, married and the mother of three children. All her children are grown and already have their own families. Kuzixon is retired, but taken up business as a second career. She sells children's clothing at the central market in the city of Isfara. Kuzixon travels once a week to the wholesale market for goods, then over the course of the week sells them retail. She plans to increase the assortment of clothing for newborns and therefore has put in an application for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for newborns

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife B. grows corn. It is the second most commonly grown crop in the Philippines. She is 34 years old and has three children. Her husband, Allan B., is the one who manages their farm. They have been together for more than 10 years already. They work hard for the future of their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy seeds and to pay for the labor for land preparation. Also, she'd like to start a business to augment their income.

CEVI is reaching out to people to help them sustain their livelihoods. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay for land-preparation labor

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria Petrona F. tiene  58 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Ubence Reina, ellos tiene 3 hijos y ninguno depende de ellos ya que son personas grandes y realizaron su vida aparte, ya estan casados y son hombres de bien.
la Sra. F. se dedica a la compra y venta de camararon al detalle, ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias, la cantidad que ella quiere comprar son 170 libras de camaron.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene, su meta es poder poner un local grande para hacer una tienda de venta de mariscos.
junto con su esposo ellos dos sacan adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Petrona F. is 58 years old, married to Mr. Ubence Reina, and they have 3 children who do not depend on them as they are all grown-ups, live apart, are married, and good human beings.

Mrs. F. buys and sells shrimp, retail, and she has been doing this for 4 years. At the moment she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and thus increase sales and improve earnings. She wishes to buy 170 pounds of shrimp. This is her only income resource, and it is her goal to be able to open a store in a big facility to sell seafood. Together with her husband, they cover the expenses of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: "I have a two-hectare (5-acre) farm. My husband and I have been tilling our farm for 20 years already. We want to grow our farm to be able to support the needs of our family," says Sally D., 43-year old mother of five children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her farm achieve its maximum harvest. In that way, she could easily buy the things they need. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It gives its clients not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou D. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1989.elle s'active dans la vente de jus et de glace.son objectif est de prendre des mesures d'accompagnement pour affronter la periode de la chaleur periode ou la demande est tres forte .par consequent ellle demnde un pret de soixante quinze mille frs.elle capitalise plus de sept d'experience dans cette activite.
texts.en:
Fatou D. has been a client parent since 1989. She is active in selling juices and ice cream. Her goal is to take supportive measures in face of periods of hot weather, when the demand is very high. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of 75,000 francs. She capitalizes on over seven years of experience in this business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, ages 10 and 3, is a self-proclaimed “fish monger” who sells fried fish. She buys the fish daily from the market and transports them by matatu (mini-bus taxi) to Nyamasaria, a more rural area not far out of town.

Rose will use this money to buy more fish, mostly Tillapia from nearby Lake Victoria. She finds that sometimes when she goes to buy fish there are none, so she will use some of the loan money to travel to the shore of the lake where she can buy the fish more directly. Rose hopes to earn enough money from her business to educate her children and to get her “daily bread." Her husband’s income also helps support the family; her husband is a mechanic.

K-MET, the NGO giving providing this loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, click on “About the Field Partner” on the right-hand side of the webpage.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Mrs. Concepcion D., 41 years of age, is a resident of P-6 Gango, Ozamis City, married to Mr. Edmund D. and blessed with 3 children. To complement the income of her husband, she decided to engage in a gardening and vegetable and fish vending business in the year 1988 with an initial capital of P 2,000 only.

Now, she is earning an average monthly net income of not less than P3,000 from her business. In July 2008, she joined PAGLAUM MPC and was able to access loans and other services offered in our cooperative. Being responsible in her account, she finished the term with a good credit record, and now she is applying for the amount of P10,000 to add to her capital for her business. She expects to be able to earn more in order to sustain the needs of her family, especially in food. She is planning to own a stall in the market.

loans.use: Additional capital for her gardening and vegetable and fish vending businesses

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Oblaberdi

texts.en:
N. Oblaberdi, aged 42 years, is married and has two children. He earns his living through farming, specifically planting potatoes. Oblaberdi seeks room to expand the business and create an opportunity for his market, especially during the times he is waiting to harvest. He needs an alternative that can help him save for his children's higher education. Oblaberdi requests a loan of 4600 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Soyaltepec Group

texts.es:
Ude: Soyaltepec
Ciclo: 1
Fecha de desembolso: 11 de agosto del 2009
Monto de crédito: 25,000.00



           Francisca J. A. originaria y vecina de la comunidad de Soyaltepec municipio de Temascal Oaxaca, casada de 49 años de edad madre de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en el extranjero, con muchos sueños de superación y ánimos de salir adelante, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes la cual le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, por que nos platica que empezó a vender con una pequeña mesa en la cual solo vendía dulces y chicharrones a los niños,  pero que con la ayuda de dios y de sus hijos  ha ido creciendo su negocio, nos comenta que empezó con su venta por que su comunidad se encuentra a 3 kilómetros de  la carretera y a 20 minutos de su municipio, la falta de comercio que existente en su localidad y el largo trayecto  que tendrían que recorrer para comprar el consumo de la canasta básica, entonces fue  hay donde surgió la idea de vender abarrotes en general.


          En la comunidad  nos comentan que doña Francisca es una persona líder en su localidad, responsable y honesta con un carisma que a todos contagia con su forma de ser a todas las personas de la comunidad, su mayor anhelo es que en su negocio se encuentre bien surtido y se venda de todo  para  que no tengan la necesidad de salir las personas de su localidad y de esta forma  salir ella adelante  y asegurar un futuro para ella y su esposo. 

          Doña Francisca en sus sueños de superación para ella y para las personas de su comunidad ingreso a una micro financiera llamada Fundacion Realidad A.C. en la cual ingresaron con ella 4 hombres y 5 mujeres los cuales formaron un grupo llamado Soyaltepec. En el cual ella adquirió un crédito de $3,000 el cual lo utilizara para resurtir su negocio y vender más producto. El grupo nos dicen muy contentos que se sienten apoyados, y dan gracias de que se les pueda brindar este tipo de ayuda de  prestamos ya que no tienen acceso a los servicios financieros de ningún tipo y cuando quieren un préstamo les piden demasiados  requisitos con los que no cuentan, y se consideran personas de escasos recursos.  

          Los integrantes del grupo de doña Francisca son: Dora Hilda M. A. ella cría y venta de cerdo, Celerino M. C. el ofrece sus servicios de taxi, Armando M. C.  el ofrece sus servicios de mecánico, Justina B. M. ella vende comida, Tomasa C. F. ella hace servilletas y manteles tejidos o bordados, Guillermo C. J. el vende tacos,  Francisca J. A. ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, Lorenzo A. F. el vende comida, Obdaly C. S. ella vende ropa de dama, Miriam A. C. ella vende zapatos por catalogo.

Nota: Doña Francisca es la segunda de izquierda a derecha.

loans.use: PARA EL INCREMENTO DE SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES OFRECIENDO UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SU COMUNIDAD Y PROGRESO

loans.name: Malaneh Group

texts.en:
The Malaneh group is a group of small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town, which is in northern Sierra Leone.

The leader of the group is Yeabu S., pictured on the left. Yeabu was born in Magburaka town about fifty-five years ago. She is a widow with eight children. Seven are now on their own and one is in Senior Secondary School III.

Yeabu sells market food such as onions, pepper, oil, tomatoes, and “margi.” She has been selling food at the market for more than forty years now.

Through Kiva’s partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), the members of the Maleneh group are seeking a Kiva loan of 500,000 Leone (SLL) each. With these loans, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits, and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in their small-scale woman-owned businesses.

loans.name: Mame Ndoumbane

texts.fr: Mame Mboumbane G., 50 ans, mariée, est mère de 2 petits enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 3 ans. Elle a eu 5 expériences avec le crédit, et chaque fois elle rembourse sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle va s'approvisionner en marchandises pour le renforcement de sa boutique. Elle partice à la prise en charge de la famille.

loans.use: renforcer son activé de petit commerce

loans.name: Banco Comunal De Juntos A Trabajar Group

texts.en:
The group consists of 11 neighbors who live in San Sebastián, a neighborhood in Cusco.  The group is called Juntos a Trabajar, which means We Work Together. The members are natives of Cusco and surrounding areas.

Some of the members are single, some have children and others are single.

The members are engaged in various commercial activities – construction, grocery, selling jewelry, clothing, fresh juice, and cellular phones.

With this loan, they will invest in more construction materials and products for their stores.  One will repair a car  to rent and another will open a new store selling piñatas for children’s birthday parties.
 
For some this is their first loan, while others have received loans in the past.

All of the members are grateful for the loans, especially since some have had problems obtaining capital in the past.  They all promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(Erica is not pictured in the photo)

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mariano Nieves

texts.en:
Mariano is a member of the Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Mariano is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. He is 57 years old and is married with 4 children and 2 grandchildren. 

Mariano is a small farmer. On his land, he grows potatoes, beans and barley. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields.

Mariano appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Đào Thị's Group

texts.en: Hà Đào Thị (10107070078) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they all both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 07 (2). Hà is married and has four adult children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. In 2008, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,204,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Hà is now requesting a new loan of 4,142,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 3rd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrower in the group: Nguyễn Thị S. (10107070080) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hà Đào Thị (10107070078) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ,, Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 07 (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 4,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,204,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị S. (10107070080) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Luisa M. mujer esforzada, labora en servicios domésticos desde hace once años el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa, pero le hace falta mucho aun  no tiene piso, falta el repello de las paredes de la casa, también cambiar el techo que esta malo, en el invierno se le pasa el agua, anteriormente tenia letrina pero compro un inodoro que lo ubico junto con el baño pero que aun no tiene paredes ni piso el baño y cuando llueve se moja, y las condiciones sanitarias no son las adecuadas
Solo esta forrado con zinc, muy inseguro para el aseo personal, además tiene miedo que se metan a robar el inodoro a como esta la delincuencia en su barrio, tiene 48 años de edad, su esposo es carpintero y sus tres hijos están mayores. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para hacer el baño y poder cerrar el inodoro también a si como comprar una ventanas para la casa que están solo tapada con mantas que por gracias a Dios no le han robado nada todavía. Contenta por este represtamo ya que ha logrado poder hacer mejor sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa M. is a hard-working woman. She has worked in domestic services for 11 years. This has enabled her to make improvements to her house. But, she still does not have a floor, the walls are not plastered, and the bad roof needs to be changed because it leaks in the winter. She previously had a latrine, but she bought a toilet. She put it in the bathroom, but there still are no walls or flooring in the bathroom. When it rains, it gets wet. It has inadequate sanitary conditions. It is only covered with zinc, which is very unsafe for personal hygiene. Also, she is afraid that someone will steal the toilet because there is delinquency in her neighborhood. She is 48. Her husband is a carpenter, and her three children are adults. With this loan she will buy construction materials like stones, sand, cement, and iron to make the bathroom and enclose the toilet. She will also buy windows for the house; they are now covered with blankets. Thank God that nothing has been stolen yet. She is happy with this loan because she has been able to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stones, sand, cement, and iron to make the bathroom and enclose the toilet for better hygiene

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en: Fatmata K. (right) is approximately thirty-seven years old. She is the leader of this group called 'Hope To God'. She and her group members are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone, who want a loan of Le 800,000 each to boost their businesses. Their leader, Fatmata K. is married with five children – three of whom are attending school. She sells palm oil and has been in this business for about twenty-seven years now. Fatmata will use this loan to improve her business. She will buy fifty gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy fifty gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Analie is single. To make a living, Analie operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear items like jeans, shirts and more in the local community. Analie is just starting this business. In 2009, Analie joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Analie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El señor Jose Dolores Z. M., tiene 56 años vive en Barrio Medardo Andino, es casado y su esposa se es cajera ellos tiene un hijo, antes tenian bajo su custodia a dos mán pero se independizarón y se quedaron con la tutela del menor, actualmente el muchacho estudia pero trabaja para apoyar en los gastos del hogar, el plan principal de la familia es el realizar mejoras en su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones de vida, el señor se gana el sustento diario como albañil desde hace 20 años, dentro de las principales dificultades que han enfrentado son los ataques de asma que el señor padece y que le afecta más cuando se encuentra en su casa de habitacion, debido a las pauperrimas condiciones en las que habita que aunmentan las posibilidades de ataques con más freuencia, es por esta razon que la familia solicita este prestamo para realizar remodelaciones en su hogar con el credito comprarian materiales de construccion para comenzar con la remodelacion de corredor de su casa esto garantizara la buena salud del señor y la tranquilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Dolores Z. M. is 56 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. He is married, and his wife is a cashier. They have one child at home; previously, they had two more in their care, but those children grew up and became independent, so the couple are now taking care of only the youngest. Currently, the boy is studying, but he is also working to contribute to the household expenses. The family's central plan is to make improvements to their home, in order to raise their quality of life. Jose has earned a living as a mason for 20 years. Among the main difficulties he has faced are the asthma attacks he suffers, which affect him most strongly when he is at home. This is due to the impoverished conditions he lives in, which increase his risk of having more frequent asthma attacks. For this reason, the family is requesting the current loan in order to carry out remodeling work in their home. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to begin remodeling the open areas of their home. This will help keep Jose healthy and give his family more peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 46 years old, and she has 5 children with ages between 3 and 21. Marie lives in Nyamagabe, a region of the southern province of Rwanda. Marie has been working as a taxi driver for a long time in this province. Marie starts driving early in the morning and works until late in the evening every day.

Marie wants to create one more job for one of the people from her community. Her wish is to purchase a motorbike. Through using this motorbike, Marie hopes that the life situation of her employees will be improved and Marie' s daily revenue will increase. Through the profits she gains daily, Marie's goal is to keep helping the people from her community through purchasing some more motorbikes. With this purchase of motorbikes, Marie hopes that one day she will find herself financially stable and be able to help other people see how they too can also work for themselves.

loans.use: the purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Purok 1A Pagahan in Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Leonida is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Leonida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Leonida's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy L. is the village bank president of a group loan for 21 people offered by Kiva partner, AMK. The group is located in Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province. The members of the group will use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Chanthy L. is 36 years old and the mother of three children – one is a construction worker, one is a student in the local school, while the youngest is three years old. She owns a store that sells soup, but faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her business. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to bU. tables, chairs and other items for supporting her business. Her husband, Mr. Boramy Khut, is a teacher who receives a small salary to support his family.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and other items

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 38 años, convive con su pareja, de las cuales tiene dos hijos, y todos juntos viven en su casa propia. Por las mañanas trabaja cuidando niños, de la edad de 1 a 3 años, en un Wawa Wasi, desde las 7:00am de la mañana hasta las 4:00pm de la tarde, centro que queda a cinco cuadras de su casa. Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona tierna con todos los infantes, a todos los infantes que tiene que cuidar, y por el que ya ellos están acostumbrados a su carácter.  Por otro lado, Genoveva, aprovecha vendiendo ropa a los padres de estos infantes, dejando en la modalidad de crédito, siempre y cuando se quedan con el producto. De esa manera tiene ingresos adicionales, además vende casi toda la mercadería que tiene. Ella está contenta de cuidar niños y a la vez de vender ropa, una manera de tener doble ingresos para su hogar, es por ello que Víctor, su esposo, quien se dedica a transportar clientes en un triciclo en el interior del mercado, desea apoyarla en las compras, para que así no le falte mercadería que vender. En el futuro desea incrementar con una variedad de ropas exclusivas, siendo su mayor sueño tener un puesto en el mercado, y en donde pueda trabajar junto con su esposo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en donde reconfirma su compromiso en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, asimismo menciona que le tiene mucho aprecio a sus compañeras de su grupo solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas para niños, de esa manera tener satisfecha a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 38, lives with her life partner, with whom she has 2 children; they all live together in their own home. During the morning, from 7am to 4pm, she works caring for children between the ages of 1 and 3 in a Wawa Wasi (Quechua for Children’s Home-it’s a national child-care program for children under the age of 4), located five blocks from home. She is known for the tenderness with which she treats all the children under her care and they are all used to her way of being. On the other hand, Genoveva sells children’s clothing to these children’s parents; to insure that they keep the goods, she sells on credit. This is a way for her to earn extra income for her home; besides, she usually sells out all her merchandise. She is happy to care for children and sell clothing at the same time, a way to double her household’s income. This is why her husband, Victor, who transports passengers with his three-wheeled vehicle in the market, wants to support her with her purchases so that she won’t lack merchandise to sell. In the future, she would like to increase the variety of exclusive items, her greatest wish being to have a fixed site in the market so that she can work together with her husband. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she reconfirms her intention to repay in a timely fashion; she also mentions that she likes her fellow group members very much. She will use the funds to buy children’s clothes so that she can satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des médicaments naturels

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia T. is a 53-year-old married woman with four children who lives in San Ramon, Poblacion, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Cresencia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for nine years now and earns a living by running a jeepney and motorcycle operator business.		
		
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products: Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones to families who normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly, renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.
		
About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Grupo Brillante Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres decidió llamarse “Grupo Brillante” porque están seguras que van lograr que sus pequeños negocios crezcan ciclo con ciclo, está integrado por once brillantes mujeres que en base al esfuerzo que le dedican a sus negocios están seguras sacarán a delante a sus familias. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Pachuca, Hidalgo.

la Sra. Rosa M. de 64 años, divorciada, sus hijos ya no dependen de ella, pues ya cada uno de ellos tomo su propio camino; desde hace 30 se dedica a la venta de colchas, sabanas y productos de belleza por catalogo la cual se encarga de surtir a sus vecinas, familiares y amigos los productos que vende, gracias al apoyo de sus hijos a logrado vender también en diferentes oficinas del gobierno, así que cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

En el caso de la Sra. María Lucia Hernández la cual se casó y es madre desde los 17 años ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven, actualmente tiene 26 años y tiene ya  3 hijos uno de 9 años,  de 7 años y de 3 años respectivamente. La Sra. Mary como sus vecinos la conocen comienza a trabajar desde las 3pm para poner a cocer los elotes y realizar los esquites que vende día con día, ella espera darle una vida mejor a su familia.

Ambas señoras tienen diferentes historias, pero algo que tienen en común es que luchan a diario para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
M. R. ROSA	        VENTA DE COLCHAS Y SABANAS
B. M. NORMA	        VENTA DE ZAPATOS, ORO Y PLATA
ANGELES MONSALVO ROSA MARIA	COCINA ECONOMICA
H. H. CIRILA	VENTA DE PLATA
H. V. MARIA LUCIA	VENTA DE ELOTES Y ESQUITES
M. H. MARIA ELENA	VENTA DE COLCHAS
S. M. BLANCA ROSA	VENTA DE AVON Y COLCHAS
S. R. JUANA VIVIANA	VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y LENCERIA
G. A. VALENTINA	ESTETICA
D. V. NAYELY	        RECAUDERIA
T. A. PATRICIA	        VENTA DE ZAPATO
texts.en:
This group of women decided to call themselves the “Grupo Brillante” or "Bright Group" because they are sure that their small business will grow with each loan cycle. The members are eleven bright women who are sure that they will put their families on the right track with the effort they put into their businesses. They live in the city of Pachuca, Hidalgo. Rosa M. is 64 years old. She is divorced and her children no longer depend on her, as each of them has already gone down his or her own path in life. For 30 years, Rosa has worked selling bedspreads, sheets and beauty products by catalog. She sells a variety of products to friends, neighbors and family members. Thanks to the support of her children she has also been able to make sales in various government buildings, so she has a good number of clients. María Lucia Hernández, who is married and became a mother at 17, has had to work hard from a young age. She is now 26 years old and has 3 children who are 9, 7, and 3 years old. "Mrs. Mary," as she is known to her neighbors, starts work at 3pm cooking ears of corn and making the esquites [a dish made with corn cut off the cob] that she sells each day. She hopes to make a better life for her family. Both of these women have different stories, but what they have in common is that every day they fight to improve their quality of life. The other members of the group, listed with their businesses, are: ROSA M. R. (sale of bedspreads and sheets) NORMA B. M. (sale of shoes, gold and silver) ROSA MARIA ANGELES MONSALVO (food sales) CIRILA H. H. (sale of silver) MARIA LUCIA H. V. (sale of corn products) MARIA ELENA M. H. (sale of bedspreads) BLANCA ROSA S. M. (Avon sales and sale of bespreads) JUANA VIVIANA S. R. (sale of shoes and lingerie) VALENTINA G. A. (beautician) NAYELY D. V. (owner of a small grocery store) PATRICIA T. A. (shoe sales)

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and tomatoes to sell.

Cicilia is 47 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and only her younger child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her younger child to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Santa Fe Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal SANTA FE
Su presidenta es la señora Marisol P. de 30 años, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, azucar, harina y otros) en su domicilio, el cual atiende todos los días de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, le colabora en el negocio su hermana. Con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar arroz y fideo que son los productos que mayor demanda tienen. 
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios y necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
The SANTA FE communal bank meets in one of Pro Mujer Panamericana’s focus centers. The group president is Marisol P., 30. She has a grocery store (rice, pasta, sugar, flour, etc) in her home. She is open for business every day from 6am until 9pm; her sister helps out. She plans to use the funds to buy rice and pasta which are the items that have the most demand. The other group members have a variety of businesses and need the funds to buy merchandise, ingredients or raw materials according to the type of business each has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Benvinida

texts.en:
Benvinida A. is a 52 year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store and selling fish. She lives in Seaside North, Brgy Poblacion, Naga, Cebu City with her husband and their three adult children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 24,000.
 
Benvinida is borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can expand her store and fish vending business. This will be her 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Benvinida aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon  —a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Bakary B.  est âgé de plus de 47 ans, polygame et père de huit. Il vit avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités de commercialisation des engrais, pesticides et insecticides depuis plus de vingt ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. 
Ainsi, il sollicite ce troisième prêt, auprès de Soro Yiriwaso, qui lui permettra d’acheter, 9 sacs d’urées, 8 sacs de complexe coton et 8 sacs de complexe maïs et quelques pulvérisateurs, afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. Tous les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès du représentant de TOGUINA (une usine de fabrique d’engrais) à Sikasso dans son magasin au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. Avec une clientèle composée des agriculteurs certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit.
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Bakary B. is over 47 years old and is the polygamous father of eight. He lives with his two wives and his children in Hamdallaye, one of the more sought after neighbourhoods of the city of Sikasso (in the Third Administrative District of the Republic of Mali). He wasn't fortunate enough to go to school, but he quickly learned how to market fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides and has been in this business for more than twenty years. Because of his extensive experience in this business, he has a good reputation and many orders, but doesn't have the resources necessary to satisfy the demand. Therefore he is seeking a third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will allow him to buy 9 bags of urea, 8 bags of cotton fertilizer blend and 8 bags of maïze fertilizer blend as well as some sprayers, so that he can satisfy the needs of his ever growing client base. Both previous loans were reimbursed on time. He buys his supplies from the representative of the Toguina fertilizer factory in Sikasso, who has a store in the new Medina market in Sikasso. His clients are farmers and some pay by cash while others have lines of credit. With this loan, Mr. B. expects to make 150,000 CFA francs per month. This income will allow him to cover his and his family's living expenses, pay interest on the loan, and invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and sprayers

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa P., from the village of Allinguigan 3rd, is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jesusa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling personal products from Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange(MSE) and Natasha in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 4200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jesusa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Jesusa's fourth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jerardo Francisco

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca las mercedes Quezalguaque, actualmente se dedica a la actividad Agrícola como es la siembra de maíz y Ajonjolí, también convina otra actividad como es el traslado al país de costa Rica a trabajar de Noviembre A Mayo en la temporada de cosecha de Melones, actividad que tiene 12 años de efectuarla y de esa manera ha mejorado su nivel de vida, al momento del viaje   deja su producción aquí en su casa ya cosechado es padre de 2 hijos , un varón de 19 años estudia y trabaja con él una mujer de 30años que trabaja en una clínica provisional como cajera de farmacia, es soltera, en su casa tiene una nieta y su esposa, que son los miembros de la familia que viven juntos, se puede observar que son una familia respetosa, unida y que trabajan en conjunto para  lograr el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is a native of the district of Las Mercedes, Quezalguaque. He currently works in agriculture, for instance growing corn and sesame. He also works on contract doing other activities; for example, he moves to the country of Costa Rica to work from November to May, during the melon harvest season. He has done this work for 12 years, and it has allowed him to improve his standard of living. When he travels, he leaves his crops already harvested at home. He is the father of 2 children: a 19-year-old boy, who studies and works with him, and a 30-year-old woman who works in a health clinic as a pharmacy cashier and is single. In his home, he has a granddaughter and his wife, who are the family members who live together. It can be observed that they are a respectful and united family, and that they work together to achieve the objective of improving their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying agricultural supplies and preparing the soil

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).    

Sauda has a business of  frying samosas, chapats and pancakes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sauda sells her products at the nearby schools on a retail basis.    

Sauda has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of wheat flour, cooking oil and cowpeas (a legume). She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Sauda include transportation, the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of cooking oil, wheat flour and charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university. Sauda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of wheat flour, jerrycans of cooking oil and cowpeas (a legume)

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Success.  She is 47 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 30 and 17 years. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to financial difficulties.

For thirteen years, she has been selling bitter balls (a frequent vegetable ingredient in Liberian recipes, a variety of eggplant, also known as "jilo" or "garden eggs") and dried okra in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,000 LRD portion of this 76,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of dried okra and bitter balls.
 
She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of dried okra and bitter balls

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Âgé de 41 ans, Monsieur Daouda  C. est mariée à deux épouses père de 5 enfants et vit chez lui-même avec sa famille dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala  (Région de Sikasso).  
A cause des problèmes de famille, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études secondaires, alors il s’est intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus  auprès de son père.
Cette activité lui est très rentable et lui procure assez de revenus car il reçoit beaucoup de commandes de pièces détachées et des vitres pour auto dans le mois. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Monsieur Daouda a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt.  
Ce prêt servira à acquérir quelques pièces détachées d’occasion à Lomé. Il  effectue sa vente dans la ville  de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant  et à crédit.  
Avec l’élargissement de son activité, Daouda compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt, prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il envisage rembourser ce prêt correctement pour qu’il puisse bénéficier d’un autre dans le but d’agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
41 years of age, Mr. Daouda C. has two wives and five children, and lives with his family in the Darsalam I district in the Koutiala Prefecture (Sikasso Region).

Due to family difficulties, he has not been able to continue secondary studies, and very early started earning a living alongside his father.

This activity is profitable and brings him quite a bit of income as each months he receives many orders for spare parts and car glass. In order to better satisfy this customers’ needs and to expand his business, Mr. Daouda has turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on his first loan.

This loan will allow him to purchase some used spare parts in Lomé. He sells his wares in the town of Koutiala to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash and on credit.

By expanding his business, Daouda plans to achieve a monthly income of 150,000, which will be used to repay his loan, take care of the family needs and reinvest the remainder n his business.

He plans is to repay this loan properly in order to be able to obtain another one subsequently and continue growing his business.

loans.use: Purchasing used spare parts

loans.name: Esther Njeri

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and a single mother with five children. She has practiced farming in Olkalou town since 2003.  Esther was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan.

Esther plans to use her loan to harvest maize and plant potatoes. In the future, Esther hopes to buy more land and start farming on a larger scale.

loans.use: To harvest maize and plant potatoes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for eight years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces wheat, maize, vegetables, bananas and tea which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his lumbering business in the same location. His primary challenge in farming has been unfavorable weather conditions which affects his production. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him expand his farm and improve the livelihood of his family.

Ronald is 28 years old. He is married with four children who are between the ages of 2 and 6. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda G. is fifty years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Malipayon, part of the municipality of Pangantucan, Bukidnon province in the Mindanao islands. Yolanda buys and sells ready-to-wear and used clothing to the local community. Yolanda has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan, her sixth from HSPFI, of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional clothing to buy and sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes and for working capital

loans.name: Ruth Velia

texts.es: Ruth Velia de 49 años, tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Su vivienda es muy humilde a pesar de esto es aquí donde llegan sus clientes a solicitar sus diferentes productos. Hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar con algunos ahorros compro golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. En la actualidad tiene su negocio muy bien establecido para mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar la materia prima necesaria. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que le faltan algunas mejoras.
texts.en: Ruth Velia is 49 years old and she has a convenience store. Her home is very humble but nevertheless her clients come to her store to purchase various different products. She started out 10 years ago. With a few savings she managed to purchase snacks, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains.  She works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. With this loan she wishes to purchase merchandise. In the future she wants to finish building her home.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nerys Dario

texts.es:
el joven Nerys Dario E. es un hombre trabajador, se dedica a cortar de pelo a caballeros, esta empezando con su negocio y no tiene sillas ni sillones. en estos momentos esta teniendo varios clientes, cada dia que pasa su negocio crece y necesita los sillones y sillas para atender mejor a sus clientes. trabaja de 7 am a las 8 pm, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
el es soltero y vive con sus papas, les ayuda a sus padres economicamente para los gastos del hogar.
sus tiempos libres visita sus familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sillas y sillones para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nerys Dario E. is a hard working young man.  He dedicates himself to cutting hair for men.  He is beginning his business and does not have any chairs or benches.  He currently has many customers, everyday his business more and he needs the chairs and benches so he may better attend new customers.  He works from 7am to 8pm and his business is run from his own home.  He is unmarried  and lives with his parents.  He helps his parents economically with household expenses and visits family on his spare time.

He will use his loan for the purchase of chairs and benches so he can provide better service for his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of chairs and benches

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina S. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Florentina is married. To make a living, Florentina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Florentina earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from farming. She wants to improve her income.

Florentina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Meyling

texts.es:
La señora Meyling del Socorro V. G. de 28 años, fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de mercadería variada desde hace seis años. Ella solicito un crédito mujer, tengo derecho el cual se les proporciona a las clientas para que ellas lo utilicen para realizarse un chequeo general o para embellecerse entre otras cosas.

V. con el crédito se realizara una limpieza dental y se calzara unas muelas.
texts.en:
Meyling del Socorro V. G. is 28 years old and a hardworking and enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her work. She has worked selling varied merchandise for six years.
