She applied for a women’s loan, provided to female borrowers so that they can use it to get a checkup or to improve their appearance, among other things.

With the loan, she will have her teeth cleaned and will have some teeth filled.

loans.use: Filling and teeth cleaning

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly O. is married and has one child who attends school.  He is both a motor taxi driver and rice farmer. His wife is a weaver. They live in a village off National Road number 2, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Horl's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 members, all of whom live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Horl S., born in 1962, is the village bank president, and was selected for this position by the other members. Her husband, Mr. Soa Sophal, also born in 1962, earns a small income as a police officer, and he also helps his wife in her farming business. The couple has four children: one is a truck driver, one is a farmer, and the other two are students. 

Mrs. Horl S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow peanuts and corn for a living. Aside from being a farmer, she also sells fish at the local market.

In order to support her farming business, she is requesting a loan in order to buy peanut seeds and corn seeds, as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm in preparation for growing her crops.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and corn seeds to plant, as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow her farmin preparation for growing her crops.

loans.name: Soem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, comprised of four members, is led by Mrs. Soem, selected by the other members. Soem and her husband are farmers who own a field upon which they grow rice to earn a living. They also earn money by fishing in the local village.

This couple has four children, two of whom are iron welders, another a labourer, and the last one a student in a local school. One of her children has obtained a job in Thailand, so Soem is requesting a loan to obtain a passport for him.

loans.use: To obtain a passport for her child going to Thailand.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino G. is 43 years old and a farmer. She lives with her 21-year-old son.  Nino’s son serves as a contractor in the Georgian army.  They live in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. Five years ago Nino started a farming business. She cultivates land and sows Lucerne (alfalfa). At the same time the family owns 2 milch cows. Nino sells the dairy products locally in the village. Her average monthly income is GEL 310. 

With the borrowed 2,000 GEL Nino will cultivate her parcel and sow Lucerne. Nino plans to sell 75% of the harvested Lucerne on the market and, taking into account the current market price, she will earn GEL 1300. The reminding 25% of the Lucerne will be used for feeding her own cows. The income will be used for improvement of the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: seed of Lucerne (alfalfa seeds)

loans.name: Rutabo Twimukye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Didas G. is the leader of Rutabo Twimukye group in Kyenjojo. He is 37 years old and a very hard working and innovative man, married with children. Didas is an agriculturalist and also has a bodaboda service which he bought over two years ago to transport people to their destinations at a fee. He grows matooke, beans and other produce, while his boda services all in Rutabo – Bwizi; each enterprise earns him a daily income of 30,000/=.

A self-starter who hopes to continue expanding his businesses to greater heights, Didas now needs a loan to buy more produce such as beans, maize and matooke to stock in his business.

loans.use: to buy more produce including beans, maize and matooke to stock in his business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
La parte de atrás de la casa de Ernesto G. Álavrez es el lugar donde realiza las herraduras de acero que vende a un comercializador de la ciudfad de Medellín, el oficio lo aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre y fue cuando se casé y llegó su primer hijo cuando se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como independiente debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales en su pueblo de origen, Sonsón Antioquia. 

Ernesto es un emprendedor que sueña con ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por eso, se esfuerza día a día por mejorar la calidad de su producto y producir más para incrementar sus ventas, para ello, necesita de un préstamo con el que comprará materia prima.
texts.en:
The rear section of Ernesto G. Alvarez's house is where carries out his steel welding projects. He sells the products to a merchant in the city of Medellin. He learned the business when he was very young from his father. When he married and when he had his first child he realized the need to work independently, given the lack of work opportunities in his village of origin, Sonson Antioquia.

Ernesto is an entrepreneur that dreams of providing his family with a better quality of life and for this reason he works hard day after day to improve his products and increase production and sales. He needs a loan to purchase work materials.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials

loans.name: Perfume De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERFUME DE ROSAS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Alcira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Venta de fruta, venta de ropa, ropa de dama, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, punto VIVA y fotocopiador, ferretería, venta de frazadas.

La señora Alcira,  indica que es el primer ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, y que ingreso por invitación de la promotara. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de fruta que viene trabajando hace un mes atras.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "The Perfume of Roses" will be on their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner), as part of Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and it is governed by a board of directors which is led by Alcira. The members have various types of businesses. Among them are: fruit sales, clothing sales, ladies' clothing sales, grocery store, cosmetics sales, public telephone and photocopy center, hardware store, linen sales.

Alcira says that this is the first loan cycle for their communal bank with Pro Mujer and they joined following an invitation by a promoter. Currently she has had her business selling fruit for one month. 

The loan that she requests will be used to increase her capital funds. This business helps her generate an income to support her family in whatever possible. She lives with her common-law husband and their three children.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. It is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house in the area of Azhar colony with her family for the past many years. She is more than 50 years of age and does embroidery to help bear the financial burden of her family. Her son is also involved with her in this business. Both of them earn good income and their family is able to survive financially by their combined efforts. 

Zarina is very good at her work and receives regular orders from her neighboring customers. She has been doing this business for 10 years and has a good name in her region for the good quality of her work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her business. With this loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk quantity that will help her and her son fulfill larger orders on time and make more profits. She has a lot of confidence in herself, and is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her. 

Zarina is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident about her family’s better financial future.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 52, resident of Gamban Riverside, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a butcher, and is mother of a child who is currently studying now. At this time, she is working hard to send her child up to college. College is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Zenaida, as she herself has been an elementary graduate. She believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Zenaida operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and meats cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP40, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Zenaida dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education, through all her hard work on her business. She also prays for good health always and to be able to establish more food stalls someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat, vegetables and other raw ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de productos de la canasta básica, lo administra desde hace 15 años, trabajando de 6:00am a 7:00pm, ya que este negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, el cual surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, frijol, arroz, azúcar, y boquitas, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, manteniendo en su inventario una fuerte cantidad de cada uno de los productos antes mencionados y que son muy necesarios en los hogares de los clientes.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia, tener una fuente de ingreso que le permita cubrir en su mayoría las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and has two children.  She owns a grocery store business which she has run for 15 years.  She works from 6.00am to 7.00pm as her business is located in her own home.  She started the business through her own initiative.

María is requesting a loan to buy oil, beans, rice, sugar and snacks.  This purchase will help her to strengthen her business as she will have in stock a good quantity of every one of the aforementioned products which are essential in her customers' households.

María's goal is to support her family and to have a source of income that allows her to cover most of her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, sugar and snacks

loans.name: Diego Albaro

texts.es:
El señor Diego Albaro es casado, tiene 28 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educación básica, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para todas las edades y como también a la confección de camisas, inicio trabajando con el padre y adopto este trabajo que hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de materia prima el cual consiste en telas, hilo, aceite de máquina, ya que en el futuro espera ver su negocio con mas capital y mejor.
texts.en:
Señor Diego Albaro is married and 28-years-old.  He went to school through the third grade.  He has 2 children, who are in school.  He makes a living by selling clothing for people of all ages and also makes shirts.  He started working with his father and then started this job.  He has 10 years of experience.

He decided to request a loan that will let him buy materials he needs like fabric, thread, and oil for his sewing machine.  In the future, he hopes to have more capital for his business and to improve it.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Mujeres Emprendedoras está conformado por personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Cristian Isabel forma parte de este grupo tiene 2 hijos menores de edad su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general hace 3 años, el financiamiento es para la compra ropa en general, cosmeticos, ropa interior ya que tiene de administrarlo ha a pesar de que no ha sido fácil por la gran competencia que tiene. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir experiencia y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) solidarity group has hard-working members who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through their daily efforts, provide their children with a better future.

Cristian Isabel is a member of this group.  She has two dependent children and her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for three years.  She will use her loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and underwear.  She has to run her business in spite of the fact that it has not been easy owing to the competition that she faces.  Over time, she has managed to gain experience and keep improving every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст 61 год. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж и дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Турсун занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 35 лет. Кредит берет для покупки оптом новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Tursun lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 61 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband and children are working in the Russian Federation.  Tursun is involved in fabrics sales at a market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics.  She has been involved in this business for 35 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics wholesale

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is 31 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children. All of her children are presently in school. For the past five years, she has been selling Fufu (an African food made from cassava) in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase five bags of Fufu (an African food made from cassava) for her business. She plans to educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of Fufu

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years old, married, and has two children aged five years old and three years old. He runs a battery charging business at Kinanie market in Kitengela and is known by the name Neema Battery Charging. He has been running this business for eight months and has provided employment to one person. Daniel plans to use his loan to buy a welding machine to grow his business through diversifying to welding. 

Daniel hopes to grow his business to become a market leader in battery charging in Kitengela. He describes himself as determined.

loans.use: to buy a welding mchine

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman who has two children, one boy and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past three years, she has been selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and high costs of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a tea leaves business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and to establish a tea leaves business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and to establish a tea leaves business.

loans.name: Angel Fausto

texts.es:
Angel Fausto tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Angel se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha.  Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir cultivando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de Paseo a Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Angel Fausto, 50, is single and has no children.  He lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province.

The communal bank "El Placer" is located in the canton of Chillanes in San Jose del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San Jose.  In this communal bank there are 24 members who are farmers cultivating bananas, rice, cassava, cocoa, soy and oranges, and also members who raise barnyard animals.  

Angel is a farmer who cultivates rice, corn, oranges, soybeans and bananas.  He makes his purchases in San Jose del Tambo, and he sells his products in the Chillanes market on Sundays at the fair.

He requests a loan to buy farming supplies.  This loan will help him to have a better harvest.  His dream is to buy land so that he can continue to farm.  

In his free time he likes to go to Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nery Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Nery tiene 30 años D. edad, esta casada con 4 hijos.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora, hace un año ella vio la oportunidad D. iniciar su propio negocio poniendo una tienda en su casa. Ella comenzó vendiendo sólo un par D. productos, pero en el lugar donD. vive no habían tiendas y detectó la demanda en su comunidad. Asi es que despues decidió ofrecer productos D. primera necesidad, y D. esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Para comprar los productos, ella debe trasladarse a la cuidad. Para llegar ahí ella debe caminar dos kilómetros y medio a pie, que toma 20 minutos, luego aborda un bus que se tarda en llegar a la ciudad 10 minutos. Ella compra algunos productos en la ciudad y otros se los llevan a su casa los distribuidores.

Ella tiene una gran demanda, por eso tiene el deseo D. ofrecer mas variedad D. productos. La señora Nery solicita un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para comprar verduras, pollo, fríjol, entre otros; y aumentar la cantidad D. los productos que ya venD.. Con esto ella tendrá mayor variedad D. productos, por lo que llamará la atención D. sus clientes y podrá atraer otros nuevos.
 
El espacio que tiene disponible para su tienda es muy pequeño, por lo que en un futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio. A la señora Nery tambien le gustaría ampliar su casa, ya que actualmente viven 6 personas en dos habitaciones. Además, ella quiere brindarles a sus hijos una educación para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Nery is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She is an enterprising woman; just a year ago she saw the opportunity to begin her own business out of her house. She began by selling a couple of products only, but in the place where she lives there are no shops so she soon realized there was demand for other items. She then started to sell all the basics and in this way help her husband with household expenses.

To buy the products Nery has to travel to the city. She first walks two and a half kilometres which takes 20 minutes, and then catches a bus which arrives in the city ten minutes later. Some of the products are bought in the city while others are delivered to her house by suppliers. 

There is a big demand for the merchandise so Nery wishes to offer a greater variety of products. She is seeking a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy vegetables, chicken, beans etc. so she has more stock to sell. In turn this will attract the attention of her current customers and bring in new ones.

As the space she has available in her house for the store is very small, in the future she would like to have a bigger area and enlarge her house. At the moment six people share two bedrooms. As well Nery would like to proviD. her children with a good education so they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, beans etc. for her store

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children going to school.  They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated livestock for the sale of cow milk.  She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.  During dry season it becomes difficult for the cows to get grass to feed on.  Tabu dreams of expanding and purchasing another cow in the future in order to better her living standards.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cow feeds and medicine for the treatment of her livestock.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cow feeds and medicine for the treatment of her livestock.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth, 47 years old, is a grocery seller earning $3 per day.  Her husband sells ice-cream, earning $2 per day.  They have five children, three are studying and two more are working.  Each earns $3 per day.  Every month, Reth has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cattle to sell.  The loan will help her husband to start a new career that can earn further income.  She also plans to extend her grocery store by buying more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a married man with four children who are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Rashid has operated a dry fish selling business for the past year; in addition he runs a motorbike transportation business. His potential clients are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge with rising commodity prices in the market. He aspires to expand his business.

With this KES 10,000 loan, he wants to increase his stock of fish for resale. He decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it offers loan facilities with low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ines

texts.es: La señora  Mary es cliente antigua, se dedica a la confección y venta de deportivos, buzos, poleras, chamarras en su tienda, hace varios años trabajaba en la republica Argentina como costurera, viendo su calidad en la mano de obra ella decidió volver al país para iniciar  un negocio propio, se vino con sus dos hijas y abrió una tienda de artículos deportivos de y ropa deportiva, la señora es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, ella también confecciona en su taller propio pero prefiere dedicarse  al comercio ya que adquiere los productos al  mayor y vende  por menor, esta muy contenta de poder acceder a un crédito Kiva, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería par este fin de año  y con el tiempo desea abrir una  nueva tienda.
texts.en:
Mary is a long-standing customer who makes and sells sports clothing, tracksuits, t-shirts and jackets in her store.  Several years ago, she worked in Argentina as a seamstress.  Seeing her quality of workmanship, she decided to return home to Bolivia and start her own business.  She came with her two daughters and opened a store selling sporting goods and sports clothing.

Mary is very hard-working and has a great desire to do well in life.  She makes clothes in her own workshop but she prefers to sell as she acquires her products wholesale and sells them retail.  She is very happy that she is able to access a Kiva loan.  She will use her loan money to buy merchandise for the end-of-year season.  Over time, she would like to open another store.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise for the end-of-year season

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “San Miguel” donde integran 15 señoras de respetable reputación y muy bien recordadas como mujeres capaces de luchar en sus vidas por un mejor futuro. 
Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen quicenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayudarse unas a otras en sus tareas de desarrollo de su situación económica. 
Muchas de ellas son comerciantes (vendedoras ambulante de mercería, despensas en sus casas, venta de frutas y verduras). Algunas realizan trabajos artesanales del  tradicional tejido en  Ao po'i. 
Estas señoras están muy contentas de participar en el programa, pues mediante esta empresa de microcrédito mejoran sus entradas económicas. 
La señora Rosalina se dedica a la confección de prendas o tejidos de ao po'i, el cual es una artesanía de nuestro país, muy apreciado por los compatriotas y muy adquirido por su belleza por los extranjeros. 
Es muy sacrificada esta actividad pues no siempre hay buenas ventas, depende mucho de las temporadas estacionales, pero de igual manera trata de formar una clientela para cada época a fin de poder mantener su nivel de comercio. 
Es una mujer muy preparada en cuanto a la habilidad de comercializar y por eso es que las personas la aprecian mucho y no la dejan como proveedora de esta artesanía. 
Su sueño es poder tener algún día su propia tienda de tejidos y prendas de ao po'i, ahora pide un préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para poder comprar las telas y los hilos necesarios para seguir produciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called “San Miguel” and consists of 15 women who have respectable reputations and are well-remembered as capable individuals who have strived all of their lives to achieve a better future. These women are from the city of Villarrica. All of them are neighbors and friends. They meet every 15 days in order to support and help one another in various tasks that will develop their financial situations. Many of them are merchants (selling sewing supplies as traveling vendors, managing food stores from their homes, or selling fruits and vegetables). Some of them make handicrafts out of “ao po’i” (a fine cotton cloth unique to Paraguay that is used for embroideries). The women are very pleased with their participation in the program because the microloans from the organization have helped to improve their financial ventures.

Sra. Rosalina makes clothes and woven items out of “ao po’i” since these Paraguayan crafts are well-appreciated by the locals and admired for their beauty by those who live outside of the country. Her business requires great sacrifice because she does not always have good sales. She relies mostly on seasonal sales. However, she tries to maintain her customer base for each season so that she can keep her business afloat.

Rosalina is always prepared when it comes to her sales ability. For this reason, people greatly appreciate her and are not willing to do business with other craft vendors. Her dream is to someday have her own shop where she can sell woven crafts and clothes made of “ao po’i”. Rosalina is now requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy the fabrics and thread that she needs to continue producing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for embroidering.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a tailoring business and selling clothes to make a living. He also raises livestock to supplement his income. 

Since Francis joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next 5 years, he plans to open another clothing outlet.   He has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of fabric for making clothes. Francis dreams of buying a piece of land.

loans.use: to add to his stock of fabric.

loans.name: Bahombeho Group

texts.fr:
Jean Joram  fait partie du groupe Bahombeho. Il a 36 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 mois à 4 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Joram  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Joram  voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Joram is a member of the group Bahombeho. He is 36 years old, and he is married with three children ranging in age from 2 months to 4 years old. He attended 6 years of primary school.

Jean Joram is rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his credit to buy fertilizers. His business growth strategy is to be selective in the rice seed that he sows. 

In the coming years, Jean Joram would like to become the local rice supplier. He plans to use his profits to provide for his children’s education and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.ru: Оинисо разведенная женщина и на  воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 3 лет она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Она продает женские и детские одежды. Она имеет хороший опыт и успешна в своем деле. Оиннисо хотела бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента одежды с целью увлечения оборотного капитала и расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Oiniso is a divorced woman, who is raising two children.  She has been involved in sales at the central market for over three years.  She sells women's and children's clothing.  She has a good experience and is successful in her business.  Oiniso wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni to purchase a new selection of clothing in order to increase working capital and expand her business.  She relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to expand her business

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is 40 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Keren Noelia Yamaly

texts.es:
Keren tiene 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chiclayo, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Derecho que tanto desea, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar dulces y postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cabrito a la Norteña para compartir con su familia.

Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Keren trabaja como vendedora en una tienda comercial de abarrotes de su ciudad, adicionalmente ella prepara deliciosos postres para su venda y también vende productos cosméticos, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y el trato amble que brinda a sus clientes.

Keren se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y  gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la comprar mercadería, tales como cosméticos y perfumes; de esta manera Keren tendrá su pequeño negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado para poder ofrecer sus productos, así ella espera incrementar sus vetas e ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y junto a su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Keren is 18 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Chiclayo. In spite of being so young, she is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, because of the need to work to pay her expenses and support her parents, she was not able to study for the career in law that she so much wanted, but she dreams of being able to do it someday. In her free time, she likes to prepare sweets and desserts, and sometimes she cooks a very delicious "cabrito a la norteña" (goat northern style) to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Keren works every day as a sales person in a grocery store in her city. In addition, she prepares delicious desserts to sell and also sells cosmetic products. She can work about 10 hours [a day] and feels that it is going well for her because of her dedication and the kind treatment that she offers her customers.

Keren is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since this is the second time that they have offered her their great support, and thanks to the help offered, she will be able to make the purchase of merchandise such as cosmetics and perfumes. In this way Keren will have her little business better stocked and set up to offer her products. Thus she hopes to increase her sales and income, which will help her a lot so that in the not too distant future she can expand her business and be able to advance, along with her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (cosmetics and perfumes)

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a very hardworking man. He is not afraid of getting his hands dirty for the sake of his family.
He is married with three children all in high school and he is the bread winner. 
He lives with his family in Gakui sublocation, Thika district, central kenya. 
He and his wife are dairy farmers. They have Seven cows producing 20 liters of milk per day. This they sell at ksh 30, earning around ksh 18,000 per month.
However with the many family responsibilities he could not save enough to have a biogas constructed for him, so he took a loan with VEP of ksh 100,000 to help facilitate this.
His energy expense include one bag of charcoal per month for ksh 1,200, 20 litters of kerosine for lighting  at ksh 1600 and firewood which he doesnt buy but his wife spends atleast 2 hours a day to go collect.
With Biogas, he will be able to save that money, He and his wife can have some time to rest or do other chores while they will as well enjoy a cleaner smoke free kitchen.
He says happily that with biogas, he can also enjoy cooking for his wife once in a while as a treat or when the wife is not around he will not have a problem warming his food as its easy to light a biogas jiko.
Savings from fuel expenses and income from the sale of milk will enable him pay for the loan comfortably while enjoying convinient cooking and lighting.

loans.use: TO INSTAL A BIOGAS

loans.name: Pauline Tétédé

texts.fr: Pauline Tétédé âgée de 52 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Pauline Tétédé est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Gabriel. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certain scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pauline Tétédé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pauline Tétédé vend depuis vingt un ans à son domicile du maïs, du riz, des  savons et de l’huile végétale. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pauline Tétédé achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Pauline Tétédé sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz, des  savons et de l’huile végétale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase2 dairy cows.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie was born on December 12, 1955. She is married and a mother of eight children. She sells women’s clothing, shoes, handbags, beverages and purified water. She started the business in 1968 when she was fifteen years old by selling firewood. In the meantime, Anne has gained experience in different kinds of businesses.  Currently, her business is popular in the area. Anne has managed to increase her clientele, but she is not able to fully meet the demand, which is why she needs US$1200. Her current business capital is US$2312. She especially wants to increase the sales of purified water, which is highly demanded and very important for the health of people in her community.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of purified water and women’s clothing

loans.name: Alba Alicia

texts.en:
My name is Alba Alicia, I'm a business woman and run a clothing store situated in the town square. I've been doing this for several years and it provides me enough income to support my family and purchase goods from service providers. Thanks to my business I can provide my children with an education, since I am a single mother.

Mi nombre es Alba Alicia, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio puedo dar educacion a mis hojos ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase jeans, shirts, underwear, blouses, children's shirts, mosquito nets, bath towels and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: “I have been sewing clothes at home for the past 22 years with my daughters. I live in a small town located about 200km from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. All my children work but my family requires a loan for our furniture and rent-a-bike business. We will then be able to purchase more wood and a second hand motor bike for renting to customers in our town.” Hamida B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase materials for rent-a-bike and furniture shops

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kormen

texts.id:
Since her husband’s income as a farmer is not enough and stable, Wayan Kormen (Wayan Suarka’s wife) started the pig farming business to support her family’s life with increasing daily life expenses. With Rp.800,000 (about $87) as the initial capital, Wayan Kormen bought 1 female pig. The female pig can give birth to 4 to 11 piglets every 6 months. 1 piglet can be sold for Rp.150,000 (about $16) to Rp.175,000 (about $19). From selling the piglets, Wayan Kormen usually earns Rp.750,000 (about $82) of profit per 6 months. However, this profit is not enough for the daily family expenses; therefore, Wayan Kormen will need to expand the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani tidak mencukupi dan tidak rutin setiap hari maka Wayan Kormen istri dari Wayan Suarka menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dimaksud untuk menunjang ekonomi Rumah Tangga, yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000 Wayan Kormen membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Dari induk babi yang dipeliharanya bisa melahirkan 4 -11 ekor anak babi setiap 6 bulannya. Satu ekor biasanya dijual Rp.150.000 sampai Rp.175.000. Dari penjualan anak babi ini biasanya Wayan Kormen mendapat keuntungan Rp.750.000 per 6 bulan sekali. Namun penghasilan tersebut masih terasa kurang untuk memenuhi kebutuhan setiap harinya untuk itu Wayan Kormen akan terus mengembangkan usahanya.

loans.use: To add more growing pigs and pig's food

loans.name: Umyati

texts.en: Umyati is 40 years old and is married. She produces cakes and sells them by going around the village. At home, she sells flavoured ice sticks, and can earn $5 per day. Her husband has no fixed income. Umyati is requesting a IDR 1,000,000 loan to expand her business in order to supplement their income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha belongs to the Activas communal bank and lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali department. She is the 59-year-old mother of six children, and her husband is a carbon salesman. Thanks to her first loan from Manuela Ramos for $100, she decided to open a small store where she sells retail groceries. Currently, she relies on this grocery store that she runs out of her own home. She wakes up early to prepare breakfast for her children, and then devotes herself to her business.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for $625, which she will repay in five months, she will stock her grocery with three boxes of milk, three boxes and one package of crackers, eight boxes of eggs, two units of canned goods, four palettes of toilet paper, and one packet of noodles. Martha is very pleased to see her business prosper; thanks to it, she is earning her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Activas, vive en el Pasaje Micaela Bastidas Mz. 32 Lt. 15, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 59 años de edad y es madre de 6 hijos, su espeso es carbonero (venta de carbón). Gracias al primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decidió poner una pequeña bodega para la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su propia casa, se levanta temprano para preparar el desayuno a sus hijos, y después de dedica a su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,800, (US$ 603.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su bodega con 03 cajas de leche, 03 cajas de galletas, 08 cajas de huevo, 02 doc. de conservas, 04 planchas de papel higiénico, 01 paquete de fideo, 01 paquete de galletas. Martha está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, y gracias a él está logrando el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted groceries

loans.name: Kazinga B(Iv) Group

texts.en: Christine is 32 years old and married wih four children. She owns a retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to construct a modern shade for her market stall.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for her retail shop

loans.name: Ethel Johana

texts.es:
Señora Ethel is a single mother of three small children. Two years ago she decided to begin her small business in her humble dwelling, located in the Laureles Norte Neighborhood, due to the lack of economic support from the father of her children. She decided to open a shop for toothpaste, toilet paper, milk, caramels, bread, etc. that in Nicaragua they call a pulpería. She began this micro business with her own resources and it has continued growing little by little with financing from AFODENIC.

The people of her community have few economic resources, just like her, and every morning they buy their breakfast for that day according to their means. Ethel works at the business seven days a week from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. She requests the loan to expand the space in her house where she has this small business, and thus to be able to sell more products since at this time her customers are demanding new products. She does not have any place to put them due to the small space. Enlarging her shop will give her more income to supply the needs of her children, in consideration of the fact that this is their only source of support.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ethel es madre soltera de tres hijos pequeños, desde hace 2 años decidió montar su pequeño negocio en su humilde vivienda, ubicado en el Barrio Laureles Norte, debido a la falta de apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos decide abrir una ventecita de pasta de diente, papel higiénico, leche, caramelos, pan , etc. que en Nicaragua le llamamos pulpería, empezó este micro negocio con recursos propios el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco con financiamiento de AFODENIC.

La población de su comunidad son de escasos recursos económicos al igual que ella y compran todas las mañanas el desayuno de ese día según sus posibilidades. La señora se dedica al negocio, los siete días de la semana desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 p.m.La señora solicita el préstamo para ampliar el espacio que en su casa esta su pequeño negocio, y así poder colocar a la venta mas productos ya que en estos momentos le están demandando nuevos productos que ella no tiene donde colocarlos debido al pequeño espacio y el hacer un poco mas grande su venta le dara mas ingresos para suplir las necesidades de sus hijos en vista que esta es su única fuente de entrada.

loans.use: To enlarge the size of her shop so that she can offer more items for sale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Antonio N. is 46 years old and a native to the Quelimane district in the Zambezia province. As a child Antonio did not have the opportunity to study and only attended school until the 4th grade. He says he grew up with his mother and stepfather. At age 15 he affiliated himself with the F.A.L.M. where he stayed for 5 years until he was discharged. He was living in the province of Maputo at the time and in the same year he returned to Quelimane again and began working in a family carpentry shop with the goal to learn the art.

He married a young girl who months later became pregnant and everything in Antonio's life changed. The cost of living increased so he decided to return to the city of Maputo leaving his wife with her parents. In Maputo he was able to win a contract to work in South Africa; this in 1986 when the first President of Mozambique, Samora Machel died. This situation forced the authorities to cancel the contracts with Mozambique emigrants so he ended up working that year in a restaurant in Catembe.

In 1994 he changed jobs working as a carpenter in the town of Bela-Vista. In 1998 he ended his contract and, tired of looking for work, opened a small business producing furniture. With the difficulty of acquiring wood in the local market he almost gave up on the activity but with access to credit through HLUVUKU he opted to run the business with financing. With this loan he intends to purchase wood in the city of Maputo. With his business he can support a family of 8 people and with the savings he is building a home with conventional materials. He also works with 2 other people who are heads of households.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio N., de 46 anos de idade ,natural do Distrito de Quelimane, provincia da Zambezia, durante a sua infáncia não teve possibilidade de estudar, tendo frequentado até 4ª classe, diz que cresceu com a mae e o padrasto. Aos 15 anos foi afiliar se as F.A.L.M, onde ficou durante cinco ano dai foi desmobilizado, dizer que a desmobilizaçao ocorreu na provincia de maputo onde ate entao se encontrava e no mesmo ano volta a Quelimane provincia de origem e começou a trabalhar numa carpintaria Familiar com o proposito de aprender a arte. Lá se casa com uma jovem que meses depois ficou gravida e, tudo mudou na vida dele, o custo de vida aumentou e assim decidiu voltar á cidade de Maputo, deixando a esposa com os pais e em maputo veio a conseguir um contrato para ir trabalhar na Africa do Sul, isto em 1986 ano que morreu o primeiro presidente de Moçambique Samora Machel, situaçao que obrigou as autoridades a cancelar os contratos de emigrantes Moçambicanos, ainda no mesmo ano regressa e passa a trabalhar num restaurante na Catembe. Em 1994 muda de emprego, passando a desempenhar funcoes de carpinteiro na vila de Bela-Vista. Em 1998 termina o contrato de trabalho e cansado de pedir emprego abriu uma micro empresa de producao de mobiliario. Com a dificuldade de aquisicao de madeira no mercado local quase que disistia da actividade, mas com facilidade de acesso ao credito na HLUVUKU optou por recorrer a esta instituicao para o financiamento. Com o emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar madeira na cidade de Maputo. Com este negocio consegue suportar uma familia de 8 pessoas, e com as poupancas esta a construir uma casa de material convecional. Tambem trabalha com outras duas pessoas chefes de familias.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture Making

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en: Pisa A., 44, is married to a farmer and they have 5 children together.  She is wishing to enter the taro selling business.  She will use her loan to purchase 2 bush knives, 2 knife filings, and 2,500 taro roots.

loans.use: Purchase knives, filings and taro roots

loans.name: Jane-Mary

texts.en: Jane-Mary (aged 52) has a bar which she has owned and managed since 2001.  She opens seven days a week from mid-morning until midnight selling a variety of beers and spirits to the public.  She has two workers, who are paid $12 each per month and allowed to sleep in a room she has built for them at the back of the bar.  She is looking to borrow funds to enable her to buy beer in large quantities and therefore increase her profits.  She can buy one crate of beer for $19 and sell it for $25.  Jane-Mary has 4 children who are all married and she pays the school fees for her 4 grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy beer in large quantities for her bar and therefore increase profits.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en: Fayza is a 40-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Fayza sells gold. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Huyền năm nay 48 tuổi. Là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1997 đến nay qua  nhiều vòng vốn chị đều là người sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Khi bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình,  chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ biết cách làm ăn và chăm chỉ kinh tế của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được tăng lên. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 2 con đã khôn lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15 triệu đồng đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ thán

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Palakiyem

texts.fr:
Born on March 10, 1970 in Elavagnon, a village situated in the Plateau Region of Togo, Mrs. Palakiyem T. moved to Lomé where she works in the sale of teak wood. She is married to Mr. Kpegouni Tchatikpi, who is a taxi driver. She has two children and handles their school expenses. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 60 teak trunks so that she can better serve her clients, who are primarily the bakers of her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 mars 1970 à Elavagnon, village situé dans la région des plateaux au Togo, madame T. Palakiyem s’est installée à Lomé où elle exerce le commerce de rechutes de teck. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur TCHATIKPI Kpegouni qui est un conducteur de taxi. Elle a deux enfants et s’occupe de leur frais de scolarité. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 60 rechutes de teck afin de bien servir ses clients qui sont pour la plupart les boulangers de son quartier.

loans.use: Purchase of teak wood

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hậu năm nay 25 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 2 con còn nhỏ. Tuy còn trẻ nhưng chị Hậu đã có 6 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực buôn bán nhỏ. Ngay từ khi mới bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị đã sử dụng vốn vay để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình và cho thu nhập 500.000đ/ tháng. Anh Điểu chồng chị hàng ngày cũng tham gia công việc kinh doanh cùng vợ nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình rất thuận lợi. Đến nay qua một thời gian sử dụng vốn hiệu quả thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng lên và đạt mức bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Kết hợp với  chăn nuôi  kinh tế của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vì thế chị cũng có điều kiện hơn trong việc chăm sóc và đầu tư cho các con ăn học.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn để kinh doanh, buôn bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Hai is 25 years, she has 2 small children. Even though she is young, Ms. Hai has already had 6 years of experience doing a variety of small businesses. Since becoming a member of this organization, she has been using the loans she received to invest in the family’s business, averaging then 500.000d/month. Mr. Dieu, her husband, also work with her making it easier to run the business together. She has seen a huge success after doing business for some time; her income has increase to an average of 2.000.000d/month. Combining the family’s business and raising farm animals, their income has been stable. The family’s steady flow of income has provided an opportunity for her to invest into her children’s education. This next loan, she is requesting an amount of 10.000.000d to invest into a variety of trades.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Greetings from Alphonse in Gisenyi, Rwanda! He is 25 years old and single but cares for an adopted child.

Alphonse has been in the phone repair business for a number of years. He repairs mobile phones for the local people in his town. Many local people have mobile phones for their business activities. 

Alphonse is requesting a loan worth 300,575 Frws to buy materials like batteries and chargers for his business.The loan repayment period is eight months.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business.

loans.name: Rodrigo Jaime

texts.es: El Señor Rodrigo Jaime A. es propietario de un vehiculo automotor, el cual lo empezo a trabajar como Taxi, desde que se idenpendizo de sus padres, actualmente cuenta en su vehiculo con un radio transmisor que es de propiedad de la empresa en la que trabaja, el monto solicitado lo empleara para la compra de un nuevo radio transmisor y para el mantenimiento respectivo de la movilidad, ya que el señor trabaja con empresas hoteleras y realiza el servicio de transporte a las personas extranjeras que llegan a conocer nuestro país, para llevarlos a los lugares de destino turísticos de la ciudad de La paz, Bolivia entre ellos: mallasa, tiahuanaco, el lago titicaca, zongo, y muchos otros lugares. Es un padre responsable y un buen esposo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Jaime A. is an automobile owner and has worked as a taxi driver since he left his parents’ house. Currently, he has a radio transmitter owned by the company he works for. With this loan, he will buy a new radio transmitter to maintain his mobility while he works with hotels offering transportation services to tourists visiting his country. He takes them to tourist destinations near La Paz, Bolivia including Mallasa, Tiahuanaco, Lake Titicaca, Zongo, and many more places. He is a responsible father and a good husband.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase radio equipment and maintain his car

loans.name: Bodjonam

texts.fr:
Madame H. Bodjonam est née en 1976 à Kara, une ville située au nord de Togo. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2005, elle exerce le commerce de céréales (haricot, maïs, etc.) au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle soutient ses enfants et paye les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de haricot et 10 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bodjonam H. was born in 1976 in Kara, a city in northern Togo. She is divorced and has two (2) children. Since 2005, she has run a business selling cereals (beans, maize, etc.) in the market at Agoè, a district in the north of Lomé. With the income from this business, she supports her children and meets the household expenses. Currently, her stock is depleted and she would like to re-supply herself. For this purpose, she is asking for this loan (her first) to buy 6 bags of beans and 10 bags of maize.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cereals

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
En su pequeña casa del barrio julio Sánchez de Nindiri Doña Maria  elabora la comida que los fines de semana oferta en los cuadros de béisbol de la localidad,  mujer de 56 años quien atiende al público, hace la comida y limpia sin dejar de sonreír. Ella es la dueña del negocio, que inició dos años con un primer préstamo de ADIM y hoy está ya participando en un cuarto ciclo. Comenzó con un monto de $85.00 (ochenta y cinco dólares) y en la actualidad maneja un monto de $400.00 con un buen record crediticio.  Fue capacitada desde un inicio en como administrar el negocio, saber economizar y mantenerse al día con sus abonos, lo que ha sido la clave del éxito que ha alcanzado. 

Maria Elsa sueña con hacer un poco mas grande su comidería, comprar  mesa, sillas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes está segura que va lograr su sueño pues la vida le ha demostrado que trabajando duro, economizando y siendo responsable con los compromisos adquiridos se puede salir adelante. Todo depende del amor que se le ponga, además se siente bien agradecida con adim por la oportunidad que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
In her small home in the Julio Sanchez de Nindiri neighborhood, Doña Maria cooks meals to sell on the weekends near the local baseball fields. Doña Maria is 56 years old, and is constantly smiling as she cooks, serves her clients and cleans up. She owns the business, which she launched two years ago with the help of a loan from ADIM. Today, she is beginning her fourth loan cycle, and has good credit history. She began with US$85, and is now taking out a loan of US$400. She was trained in business administration since she first started the business, so she knows how to keep costs down and keep daily records of her sales; this is the key to her success. Maria Elsa dreams of expanding her food stand and of buying tables and chairs to make her clients more comfortable. She is certain that she will achieve her dreams, since life has taught her that you can get ahead by working hard, saving money and being responsible with your obligations. Everything depends on how much love you put into it, and she feels very grateful to Adim for the opportunity they are providing her with.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve working conditions, make her customers more satisfied by buying tables and chairs

loans.name: Poay

texts.en:
Poay T. is a rice farmer who makes very little money. She is 44 years old and lives with her four children, two children are currently employed. One works as a security guard at Angkor Temple and a daughter sells souvenirs. They work very hard to provide a good income for their family. 

Poay T. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work to reduce the cost  her children spend everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en: Rabiha, 35, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Rabiha owns a household electrical appliances shop. She is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Rabiha has requested a loan. Her clients are her family members, friends, and neighbors.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa O. is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kishwar Sultana Javed Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kishwar sultana baji is a 36 year old married lady and a citizen of Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 5 years. Kishwar baji completed her education up to the 8th standard and left her education because, due to her mother’s illness, her presence became essential at home. Kishwar baji was married at the age of 18. Her husband’s name is J. I. and he runs a movie-making business. He has been in this profession for the last 6 years. Kishwar baji is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near the house.

Kishwar baji operates a clothes sewing business. She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. With the income she pays off the school fees of her children. Her husband bears the household expenses. Kishwar baji’s brother-in-law also lives with her family. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw. Kishwar baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her brother-in-law, so that he earns the whole amount of his fares.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji and Farida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Shazia parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El M. was born in 1970 and has been living in Phnom Penh City for years. She presently works as a garment worker in the garment factory, which is located near her house. She usually works for eight hours per day with a specific salary of $80 a month to manage her family's living expenses and especially to make sure her three children, who are students, receive the highest educations. 

Her husband helps support the family by fishing in and around the public lakes. The family's living conditions are not comfortable because their house has some broken parts and the polluted environment. Therefore, M. has requested a loan to repair her house and proposes to use the remainder of the loan to buy a boat for her husband's fishing.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza L. is a rice farmer. She is 39 years old, married, and has no child yet. She want to earn more from her farm. In that way, she could help her parents and siblings out in their family finances. Her husband, Randy L., is the one managing the rice farm business. In addition to rice, the couple grows vegetables at the back of their house to supplement their income.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy five bags of fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. The loan will help Riza manage her small farm.

CEVI provides their clients with not just loans. It also gives training and insurance coverage services to help small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió construir la casa donde  ahora vive muy feliz junto a su esposo e hijo. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, pues visita a todos sus vecinos y amistades con el fin de ofrecerles sus prendas, dándoles facilidades de pago, ya que realiza sus cobros semanalmente. Este negocio se ha convertido en una de las principales actividades económicas dentro de su hogar por lo que trata de mejorar la atención a sus clientes para la recomienden con otras personas. Y para incrementar sus ingresos, está ahorrando para comprar una máquina de coser, y así también trabajar como costurera para las fábricas que tienen interés en su mano de obra. A pesar de estar sólo un año en el grupo conformado en MFP, ha sabido relacionarse adecuadamente con todas sus compañeras, quienes vienen trabajando con mucha responsabilidad. Con los 800 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería y comprará prendas para la temporada de invierno que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a hard working women and with a lot of hard work she has built her house. She now lives happily in this house with her husband and son. About 2 years ago she started making a living by selling clothing. She visits all her neighbors and friends with the intention of selling them clothes and lets them make weekly payments on the clothes they buy. This business has become one of her family's main ways of making a living. She tries to give her customers the best service possible so that they will recommend her business to other people and she will be able to increase her income. She is saving to buy a sewing machine and that way she can also work as a seamstress for a factory that is interested in her as a worker. Despite the fact that she has only been in the MFP group for one year she has gotten to know the members very well and they are all hard workers like she is. With the $275 (800 Soles) she wants to increase her merchandise and buy clothes for the winter season that is coming soon.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Her Merchandise

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Mrs. Susana A. is 52 years old, married to Mr. Rogelio A. and blessed with 2 children. She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative under the PDP-LP program last April 16, 2007. Her one child is already married and the other one is working in Dubai. Currently, she's requesting a loan in the amount of 18,000 as additional capital for her existing project, which is a sari-sari store. She just hopes that her sari-sari store will become mini-grocery someday. And for her family, she hopes that someday also they could build a new house.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale is business oriented. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. Bolale is 36 years old and married with six children. Bolale hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells cosmetics and hair extensions. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and hair extensions to sell. Fumilayo is 30 years old and married to K., who is a taxi driver. They have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Boafo Ne Nyame Group

texts.en:
Sophia is married and mother of three children. Currently, two of her children are in school whilst her last born is still breastfeeding. She is a 35-year-old petty trader who sells clothing materials. She is very hard-working woman who works very hard to cater for herself, her children and her business backed by her husband's support. She sells cloth for sewing garments, shoes, slippers, and lace materials. She started her business three years ago. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

Sophia treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital she buys little because of inadequate funds. She sells her goods at the community market center. For this reason she requests a loan to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Boafo Ne Nyame’ which literary means 'Our helper is God'. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a member of the Mgodi North in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Getrude started her Tailoring own business 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Getrude first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material like vitenge.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Getrude hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy moreMaterial ( vitenge)

loans.name: Gloria Teodora

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Gloria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de una prima, además Gloria se dedica a la agricultura de papa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gloria son construir su casa y tener un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Desarrollo Community Bank. Gloria, 41, is in a common law marriage and has four children. Gloria has a restaurant in a rented location. She works there every day with help from a cousin. Also, Gloria grows potatoes. Gloria needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy soft drinks, rice, and sugar. Gloria’s dreams are to build her house and to have a restaurant in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Djurakul

texts.en:
S. Djurakul is a 63-year-old farmer, who believes that he is the richest man in the world considering that he has 5 adult children. Djurakul has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. He has 7 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Djurakul’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for $1200 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Djurakul is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Maria Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias está ubicado en el  cantón Paute a unos 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, goza de un  clima templado favoreciendo para el cultivo  de flores y una gran variedad de frutas, además nos ofrece  un gran paisaje y un lugar muy hermoso para visitar se encuentra.

La señora María  Carmen Adelaida C. Cáceres es socia activa del Banco  Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, formado  por un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias, mantienen un excelente relación tanto   dentro del banco como de su comunidad apoyándose siempre unas a otras

María  vive en la parroquia Chicán en el cantón Paute, tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra casada sólo tiene un  hijo que es encuentra estudiando en la universidad Politécnica Salesiana de la Ciudad de Cuenca, su esposo viajo al extranjero en busca de un mejor futuro para  su familia, con el dinero que su esposo envía del extranjero logro construir su casa.

María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene uso de razón, siembra verduras y hortalizas además  cría pollos un poco para vender y otro para el consumo, ella debe distribuir su tiempo entre el campo sus animales y las obligaciones propias del hogar.  

Este es su quinto ciclo  trabajando  junto a la fundación y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado para salir adelante porque su esposo ya no le envía mucho dinero por la crisis económica, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y pollos para incrementar su criadero,  así como para los estudios de su hijo

Su sueño es ver a su hijo terminar los estudios y que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Women of Solidarity" is located in the administrative district of Paute, about 45 minutes away from the city of Cuenca, Ecuador. The area has a temperate climate that favors the cultivation of flowers and a large variety of fruits. Furthermore, it offers a great landscape and a beautiful place to visit. Mrs. María Carmen Adelaida C. Cáceres is an active associate of the Women of Solidarity Communal Bank, formed by a group of women interested in helping their families get ahead. The women maintain an excellent relationship within the bank as well as within the community, always supporting each other. María lives in Chicán parish in Paute, she is 47 years old, and she is married with only one son. Her son is studying at the Polytecnic Salesian University in the city of Cuenca. Her husband traveled abroad in search of a better future for his family. With the money that her husband sent from abroad, she has been able to build a house. María has dedicated herself to agriculture ever since she was young, sowing vegetables and crops as well as raising chickens; a few to sell and the others to consume. She distributes her time between the farm, her animals, and her own obligations at home. This is her fifth cycle working together with the foundation and she tells us that the loans have helped her to move ahead because her husband no longer sends much money because of the economic crisis. With the loan that the ESPOIR Foundation will give her she is going to invest in buying seeds and chickens to add to her nursery, so that she can pay for her son’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting crops and chickens to be raised

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio T. Menedez tiene 56 años, casado y tiene 7 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. 3 hijos y 2 nietos viven en su casa. El trabaja en su propia campo, cultivando cafe y mantiendo pasto para las vaccas. Su esposa y 7 hijos trabajan en la misma finca. El quiere comprar uno mas ganado para leche y despues para carne. Es el primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este prestamo. El ha tendido crédito con Banco Costa Rica hace muchos anos pero prefiere los prestamos de FUDECOSUR porque son más baratos. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable.
texts.en:
Patricio T. Menedez is 56 years old, married and has 7 children who are his main priority. Three of his children and two of his grandchildren live in his house. He works on his own land cultivating coffee and maintaining a pasture for his cattle. His wife and 7 children work on the same farm. He wants to buy another cow that he will use for milk and then later for meat. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he believes that he will be able to increase his business with this loan. He has had a loan from the Banco Costa Rica for many years but he prefers the loans from FUDECOSUR because they are more affordable. He wishes to provide his wife and children with a better and more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Dalila Raquel

texts.es: Dalila Raquel es una joven de 29 años. Doña Dalila tiene 1 hijo y depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella decidió escoger este tipo de trabajo por ser uno de las fuentes de ingresos más accesibles además le gusta mucho este tipo de trabajo. Los propósitos de Dalila con su negocio son de mantener a sus clientes ya que algunos no reciben la atención que se merecen. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de cosméticos, ropa interior, ropa para niños, ropa para damas y caballeros. El deseo de Ella es mejorar su nivel de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Dalila Raquel is a 29 year old young woman. Dalila has one dependent son. Her economic activity is the buying and selling of general merchandise. For more than 6 years she has been involved in this business, she decided to choose this type of work because it’s one of the most accessible sources of income and also because she likes this type of work a lot.
