Dalila’s goal with her business is to keep her clients because some are not receiving the attention they deserve. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase cosmetics, undergarments, and clothing for children, women and men. Her wish is to improve the quality of life of herself and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон Джураев проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена работает в колхозницей на поле. Абдурахмон более 10 лет работает по специальности "электриком". Помимо этого он более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon J. lives in the Tursunzoda region. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. His wife works in the fields at a collective farm. Abdurahmon has worked as an electrician for more than ten years. In addition, he has kept livestock for over six years. He raises cattle for sale.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying hair extensions

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 68-year-old divorced mother of seven children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (a local specialty). She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for over 40 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Ahmad Jan

texts.en:
Ahmad Jan is a hardworking man. He is uneducated, but he has a great deal of experience in retail. He has been involved in this business for six years in Jalalabad city. He is married and has two children, and is responsible for all of his family.

Through the years he tried many times to enlarge his store, but he couldn't until he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He was really very happy and then decided to apply for a loan. He requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN to expand his business capacity and increase his business income. He is grateful for all Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: to expand his business capacity

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou D. est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOURECOUNDA depuis 3 ans et a eu 6 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de savon traditionnel, de sucre, de thé, de kolas, et de tabac. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Safiétou D. is 45 years old and the married mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Tourécounda for three years and has had six successful loans. She runs a small trade, selling traditional soap, sugar, tea, kola nuts, and tobacco. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and contribute to her family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop her business to generate revenue

loans.name: B.g.

texts.en: C. is a 21 year old married woman living with her husband and one daughter. Her husband has a small masonry business which she helps him with to support the family. She wants to take a loan and improve their business so that in future with the income from the business they can provide higher education for their daughter.  Ultimately they want to earn enough money to live a decent life.  With the loan she plans to buy brick, sand, stone, and other materials that help the daily operations of the masonry business.

loans.use: Brick, sands, stone etc.

loans.name: Jeza

texts.en:
Jeza N. is from the village of Pangantucan , Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Jeza is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living Jeza sells seafood products including fish and shrimp to the local community. Jeza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jeza joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeza successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Jeza is requesting her third loan from HSPFI, for 11000 PHP, which she will invest in her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in her fish selling business.

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne L. est présidente du groupe de crédit Tujikaze, qui lève la main droite sur la photo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima au 13e cycle, âgée de 38 ans, mère d’un  enfant  qui va à l’école et  son mari est Enseignant. 
Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente de Ciment avec son fond propre appuyé par le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle loue avec 30$ un petit  dépôt sur la boulevard Terminus Katindo où elle vend le ciment et la chaux. Elle vend également de Fanta  à  domicile pour augmenter ses revenus.  
Jeanne L. souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et  construire une maison en matériaux durable pour sa famille. 
Le groupe Tujikaze est composé de 20 membres.  Il sied d’indiquer que sur la photo  le visage de la cliente maria B.  n’est pas visible.
texts.en:
Jeanne L. is president of the Tujikaze credit loan group (she’s the one raising her right hand on the picture), which has been a client of the Hekima IMF through 13 loan cycles. She is 38 years old, mother of one child attending school, and is married to a teacher. She started her small business selling cement with her own funds, supplemented by the loan from Hekima IMF. For $30/month, she rents a small warehouse on the Terminus Katingo Boulevard, where she sells cement and lime. She also sells soft drinks from her home to increase her income. Jeanne L. would like to have a larger credit loan so that she can expand her business and build a house made of durable materials for her family. The Tujikaze group has 20 members. It should be noted that the picture does not show the face of group member Maria B..

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and lime

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
La señora karla barca venda ropa usada en el mercado la estación de León dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 7:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería siendo su mayor clientela la gente de las comarcas
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de pacas de ropa usada y calzados.
texts.en:
Karla Barca sells used clothing in León's La Estación market; at 7am she opens for business and starts receiving her customers and offering them her merchandise. The majority of her customers are from the surrounding region. She will use this loan to buy bales of used clothing and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing such as: shorts, t-shirts, pants, skirts, children's clothing, blouses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of drinks

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda S. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 2.

Yolanda is 41 and married with six school-aged children. She has a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, candies, sugar, salt, soap and toothpaste. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003 ce qui lui a donné une bonne maîtrise de ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et divers.
Elle est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This woman is a vendor of cosmetics products. She has been in this business since 2003 and therefore knows it well. She purchases her stock at the big market of Lomé and has a diverse customer base. Wishing to increase her stock, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase cosmetics and assorted products. She is single, and it is with the income from this business that she is able to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics [for resale]

loans.name: Alexandre Samuel

texts.pt:
Alexandre Samuel T. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 10, 08, 07 e 02 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 1ą classe não continuou porque os pais priorizaram que ele cuidasse do gado da família. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane com os seus pais ha 20 anos, devido a guerra de desestabilização. É negociante ha mais de 4 anos e trabalha também na empresa Aguas de Moçambique como guarda. A sua esposa também possui um negócio e tem ajudado seu marido. Não possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.200.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, óleo, sal e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na construção de outro estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Alexandre Samuel T. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children, ages 10, 8, 7 and 2. The three oldest children go to school. Alexandre only finished first grade; he did not continue with school because his parents felt it was more important for him to take care of the family's cattle. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. 20 years ago, Alexandre left Chibuto to move to Boane District with his family because of the civil war. He has been a businessman for more than four years and also works as a guard for Aguas de Moçambique. His wife also has a job and has helped Alexandre. He has no employees and has an income of about 7,000 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and saves some of it through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Alexandre has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This 10,200 meticais loan is his first. He intends to buy products (rice, sugar, oil, salt and other items) to increase his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain his good credit. In the future, Alexandre would like to apply for loans to build another shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (rice, oil, sugar, salt, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos.Se dedica a la venta de bebidas, desde hace varios años, y  le resulta bastante rentable gracias a la dedicación diaria. Ella se inicio vendiendo bebidas en su casa, pero gracias a sus esfuerzos ahora las vende desde su pequeña tienda, y lo hace con la ayuda de su madre, quien la apoya en la atención cuando tiene que salir. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener la libertad de dedicarse a su hogar, y a la vez generar ingresos económicos para la manutención de su familia.Espera seguir creciendo para que en el futuro pueda  terminar de construir su casa y así desea tener un local más grande, haciendo que su negocio luzca mejor y se haga más rentable.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete en pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas, para continuar progresando.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas, para aumentar sus ventas, y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria, 42, lives in her own home with her partner and their two small children. She has sold beverages for several years; it’s been profitable thanks to her daily attention to it. She started out selling beverages in her home but, thanks to her efforts, she now has a small store. Her mother helps out by tending to customers whenever she has to go someplace. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to tend to her household as well as earn income to support her family. She hopes to continue growing so that in the future she can finish building her house. She also hopes to have a larger store so that her business will look more appealing and thus become more profitable. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion in order to continue to progress. Gloria will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of carbonated beverages to increase sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock beverages for her store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda B. is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, a videoke machine, and billiards (rent to play). She lives in  Brgy. Tamisu, Bais City, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now eans an average income of PHP 51,000. 

Luzviminda is now borrowing PHP 40,000 so that she can use it as additional capital for her general store and to purchase pigs for fattening. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Luzviminda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénéba  S. est âgée  de 62 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants au  quartier Pelengana Sébénikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient à l’école une porte de déperdition des filles, elle commença tôt les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle mena plusieurs petites activités, vente de beignets, de chaussures, de mil et d’arachide grillé. Finalement elle opte pour cette dernière activité (la vente de mil et d’arachide grillé) qu’elle exerce depuis 12 ans au marché château de Ségou et dans les différents marchés  de  foires (lundi de Ségou et jeudi de Banankoro). 
Pour griller l’arachide elle pose un poêle sablonneux  contenant de l’arachide  sur le feu, de temps en temps elle remue la contenance à l’aide d’une louche, cette opération répétitive peut prendre quelques moments.
Dans le dessein de renforcer son activité, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 56 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter,  18 sacs d’arachide et 12 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne en arachide à Ségou et mil à Banankoro.
Madame Djénéba  S. vend  au comptant à  une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA, ce qui  lui permettra de faire face aux dépenses familiales et participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles).
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénéba S. is 62 years old. She lives with her husband and their six children in the Pelengana Sébénikoro district of Ségou (the third administrative region of Mali). She did not have an opportunity to go to school as her parents, who saw school as the road to perdition for girls, had refused to allow it. Therefore she started working and earning an income early on. She tried different types of activities, such as selling beignets, shoes, millet and grilled peanuts. Finally, she settled on this last line of business (selling millet and grilled peanuts), which she has been engaged in for about 12 years, at the Château de Segou market as well as other local markets (the Monday market in Ségou and the Thursday market of Banankoro). In order to grill peanuts , she puts them in a large heavy skillet over fire. From time to time she stirs peanuts with a ladle; this repetitive process can take a while With the goal of strengthening her business, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a member for 56 months. After four solidarity loans and four individual loans, all duly repaid, she is now on her fifth individual loan, which she plans to use for purchasing 18 bags of peanuts and 12 bags of millet. She stocks up on peanuts in Ségou and on millet in Banankoro. Mrs. Djénéba S. sells for cash to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 70,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to meet some family expenses and participate in social events such as weddings, baptisms and funerals.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing peanuts and millet

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian J. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 61 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Lilian grows rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Lilian from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a resident of Kot Radha Kishen, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its dairy products. She is 32 years old and lives in a single-room brick house with her family.  

She is the mother of 11-year-old Adeel and 9-year-old Sania, who are studying in 8th and 6th class respectively, and 6-year-old Talib. Her youngest son has not started to attend school yet. 

Her husband is an educated person; he completed his education through 10th standard and operates a grocery shop in the market. After coming from the shop, he supplies milk to the milk shops, while Kalsoom takes care of his buffaloes at her home. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will add groceries to his grocery shop because he has found good profit potential in this business and enjoys working in it. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. She has proved herself a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria M. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Desideria owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members and her husband is the driver. Desideria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Desideria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desideria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools to improve and maintain the business. This loan will be Desideria's 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools to improve and maintain the business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith K. K. is twenty-four years old and single. She has two children, aged six and two, whom she hopes to educate well up to the university level. Her business is located at a busy estate in Nairobi called Pumwani. She sells cereals like rice to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the fact that there so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well.

 She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more rice to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big cereals supplier. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Rice

loans.name: Rutwe Women's Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Hard working with a cordial character, Sarah K. is married with 6 children of her own to take care of, and knows that she has her responsibility tasks cut out for her. This reality has looked her in the face for the past 10 years as she goes about her trivial retail shop business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, from Rutwe, Kihihi.

With her monthly earnings amounting to 400,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as the husband seems not to be so productive. Sarah wants to improve on the status quo of her family with the acquisition of this loan as she wants to give this business an improved lease of life in terms of restocking and expansion. Through restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business will make her earn more sales revenue and be able to pay the education bills for her children.

Sarah belongs to Rutwe women's group, Kihihi.

loans.use: Business restocking.

loans.name: Hafeez's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, that is famous for its agriculture industry. She is 30 years old and a mother of three sons and a daughter. She is unable to provide an education to her children due to the poor financial condition of her family. 

Her husband, M., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a dairy business. For this purpose, he keeps a buffalo at his home. That gives him almost 8kg milk, which he sells for 45 Pakistan rupees (PKRs) per kg. In this way, his daily income becomes PKRs 360, which helps him to manage the financial circle of his family.  

Hafeez is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home and take care of her family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy business and increase the milk productivity.  

Hafeez is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to increase his profits by utilizing the money positively. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous year, she has built good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding the book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Hafeez.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Malikahon's Group

texts.en:
Halimahan J., 58, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has three children.  Halimahon makes money by taking orders and sewing men's and women's clothes. In this way she earns 2000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money in order to repair the house. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a sewing workshop. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de aretes, ella trae de la ciudad de Bolivia y lo vende en la ciudad de Cusco en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los aretes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aretes al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank named "The Dawn". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Beatriz. She is 35 years old; she lives together with her partner and their son. Her business is selling earrings. She brings her merchandise from Bolivia for resale in along the streets of Cusco.  She dreams of having a store from where to sell her earrings. She requests a loan to purchase earrings in wholesale. 

She is grateful to all those who have become part of her dream. She is committed to the payment terms established for her loan.

loans.use: To purchase earrings in wholesale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Oswaldo de 44 años y sus 2 menores hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 5 años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comestibles y productos de primera necesidad, comercializa  en su tienda que esta instalada en su casa. Dice que le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite atender los quehaceres de su hogar; además de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Atiende sola todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, solo cuando sus hijos no tienen tareas escolares le ayudan en la atención, y obtiene ganancias regulares pues su negocio es el mejor abastecido de su zona, y el tiempo que vende sumado a la buena atención, le ha permitido captar gran cantidad de clientes que la prefieren porque los precios de sus variados productos son muy accesibles. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues esta quedando algo pequeño para la cantidad de alimentos que vende.  Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Erlinda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de panetones, y otros alimentos, pues como las fiestas navideñas están cerca, desea ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 43, lives in her own house with her husband, Oswaldo, 44, and their two minor children.  Together they strive daily to get ahead seeking progress.  For the last five years this hard working woman has sold food and basic need items in a store installed in her house.  She says she enjoys it very much because it allows her to do her housework as well as help her husband meet household expenses.

She works alone every day from 7am until 10pm.  Her children help her only if they don’t have any schoolwork to do.  Her profits are regular because she has the best stocked store in the zone.  The length of time she’s been in business added to the good customer service have produced a large number of regular customers that prefer her because the prices of her various products are quite accessible.

As an enterprising woman she plans to expand her installations in the future because it’s getting a bit small for the amount of products she stocks.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan, which will allow her to stay in business seeking progress, possible.

Erlinda plans to use the requested funds to buy a quantity of Panettones and other food items because, since the Christmas season is near, she wants to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy Panettones, chocolate and other foods consumed during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano, 49 years old, is from the town of Talibon. He is married and has two children, age 17 and 16. To make a living, Luciano owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luciano has a dream of becoming a politician. He says he wants to be of service to his townsfolk.

Luciano joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora O. F. T. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 42 años quien tiene una pequeña Pulpería la cual inicio el 2001 con la venta de chiverias y gaseosa. En la actualidad ella comercializa desde arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carne, pastas, verduras y frutas etc.

Ella tiene dos hijos uno de 22 años y otro de 9 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en útiles escolares ya que se aproxima el regreso a clase y tiene muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Sra. O.F.T. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman. She is 42 years old and has a small grocery store that she started in 2001 by selling yogurt and sodas. At the moment she sells rice, beans, sugar, meat, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and other items.

She has two children (ages 22 and 9) for whom she works extremely hard. She will invest in school supplies since classes are restarting and she has many orders.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to sell

loans.name: Um's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. U. O. is a widow with six children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, one is a constructiO. worker and the others are attending a local public school. They live in Angk Ta Nu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

U. was selected by the three other members of her group to be the head of a group loan. Each member will use her portiO. of the loan in different ways to support her family.

U.’s problem is that her kitchen is too old to use, so she will be using her portiO. of the loan to add to her savings to rebuild her kitchen.

loans.use: To rebuild her kitchen

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao S. is a married woman, born in 1977, and is a villager who lives in Knong Preaek village in Kandal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory, where she earns a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Marn Meng, makes incense to sell to help support the family. 
He owns a motorcycle for transportation, but it is too old. So Mrs.Sao S. would like a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a new motorcycle. 
This couple has two children.   One is attending a local school and the other one is 5 years old and not in school. Sao S.'s husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Shadrack Chigiri

texts.en: Shadrack Chigiri M. operates a motorcycle transport in Shanzu, Mombasa town. He has been in this business for two years and earns a good income.  He is 30 years old. He has never borrowed from any other MFI and is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another motorbike.  Shadrack intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: For the past five years Emmanuel, 27 years old and single, has owned a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6am to 10pm. Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying a new motorcycle, and plans to reinvest additional profits into his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 56-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school.  Patricia works very hard to provide for them.

Patricia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Patricia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sardines, noodles, soap, eggs, bread etc. 

In the future, Patricia would like to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio María Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Caacupe, que dista a 38 km de la oficina regional dicha ciudad.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Limpia Concepción S. Zorrilla, ella vive con su marido y sus hijos.
Ella trabaja en la venta de comidas, de a poco va progresando pero necesita de una ayuda o soporte económico que la ayude a seguir superándose ella misma y a su fasmilia, por eso solicita el apoyo de Kiva para poder comprar víveres y bebidas en mayores cantidades a fin de obtener más ganancias.
Ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, las señoras están en el ciclo Nº 3 con sus 19 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the community of Maria Auxiliadora in the city of Caacupe, located at 38 km from the regional office of the city.

The leader of the group is Mrs. Limpia Concepcion S. Zorilla. She lives with her husband and children. 

She sells prepared foods and she has been increasing incrementally but she now needs help or financial support to keep improving herself and her family. For this reason she requests support from Kiva to purchase ingredients and drinks in large quantities with the goal of increasing her profits. 

She, as her colleagues, is very happy with the support that they have received from Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva. These women are on their 3rd loan cycle and they are 19 members.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and drinks

loans.name: Las Tigresas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TIGRESAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mirtha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cabina de ENTEL, viva y venta de tarjetas, venta de edredones, venta de cosméticos, venta de frutas, venta de alfombras.

La señora Mirtha, indica que hace cinco años que trabaja con Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida en Kiosco y pensión desde hace tres años, que aprendió de su cuñada. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de material de trabajo. Los insumos para la elaboración de la comida las adquiere de los mercados de abarrotes en generadle la zona villa Dolores. Posteriormente lo vende en su domicilio de lunes a domingo en las horas de 11:00 a 22:00, con la ayuda de su hermana y de una empleada. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y los consultorios.

En la fotografía no sale la señora Patricia por razones culturales
texts.en:
The “LAS TIGRESAS” [The Tigresses] communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Center. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive committee headed by Sra. Mirtha. The business activities of the members are varied. Among them are operating a telephone booth for ENTEL; working for Viva and selling cards; and selling comforters, cosmetics, fruit, and rugs.

Sra. Mirtha says she has worked with Pro Mujer for five years. Right now she has a business selling food from a kiosk. For three years she also has run a boarding house, which she learned from her sister-in-law.

The loan she is taking now is to increase work material. She usually gets the supplies for making food from the grocery stores in Villa Dolores. Later she sells her food at her home every day from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm, with help from her sister and one employee. The income from this work lets her support her family as much as possible. She lives with her partner and has two children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health training and clinics.

Sra. Patricia does not appear in the photograph for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to increase work materials for making food to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva C. is 44 years old and married with 4 children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, groceries, etc in her sari-sari store.

Eva has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from the retail sale of rice and charcoal.

Eva aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Gyulab

texts.en:
Gyulab has a farm, where he breeds various farm animals: cows, sheep and a goat. He works very hard on his farm and thereby he is able to keep his family. To increase his family’s profit, Gyulab intends to organize potato growing on his farm. For that he is asking for a 600,000 Armenian drams loan to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel to organize growing process. 

Gyulab is 39 years old. He lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his wife and two sons, who are students.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel to organize growing process.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: José Maria tiene 60 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo. Se dedica a la comercialización de venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 20 años pues fue con recursos propios que empezó este medio de vida. Esta actividad es su principal fuente ingreso por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. José desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y aumentar el número de ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez un crédito para la compra de tratamientos, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado. El es una persona tranquila y bastante emprendedora.
texts.en:
José Maria is 60 years old, married, and lives together with his wife and son.  His business is selling general merchandise and he has been in the business for more than 20 years.  He started out with his own resources.

This business is José's main source of income so he tries to keep it running in the best way possible.  José would like to acquire more products so that he can expand his business and increase his number of sales.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan to buy treatments, clothes, cosmetics and footwear.  He is a calm and entrepreneurial person.

loans.use: to buy treatments, clothes, cosmetics and footwear

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 mujeres amables, carismáticas, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras. Viven por la comunidad de Zhidmad, este lugar esta  rodeado de naturaleza y vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades. Nuestras socias realizan los créditos para mejorar su situación económica, invierten en sus negocios y así pueden sacar adelante a sus familias.

La Señora. Zoila es una de las socias de este Banco Comunal, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad.

Tiene 40 años,  está  separada de su esposo pero de  su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20, 17, 16 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela de la comunidad. La casa en la que habita es propia.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes y cerdos, a los que los vende en su propia comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y los productos que obtiene  son para su consumo y el sobrante lo vende.

Se encuentra hace 9 años en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es terminar su casa y  tener más animales.

Las 2 fotos pequeñas adjuntas es de 2 socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes en la reunión cuando fué tomada la fotografía.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanacer” (New Dawn) Communal Bank is comprised of eight kind, charismatic, tenacious, and very hard-working women.  They live in the Zhidmad community.  This place is surrounded by nature and vegetation.  Its people dedicate themselves to raising animals, agriculture, and some work in different business activities in the city of Cuenca.  Our members use the loans to improve their financial situations.  They invest in their businesses, and that way they are able to get their families ahead.

Zoila is one of the members of this communal bank, and she lives in the Zhidmad community.  She is 40 years old, and she is separated from her husband.  They have four children; ages 20, 17, 16, and 7.  The first three are in high school, and the last child attends a community school.  The house they live in is their own. 

 Zoila raises cattle, guinea pigs, and pigs.  She sells them in her own community.  She also farms, and the products she gets are for her family’s consumption.  She sells the extra.

She has been in the communal bank for nine years.  She will use her new loan to buy feed for her animals.  Her goal is to finish her house and to have more animals. 

The two tiny photos are of two members who, due to work commitments, could not be present in the meeting when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Larch

texts.en:
Larch is a housewife. Her husband used to be a teacher but now he is retired. They have 3 children; one is studying, and the other two are working in a factory with an income of $3 per day each. 

Larch depends on her children to pay the family expenses – about $100 per month – because she does not have an income. She would like to request a loan of $300 for her third child’s school fees. She will try to send her child to school until he finishes university. All her children will help to repay the loan. She wants to sell gruel in front of her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun, age 50, has her own small farming business that she learned from her grandfather. Her main activity is planting a variety of crops and catching fish along the river for extra profit. The couple has lived together in a small house and are blessed with five single children. Three of the children make money in a variety of jobs. Mrs. Roeun will use her loan to purchase some fishing equipment such as a boat, machine and nets so she can catch more fish than the previous time. She resides in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to buy a boat, machine and fishing nets

loans.name: Charles Louanga

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 46 ans, marie et père d’un enfant de 8 ans.
Ne pouvant poursuivre ses études supérieures par manque d’appui financier, il se lance en 1987  dans la vente des produits alimentaires et  du bois de chauffe.

Au regard de la forte demande dans son quartier, le prêt permettre de renforcer le stock des produits comme, 200 paquets de bois de chauffe, cartons de lait cowbell,  carton de tomate, savons de lessive et détergents.
Sa stratégie est de beaucoup épargner, et vendre des produits de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle.
Ayant déjà une grande expérience, pour le futur il pense ouvrir une grande boutique. Et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 46 years old, married and father of one 8-year-old child. Unable to proceed with his college studies for lack of financial support, he got his start selling groceries and firewood in 1987.

Given the high demand in his district, the loan will allow him to build up his stock of products such as 200 bundles of firewood, Cowbell milk cartons, tomatoes, laundry soap and detergents.

His strategy is to save a lot and to sell quality products to satisfy his customers. As he already has a lot of experience, he is considering opening a large shop in the future and wants to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 200 bundles of firewood, Cowbell milk cartons, detergents and tomatoes.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 31 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has two children, ages 9 and 12. Both of them are presently attending school. For the past two years she has been selling slippers, oil, soap, etc., on a table in the local market. Her major problem is that the price of oil during the rainy season is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase 10 drums of red oil [unrefined palm oil] for her business. She plans to live a better life and get married soon.

loans.use: to purchase 10 drums of red oil for her business.

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëkër Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP Sa Jëkër est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Le groupe est constitué de 12 membres. 

La présidente Déguéne, âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et a à sa charge sa maman. Elle vend des produits alimentaires et de chaussures. Le fournisseur lui amène les chaussures à domicile. Elle vend également de la bouillie mais sa ne marche pas tellement. Elle a arrêté et se consacre aux autres produits. Elle a une bonne expérience de son commerce.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce. Sur la photo elle est à droite emmitouflée d'un châle noir.

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrai augmenter son épargne, préparer son remboursement et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The “ SOP Sa Jëkër  “ solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. The group consists of 12 members.
The group’s leader is Déguéne, a 36-year old woman, married and the mother of five, with her own mother also in her care.  Déguéne sells food products and shoes. The distributor delivers shoes to her home. She also sells porridge but that doesn’t work so well. She now focuses on selling other types of products instead. She has a long experience in the business.

She will use her loan to buy additional wares to bolster her business.  In the photo she is in the right wearing a black scarf. She would like to use the resulting income to grow her savings, ensure the repayment of her loan and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to stock up on goods for bolstering her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Juana; tiene  38 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; y ella tiene 1 hija de 12 años de edad;  la socia  tiene su restaurante, ella atiende su restaurante sola y también se encarga de prepara los diferentes potajes, la socia  tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años y es muy conocida, ella tiene muchos clientes debido a la elaboración de sus potajes, la socia tiene una muy buena sazón lo cual permite que sus clientes le sean fiel, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra al por mayor de arroz, papa, aceite en galón, fideos y otros productos para seguir elaborando sus diversos potajes, ella desea implementar  a futuro su restaurante y mejorar la condición del local. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor, como papa, aceite, arroz y otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, belongs to the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is single and has a 12-year-old daughter.  She has a restaurant that she runs by herself and where she cooks the meals herself.  She’s had this business for four years and is very well known.  She has many customers thanks to the way she prepares her meals; they are very tasty and this leads to her customers being repeat customers.

She wants to invest the loan in wholesale purchases of rice, potatoes, oil by the gallon, noodles and other products to continue preparing her delicious meals. IN the future, she wants to set up a restaurant and improve the conditions of her locale.  She is asking for the loan to buy products, like potatoes, oil, rice and others, at wholesale.  She is grateful for the support that will be provided and she commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre, responsable y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja con quien tiene cinco hijos de 19, 17, 15, 8 y 3 años. Por tanto ella y su pareja trabajan mucho para dar una mejor calida de vidad a su familia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de frutas, como: sandías, naranjas, mandarinas, aguaje y otras frutas más de acuerdo a la temporada. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano cuando se dirige al mercado mayorista donde consige su mercadería a un bajo precio y frescos traídos del campo y del que luego son llevados a su puesto de venta, ubicada en el mercado central de su ciudad. Tiene diez años como comerciante y en ella sus hijos la apoyan, pues su esposo se dedica a otro negocio. Para ella éste trabajo le resulta muy práctico ya que trabaja hasta el medio día, y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a sus hijos. Por tal razón espera continuar así para no dejar de tener ingresos y con ello podrá ampliar su negocio. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura que será cumplida con sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará variedad de frutas, además comprará materiales para refaccinar su local de ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario is 35 years old.  She is a very cheerful, responsible and hard-working woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have five children aged 19, 17, 15, 8 and 3.  Rosario and her partner work hard so that they can provide their family with a better quality of life.

Rosario's business is selling fruit such as watermelons, oranges, mandarins, 'aguaje' (a native fruit) and other fruits according to the season.  Her work starts very early in the morning when she goes to the wholesale market and buys her merchandise at a low price, fresh from the field.  She transports the merchandise to her sales stall which is located in her town's central market.

Rosario has been working as a trader for ten years and her children support her in her work as her husband works in another business.  This work is very practical for Rosario as she works until midday and then devotes the rest of her time to her children.  For this reason, she hopes to continue in her work so that she doesn't stop making income.  She hopes to be able to expand her business.

This will be Rosario's third loan from MFP and she assures us that she will make her repayments punctually.  Rosario will use the sum she has requested to buy a range of fruit.  She will also buy material with which to refurbish her sales location.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, and materials with which to refurbish her stall

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in Tsovagyugh Village.  He used to work as a driver, and since 1996 he has been doing rescue work.  He believes that his work is very important and a responsible thing to do.

Hambardzum, his wife, and son are also engaged in agriculture. They breed cows and chickens, and they grow wheat and potatoes for sale. They produce milk, eggs and meat that they sell to bulk buyers.  This is Hambardzum’s second loan from Kiva field partner Nor Horizon.  He plans to use this 500.000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and seeds for autumn sowing.

loans.use: to buy fodder for farm animals and seeds for autumn sowing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açucar, oleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para melhorar o seu negocio e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Inhambane Province, southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children who still attend school. He completed grade 7 but did not continue due to financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and supports his parents who live with him.

He left Inhambane for Boane in Maputo Province, as he was looking to improve his life. He has been a businessman for more than 13 years. He has a salary of around 8,000 Mozambican Meticals per month. He uses this for household expenses, and saves some in his bank account.
He has never had loans with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and is for the amount of 25,000 Mozambican Meticals. With the loan he will buy food products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others) to increase the stock in his store. He promises to pay without problems and in the future he intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to improve his business and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in his shop (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others)

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 31 year old farmer and is married with two children. She also feeds cows, raises pigs, and works for others for additional income. She has been a farmer for more than ten years. 

Channy requested a loan to cultivate her rice paddy and to buy food for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and feed her pigs so they are healthy and fat and so she earn more income to support her family, to have some savings, and also keep her children in school. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice paddy and buy food for her pigs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yasmina Del Socorro

texts.es: Yasmina Del Socorro es maestra, ella va solicitar un préstamo debido a mejorar su vivienda, aprovechando que ya tiene un buen historial crediticio, solicita nuevamente, para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, cerámica para la construcción del piso de la vivienda.Los préstamos le han ayudado para mejorar su condición, apoyando siempre a su hijo en los estudios y viendo la manera de salir adelante, el cambio que ha tenido en la familia, es el avance de su hijo en la educación.
texts.en: Yasmina Del Socorro is a teacher.  She is requesting a loan to improve her home.  Taking advantage of the fact that she now has a good credit history, she is requesting a new loan to buy building supplies such as cement, sand and tiles for laying flooring in her home.  Her loans have helped her to improve her condition, support her son with his education, and make progress.  The change that has taken place in her family is the progress that her son has made in his education.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tiles

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El comité Espíritu Santo surgió de la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Las integrantes pudieron formar un grupo bien unido y trabajador, quienes ya son muy conocidas en el barrio por su trabajo.
La Sra Gloria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se define como una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, quien diariamente lucha por el sustento de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, pantalones y demás, mediante el cual pueda cubrir sus necesidades.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, como ser shorts, camisillas y demás, ya que se acerca la época de calor y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The Espíritu Santo (“Holy Ghost”) Committee was born thanks to the management and support of another Committee that was working in their area. The members were able to create a tightly united and hardworking group, and they are very well-known in their neighborhood for their work.
Gloria is one of the members of the group. She considers herself to be a very resourceful and hardworking woman, who daily strives to provide for her family. She engages in selling all kinds of clothes, such as shirts, trousers and other items, a mean to help her pay for her necessities.
As the heath season is approaching, she is requesting a loan to buy summer clothes such as shorts, T-shirts and other items in order to have a full stock to sell.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus is married and blessed with five children - all of whom attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming to support his family. He also does crop farming to supplement his income. His hard work and determination has helped him to retain his business. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy animal feed and seeds. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Maria Elena requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Maria Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bonfice

texts.en:
Bonfice is 26 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have two children. He has been operating a quarry business for the last 6 years with a monthly income of about Kes 15,000.

He is requesting his second loan with KADET of Kes 40,000 to expand his quarry output by buying more equipment for quarrying tools; i.e. cold chisels and hammers. With the anticipated profits he plans to become a wholesaler of construction stones.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry to directly transport the quarry products to his customers.

loans.use: to expand his quarry business.

loans.name: Agau

texts.en:
Agau is a 47-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has run a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Agau is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, por su agricultura y por tener a la Laguna de Huacachina, la cual es considerada el “Oasis de América”, flor es madre de un pequeño de 6 años al cual ama muchísimo y por el cual da la vida por verlo feliz y darle lo necesario para tener una buena calidad de vida, como buena peruana le gusta la comida por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Flor trabaja en su negocio de venta de desayuno, le dedica alrededor de 5 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque atiende bien a sus clientes.

Flor está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva por brindarle su gran apoyo por segunda vez y gracias a ello podrá realizar una mejoras a su carrito sanguchero donde vende sus desayunos,asi como tambien comprar tasa, vasos, platos, entre otros, lo que le permitirá mejorar su negocio y poder seguir trabajando y luchar cada día para salir adelante y cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su restaurante y darle una profesión a su hijo”.

loans.use: Para mantenimiento de carrito de desayuno y compra de tasas, vasos, platos, entre otros

loans.name: Impano Tcb Group

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old. She is married with three children. They range in age from a baby of nine days to a child of six years old. She sells various products and has been dealing in a retail business for the past five years. She is a group leader for the group called Impano, which means “a gift”. With the loan, she would like buy more retail business items for resale. The group members sell different items and have different businesses, but they all have the same visions for their businesses, which is to have a better future and to provide food for their families with the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more retail business items for sale

loans.name: David Ndanda's Group

texts.en:
David’s group is one of four group leader farmers who are located in Busia District. The leaders in this group represent a total of 40 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings (KES) to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, David is pictured on the right of the Mkilima Group with his hand raised. 

David is 47 years old, and a reliable member of the community. He is married with eight children. David has been working as a farmer for the last seven years to support his family. In addition to this, David is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, prayer group and burial committee. Last year he was not with One Acre Fund. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!

The 2013 Long Rains season will be David’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to get new farming methods, get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, David also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. He wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. David plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, and buy a cow. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training, has more farm group support, and will be able to feed his family. One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.

 The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. David and the Mkilima Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 5 years, both of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 3 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan requested from kiva, she would like to pay who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize.

loans.name: Khabil

texts.en:
45-year-old Khabil is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Buzlu village. He and his family were settled in Absheron  region Masazir village. He is  married and has 2 children. 
Khabil borrowed the loan of amount $400 to buy 5 sheeps. He wanted to expand his business. He has 14 year experience in this business.
Khabil applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy 12 sheeps.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheeps

loans.name: María Belem

texts.en:
Maria began selling home products two years ago, when her husband was unemployed. Her family went through very difficult times and there were arguments over money. From that moment she decided to work, but her husband wouldn’t let her because he was afraid she wouldn’t be able to take good care of their 8 year-old son. Out of desperation to help support her husband in a way that wouldn’t offend him, she began selling from catalogues since that wouldn’t interfere with her household duties. María began to supply her first orders by using her husband’s severance pay. She reinvested the earnings by selling products physically, instead of from a catalog, and was able to achieve better results with her clients.

María needs a loan of $375 to buy inventory because demand for her products has increased recently. You can collaborate in the growth of this home business and provide support to this family. Decide to help, they will be very appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María comenzó con las ventas hace dos años, cuando su esposo fue desempleado, su familia pasó por momentos muy difíciles y se presentaron discusiones familiares por motivos económicos. A partir de ese momento ella decidió trabajar, pero su esposo no se lo permitió por temor a que descuidara a su hijo de 8 años; en su desesperación por apoyar a su esposo y que éste no se ofendiera inició con la venta por catálogo ya que esto no le impedía llevar a cabo sus ocupaciones del hogar. Así María, empezó a surtir sus primeros pedidos con el dinero de la liquidación de su esposo, y reinvertía las ganancias para ofrecer sus productos físicamente y de esta manera obtuvo mejores resultados de sus clientes.

María requiere un préstamo de $375 dólares para la compra de mercancía ya que la demanda de sus productos se ha incrementado últimamente. Tú puedes colaborar en el crecimiento de este negocio, y apoyar a esta familia, decídete a ayudar, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy product inventory

loans.name: Nedy Suyapa

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Nedy Suyapa and I've run a used clothing business in my home for the past three years. This provides enough income to support my family. I am a single mother. I need purchase more clothes because sales have increased and I don't have enough capital to meet my clients' demand.

Hola mi nombre es Nedy Suyapa, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada en mi casa de habitación, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera, actuamente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que el volumen de venta es mayor, y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer la demanda.

loans.use: Purchase adult clothing.

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en: Huseyin R. owns and operates a small stand in a bazzar in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Huseyin has already successfully repaid a loan from Norwegian Microcredit proving that he is a reliable customer. Huseyin is looking for funding so that he can purchase more summer footwear that his customers are seeking.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of summer footwear for his stand.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sumadi live in her own semi permanent hut built from gedeg (woven bamboo). The traditional way Sumadi has raised pigs for 27 years. With a capital of Rp1,550,000 (about US$170) Sumadi bought 3 piglets for Rp250,000 (about $28) each, and the rest to buy pig feed. After 5 months Sumadi will sell those raised pigs, for a Rp250,000 (about $28) profit. Those profit is used for her daily expense with her husband. Laon from DINARI will be used to buy more piglets to be raised, with the hope Sumadi will get more profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Sumadi tinggal di sebuah rumah milik sendiri yang bangunannya semi permanent terbuat dari gedeg. Secara tradisional Sumadi memelihara babi sejak 27 tahun yang lalu. Dengan modal Rp. 1.550.000,- Sumadi membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan yang masing-masing harganya Rp. 250.000,- dan sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi-babi tersebut. Setelah 5 bulan Sumadi akan menjual babi-babi yang sudah dipeliharanya tersebut dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 250.000,- Keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk keperluan hidupnya sehari-hari bersama suaminya. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal membeli bibit babi penggemukan dengan harapan semakin banyak memelihara babi, Sumadi akan mendapat lebih banyak keuntungan.

loans.use:
To buy piglets to be fatten so that it could be sold at a higher pricer

Membeli bibit babi untuk digemukkan, sehingga dapat dijual lagi dengan harga yang lebih tinggi

loans.name: Thi Chuyen

texts.vi:
Ms Chuyên is a hard working, responsible person. She is 40 years old, married with 3 young children. They live in "Trung Bạn" hamlet, near the town of "Chờ", Yên Phong, in the province of "Bắc Ninh". In the past, she used to sell waste material (glass, glass bottles, metal) to recycling companies for a living. Everyday, she would go to town, doing door to door to buy glass & metal material then she would resell. She made about 2.50 USD a day (40000 VND). Her husband works in construction, his salary helps cover part of the expenses of the family. But the income from both of them is not enough and it is unstable so they have decided to put all their savings and borrow some money from their family members to buy chickens to raise. Every year, their peep of chickens grows. They sell 2 batches of chickens a year, these chickens are replaced by new chicks from their own chicken hatchery. Today they have about 100 chickens and this is their pride and happiness for the family. They request a loan to buy chicken feed. They will be able to pay back the loan in 6 months

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Chuyên là người phụ nữ chịu khó, đảm đang. Chị 40 tuổi đã có chồng và 3 con nhỏ. Chị sống ở Thôn Trung Bạn, Thị trấn Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Trước đây, chị kiếm sống bằng nghề thu mua đồng nát (ve chai). Hàng ngày, chị gánh đôi quang gánh đi khắp nơi trong thị trấn để thu mua đồng nát, sắt vụn, sau đó bán lại cho các cơ sở mua buôn. Mỗi ngày chị cũng kiếm được khoảng 30-40.000 VND. Chồng chị làm thợ xây cũng hỗ trợ được thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Tuy nhiên, mức thu nhập quá bấp bênh và không đủ sống như vậy nên anh chị đã quyết định gom góp tất cả vốn liếng của mình và đi vay mượn thêm của những người thân trong gia đình để mua gà về nuôi. Mỗi năm, đàn gà của anh chị lại nhiều thêm và trung bình mỗi năm chị có thể bán đi 2 lứa và nuôi thêm những lứa mới từ việc cho ấp nở tại nhà. Hiện tại đàn gà của anh chị đã có khoảng trên 100 con và đó là niềm vui rất lớn của cả gia đình. Anh chị đang mong muốn có thêm một khoản tiền để hỗ trợ trong việc mua thức ăn cho gà. Anh chị sẽ có đủ khả năng để thanh toán khoản vay trong vòng 6 tháng.

loans.use: To purchase food for chickens

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
I have been in the footwear business for more than 34 years. This business is the source of income for my family and I have dedicated my whole life to the making of leather shoes. Right now I lack the raw materials needed to fill some requests. I am asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars in order to buy raw materials for making shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 34 años que me dedico a la elaboración de calzado. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia y me he dedicado toda mi vida en la elaboración de calzado de piel.
