Pero me esta haciendo falta materia prima para elaborar unos pedidos que tengo y solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de materia prima, para la elaboración de calzado.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 37-year-old mother of 5. She lives with her family in Aley. Samira does crochet work and is supporting her family with her business. This is the fourth time Samira is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy yarn and materials for my business.

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat Babyev is a 33-year-old single man living in Khachmaz, Azerbaijan. He has 6 years of experience raising cattle and would like a loan of $850 to buy a cow for his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Beatriz Díaz sells fast food, such as hot dogs and hamburgers, for a living. She started this business 3 years ago, and she now needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments. She needs the loan in order to buy supplies because her business is very prosperous and she receives more and more customers each day. Among her future goals are saving enough money so that she can open her own store and engage in both activities.

She is a single mother with a 19-year-old son who occasionally helps her prepare the meals and serve the customers. Beatriz started this business knowing that it would allow her to both generate income and same time stay home without neglecting her son. Betty and her son thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Beatriz Díaz se dedica a la venta de comida rápida hot dogs y hamburguesas, hace 3 años empezó con este negocio, ahora necesita de un crédito de US $250 que liquidara en un plazo de 3 meses para la compra de insumos ya que su negocio ha prosperado y cada día cuenta con más clientes. Entre sus metas futuras desea reunir un capital mayor para abrir su tienda y dedicarse a ambas actividades.

Ella es madre soltera de un joven que actualmente cuenta con 19 años quien ocasionalmente le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos y la atención a los clientes, inicio esta actividad dado que esta le permitía generar ingresos y a su vez permanecer en su casa sin descuidar a su hijo. Betty y su hijo te agradecerán tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 44 years old and is divorced with 4 children, ages 24, 22, 20 and 14 years old. She also takes care of 4 other children, ages 1-6 years old. Salma sells mobiles, perfumes, clothes and shoes starting in 1992. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (mobiles, perfumes, clothes and shoes) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items  for her business.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura, a single mother of four children, lives in Monte Plata where she operates a small shop offering women’s clothes and jewelry to people of the neighborhood. Maura explains that it was a terrible blow for her raise four children on her own after her husband passed away. “Nonetheless, God has helped me a lot, and He gave me strength to work hard and move my business forward.

Maura explains that maintaining the cash flow is sometimes a hard task, but she hopes that her new collection of fashionable garments will help her business be more profitable than before.

Maura says that she’ll keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and jewels for a small shop.

loans.name: Cairo 2003-C Group

texts.en:
Rose K., the group leader, has a business selling tea and has applied for this loan in order to buy more sugar. Rose is 30 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 15. Her husband is a driver and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 75 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Rose is joined in her small group by Rebecca Abuck, Mary A., Lilas T., and Agnes J.. Rebecca Abuck sells bread and wants to expand her business. Mary A. currently sells local brew and would use her loan to buy firewood. Lilas T. also sells local brew and would like to open up a shop. Agnes J. sells local brew as well but would use this loan to begin raising livestock.

loans.use: To buy more sugar

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery, who is 38 years old, is a hard-working and dedicated woman. Eight years ago she decided to have her own source of income, to which she is very attentive and works arduously. Mery set aside a small space in her home to sell food, offering delicious meals in the afternoons. During the day she takes care of and tends her flock of sheep. Mery accomplishes these activities for the well-being of her three children, who are school-aged and being young children need lots of support and love. The loan that Mery needs is for the purchase of general goods in bulk in order to prepare meal and to feed her sheep. Support Mery's noble casue so she can continue to move forward for the sake of those she loves the most, her children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Mery, con 38 años de edad es una mujer luchadora y muy empeñosa, hace ocho años que decidió tener su propia fuente de ingreso, para ello es que está muy atenta a trabajar arduamente. Mery acondicionó en su casa un pequeño espacio para la venta de comida, ofrece deliciosos platos por las tardes, y por el día ella se dedica al cuidado de su rebaño de ovejas. Estas actividades las realiza Mery por el bienestar de sus tres hijos que están aún en edad escolar y al estar pequeños necesitan mucho de su apoyo y cariño. El préstamo que necesita Mery es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para el preparado de sus platos y de alimento para sus ovejas. Apoya la noble causa de Mery, y a continuar adelante por el bienestar de los seres que más ama, sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the sheep she raises and sells, in addition to the food she also sells to her neighbors.

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru:
Juma Quamov is a farmer and is involved in the buying and selling of KPC. He brings in bulls, fattens them and then sells them to the meat market. He has been involved in this type of business for 15 years. Currently the price for livestock has increased, thus generating less revenue for Juma. He wants to secure his business and plans to receive a loan. His business provides the local market with meat, and with fresh livestock. Other than that Juma is the sole provider for his large family of his wife and their five children. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Каюмов Джума –фермер. Занимается купле-продажей КРС . Привозит бычков , откармливает и продает мясникам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. В связи с тем , что цены на животных поднялись , его оборотная сумма уменьшилась. Поэтому для того , чтобы восстановить дело он планирует получить кредит. Его бизнес позволяет обеспечить рынки мясом и здоровым скотом. Кроме того Джума один обеспечивает свою большую семью. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of КРС

loans.name: Salamata

texts.fr:
Madame Salamata Traoré est âgée de 28 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants au quartier Torakabougou de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de formation, elle mène l’activité de fabrication de savons  traditonnels dès son jeune âge. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa grande mère. Avec une expérience de 8  ans, elle jouit d’une grande notoriété et d’une expertise sans égale dans la localité ce qui lui a valu la mise en place d’une association pour la promotion et la defense  des intérêts des fabricants de savon local.
Dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de ses activités Madame Salamata Traoré ( présidente et membre fondatrice de l’assciation des frabriçantes de savon local de la ville de Bougouni) a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt. Avec ce prêt, elle compte  acheter  15 sachets de soude caustique, 7 kilogrammes de beurre de karité,  20 litres d’huile d’arachide  et 15 sachets de savon en poudre.
Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Bougouni. Elle fait sa fabrication dans son atelier à  domicile. Les produits sont melangés et mis dans des moules pour donner des savons de différentes couleurs. Ensuite elle les revend au comptant ou à crédit. Ses clients sont géréralement les boutiquiers, les revendeuses et des commerçantes ambulantes. Son cycle (achat de matières premières, fabrication et  vente) dure un mois. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamata Traoré is 28 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, his two other wives and their children in the area of Torakabougou in the prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali). A teacher by trade, from a young age she has been in the business of producing traditional soaps. She learned this business from her grandmother. With 8 years of experience, she enjoys the benefits of a good reputation and unequalled expertise in her area. This brought her to establish an association to promote and defend the interests of local soap makers. With the intent of growing her business, Mrs. Salamata Traoré (president and founding member of the association of local soap makers of the city of Bougouni) decided to integrate the loan program from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from whom she has requested her first loan. With this loan she plans to purchase 15 bags of caustic soda, 7 kilograms of shea butter, 20 liters of peanut oil and 15 bags of powdered soap. She stocks her basic supplies on site at Bougouni and the soap production takes place in her home workshop. The products are mixed and poured into molds to create different colored soaps. She then sells them for cash or on credit. Her clients are generally shopkeepers, retailers and travelling salespeople. This process (the purchase of supplies, production and sales) takes one month. She foresees earning a profit of 50,000 FCFA per month which she will use to pay the interest on the loan and to contribute to her family expenses.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients to produce local soap

loans.name: Victor Noe

texts.es:
VICTOR NOE S. P. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.


EL SEÑOR VICTOR TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE DE UN HOSPITAL DONDE LO ADMIRAN POR LAS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE QUE DEMUESTRA, ES UNA PERSONA QUE VINO BUSCANDO UNA SOLUCION ECONOMICA Y CON LA FUERZA DE VOLUNTAD QUE POSEE LO HA LOGRADO. EL ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR SU HOGAR MEDIANTE LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN CUARTO EN LA PARTE TRASERA Y ASI LOGRANDO UNA MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Victor Noe S. P. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Mr. Victor Noe S. P. works as a guard in the hospital where he is admired for his desire to succeed. He is a person that came looking for an economic solution and with his personal will he has achieved it. He is asking for this loan to expand his home through the construction of a room in the back part of his house and achieve greater comfort for his family

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back part of his house

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es: Santos Roberto P. M. tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en el sector conocido como Los Rios, es casado, junto a su esposa Maria Argentina Mercado tiene dos pequeños niños de 5 y 3 años de edad. Santos se dedica al oficio de albañil, su esposa tienen una pulpería pequeña  desde hace 6 meses, la cual con mucho esfuerzo pudieron montar, y la que han podido mantener a través de créditos. este crédito será usado para invertir en la pulpería, en la compra de granos básicos y demás utensilios del hogar, y así poder ir creciendo en inventario.
texts.en:
Santos Roberto P. M. is 27 years old. He lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the sector known as Los Rios. He is married, and together with his wife, Maria Argentina Mercado, he has two small children, one 3 and one 5 years old. Santos works as a bricklayer. His wife has had a small general store for the past 6 months, which with much effort she began, and they have been able to keep it through loans. This loan would be used to invest in the general store, in the purchase of basic grains and other household utensils, and so be able to grow the inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and household utensils

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive. Esta mujer trabajadora, está dedicada a la agricultura, sobre todo al cultivo de  cítricos y mangos, a lo cual se dedica hace  30 años, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar, debido a que todos los miembros de la familia  interactúan  con un solo fin. Además esta actividad es rentable, porque su comunidad es muy frecuentada por los comerciantes, los cuales demandan sus productos a buenos precios, lo que facilita su trabajo de venta, aunque lo difícil es cuidar sus  terrenos de plagas a lo largo de  su producción. Se encuentra en su cuarto  préstamo con MFP, hasta  la fecha nunca dejó, de ser puntual en sus  pagos, siendo ella, la cabeza de su banco comunal, siempre da el ejemplo. Hermelinda  invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos para sus terrenos, lo cual es muy importante para sacar productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 45, is married and has 5 children, all of whom still live at home. This hard-working woman has been growing citrus fruit and mangos for 30 years. Her favorite part is harvesting, because the whole family works together toward a single goal. Her crops are very profitable and easy for her to sell, because the community where she lives is often visited by wholesale buyers who give her a good price for her products. For Hermelinda, the hard part of farming is to keep the crops free from pest infestations until harvest time. Hermelinda has requested four loans through Kiva partner MFP. To this date, she has always made payments on time. As the head of her communal bank, Hermelinda is an excellent example to her fellow members. The loan that Hermelinda is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizers, which are very important to produce quality crops.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Zabida

texts.en:
Zabida is married and lives in a household of 7 members. She is uneducated and divides her time between tailoring and doing the housework. Her husband has a small retail shop where she also works whenever possible.

Zabida has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans (US$650.00) to improve the inventory of her tailoring business and to help her husband's business as well. She would like to say that this loan will help a lot toward supporting her family. She is happy to maintain her partnership with Kiva and AFSG and she is certain that after two or three years she will be a good business leader. She thanks her lenders around the world.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring inventory

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas L. is a store owner in the village of Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. Their place was formerly a hacienda which is prone to flooding. Felicitas is already 58 years old and married to Elpidio, a farmer. Their marriage is blessed with three children, all male and they are: Elmer– 36 years old, Elizaldy– 32 years old, and Eddie– 26 years old. All of their children have only completed their studies at the elementary level.  

Felicitas has been managing the business for almost ten years and was somehow able to develop her store. Aside from selling basic commodities like soap, snack foods, and soft drinks, she is now selling vegetables that are displayed in front of her store. Felicitas wanted her business to expand, so she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 that she will use as additional capital for her store. Through the program, she has been encouraged to work hard and be patient in paying her loans for the sake of her business' progress and her family's living.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 42 year-old Mary K. from Mwanza She is married with five children who are between the ages of 15 and 25 years old.
 
Mary has been running a grocery business since 2005. She sells a number of food items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, cabbages, spinach and dried fish. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Mary currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. 

She is currently requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy more fruits, cabbages, spinach, tomatoes and onions. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks. Mary thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, cabbages, spinach, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer que trabaja  en la venta de zapatos, ropa y cosméticos desde hace catorce años el cual inicio con fondos propios para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio memorial sandino en la ciudad de Managua, sus hijos son mayores y viven independientes, su esposo es inspector de la policía nacional. Con este crédito es su noveno ciclo el cual va invertir en mercadería variada de ropa de niño como para adulto, zapatos. Estos préstamos han sido de muchos beneficios en su vida personal por que se siente que ha logrado sus objetivos en el comercio. A corto plazo espera incrementar el volumen de inventario.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who works selling shoes, clothing and cosmetics, beginning 14 years ago with her own funds in order to help her husband with household expenses. She is 42 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. Her children are grown and live independently, and her husband is an inspector with the national police. This is her ninth loan cycle, which she will invest in merchandise including clothing for children and adults as well as shoes. These loans have been very beneficial to her personal life, as she feels she has accomplished her commercial goals. In the short term, she hopes to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: E. Ayaba est une résidente du quartier d’agoè atsanvé, elle exerce dans la restauration mais sa spécialité est la vente de riz, très tôt le matin les travailleurs et surtout les écoliers achètent chez elle avant d’aller à l’école. Elle est très connue parce que sa cuisine est très appréciée dans son quartier. Son stock de produits de première nécessité qu’elle utilise pour la cuisson est épuisé, elle sollicite à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 4 cartons de poulets, 8cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers produits. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
E. Ayaba is a resident of the Agoè Atsanvé district. She works in the restaurant business, but her specialty is in selling rice. Very early in the morning, travelers and especially school children buy from her before going to school. She is well-known because her cooking is highly appreciated in her district. Her stock of essential ingredients she uses for cooking is exhausted. She’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy: five sacks of rice, four boxes of chickens, eight boxes of pasta, and various goods. She is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken, and pasta

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina M., 34, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the ice cake and popcorn business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Christina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, corn, oil, cordial, foam cups

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her mother financially and provide for her family.

Patricia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells sugary kenkey. She prepares the food in her house and hawks in the community and at the market square. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from wholesalers in the nearby towns. Patricia has been in the business for five years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to make some savings before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Senior High School. Stella sells provisions at Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a video operator. Stella uses her income to pay for the light bill and school fees. Stella will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to improve the business.

loans.use: Stella will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale to expand the business.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Minda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Minda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Minda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Ysabel es casada, tiene 62 años y 12 hijos, Ysabel viaja a las ferias D. la región 5 veces a la semana en donD. venD. ropa variada y D. las ferias compra cereales, quesos que venD. en su barrio. Además Ysabel tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo e hijos. Ysabel también confecciona ropa típica.
Ysabel necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. uniformes escolares, faldas, mandiles.
Los sueños D. Ysabel son comprar una maquina industrial para su taller.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Ysabel is married, 62 years old, and has 12 children. Ysabel travels to regional markets 5 times a week where she sells various clothing items and from the markets she purchases grains, and cheese that she sells in her neighborhood. In addition, Ysabel has a small grocery store in her home, which she runs with her husband and children. Ysabel also makes traditional clothing. Ysabel needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of school clothing, skirts, and aprons. Ysabel dream is to purchase an industrial machine for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of school clothing, skirts, and aprons.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy K. is 53 years old and lives in Battambong Province. K. and her husband work hard to ensure a comfortable life for their two school-aged children and other two children who dropped out of school and are employed in a garment factory.

She has an orchard where she harvests fruit and other vegetables, typically earning US $3 per day. Her husband, presented in the picture, is a motor-taxi driver who always travels around his village and local markets, seeking customers, and is able to earn approximately US $3 per day. K. really wants to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase various sorts of vegetables and grain to resell. It is very obvious that when she succeeds with her business plan by using her expected loan for investment, she will be able to obtain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase various sorts of vegetables and grain.

loans.name: Asomdwehene 1 Group

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old and the group leader. She is married and the mother of three kids. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, which are cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch, and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food, such as bags of maize, at the market square. She has been selling kenkey for ten years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children - especially in their education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asomdwehene 1’ which literally means 'prince of peace.' She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a food vendor in the village.  She lives in Binarzang,Quirino, Isabela. Aside from selling grilled foods like barbecue, also sells cooked snacks such as sweetened potato and banana. She wanted her business to become profitable.  With this she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000.00 for her business to grow.  She is very optimistic that lenders will somehow grant her request.

Lilibeth is married to Edison who is a simple farmer. She is 33 years old and a mother of three kids and they are now in the elementary level.  Lilibeth felt lucky for having a good and happy family. She dreams to send all her children to school until they finish their studies in college. She hopes to alleviate her family \from poverty through their hard works, patience and the continuous financial support of Kiva loans.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ceriaca

texts.en:
Ceriaca A. is from the village of San Isidro in Talakag Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Ceriaca is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ceriaca makes and sells food in the local community. Ceriaca just started this business.

In 2009, Ceriaca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ceriaca is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Ceriaca's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old and is married to Jonathan who is a businessman. The couple has two children, Pauline and Victor, who are nine and five years old respectively.

Agnes has been running a nursery school for young children for two years. Agnes' business is located in a densely populated area with mid-level residents who are her clients.

She was introduced to KADET by existing group members and she does not have any previous credit history. She has applied for a loan to progress her business by adding more textbooks to her school and using the balance from this to repair rental houses that she manages on the side. She plans to use the extra profits to expand the classes to higher levels of learning.

Agnes believes she is naturally motivated and focused and her future aspiration is to own a secondary school.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing textbooks and repairing rental rooms

loans.name: Edvin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Edvin Antonio A. , tiene la edad 44 años, habita en Ciudad Real, ubicado en Veracruz , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja en un cyber como administradora para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar  ellos tienen dos hijos a su cargo de 16 y 12 años actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es ampliar parte de la vivienda , ya que su casa es muy pequeña para los cuatro que habitan , don Edvin trabaja desde hace 13 años para el consejo supremo electoral , con mucho esfuerzos por parte de él , su esposa y la buena aprobación de sus tres crédito a logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda .Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción  y comenzar a construir y poder dar a su familia las mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para construir mas grande su casa

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides tiene 47 años, casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tiene 23, 25 y 27 años y no viven en su casa ya no. Se negocio es ganado. El compra el ganado cuando sea joven y vende cuando sea gordo. Ahora tiene 7 ganado pero la gustaría mas. El esta aquilando pasto que es suficiente para 10 vaccas entonces el piense que debería crecer su finca. Es su primer prestamo con Fudecosur y prefiere los prestamos Fudecosures por que hay menos requistos que los bancos formales.
texts.en:
Alcides is 47 years old, married and has 3 children who are his first priority. His children are 23, 25, and 27 years old and they don´t live in his house anymore. His business is cattle. He buys the cattle when they are young and sells them when they are fat. Now he has 7 cattle but he would like more. He is renting a pasture that is sufficient for 10 cows, so he thinks that he should be able to grow his farm. It is his first loan with Fudecosur and he prefers the Fudecosur loans because they have fewer requisites than the formal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Señor de los Milagros II” esta representado por la señora Ana Karen y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales tienen diferentes actividades de comercialización como la venta de comida, ropa, producto de belleza y joyas, Servicio de peluquería y estilismo, confección de prendas de vestir, comida al paso, abarrote, servicio de chapería y servicio de moto taxista. A pesar de la competencia los socios saben como hacer llevadera cada una de las competencias ofreciendo productos a menor precio o diversificando su mercadería, es por esta razón que las socias necesitan el financiamiento para contar con una mayor cantidad de capital para obtener mercadería al por mayor a un menor costo y abaratar los precios, también para la reparación de sus herramientas y puestos de trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya cuenta con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero el apoyo brindado por la Fundación es los que los alienta para seguir adelante y seguir buscando el progreso de sus negocios y el mejoramiento de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “El Señor de los Milagros II” group is represented by Ana Karen and made up of 12 members who engage in various commercial activities such as: sales of prepared meals, clothing, beauty products, jewelry, barber shop and hair styling, clothing manufacture, street food stands, grocery stores, auto detailing, mototaxi services. Despite market competition, the members know how to get ahead by offering products at lower cost or diversifying their merchandise. For this reason, the members need financing in order to have a larger amount of working capital to acquire merchandise at lower wholesale prices so that they can offer their wares to their customers for a lower price as well. They also need to repair their work tools and improve their sales stalls. The members of this group already have experience with these types of loans having received financing from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital but the help offered by the Fundación is what encourages them to continue forward seeking progress in their commercial activities and bettering the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa A. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a security guard at a local branch office of one of Mongolia's largest banks, her three oldest children currently attend university, and her youngest two are in secondary school.

Bayarmaa operates a small grocery shop near her home. She sells a variety of food products to customers in her neighborhood. Bayarmaa started her business in 2008 with capital of 500,000 MNT (~350 USD) after previously selling consumer goods. She has found success in her first year of operation, and her shop is well established in her community. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT (~700 USD).

Bayarmaa has gained much business experience over the years and is currently planning to expand her business. She hopes to soon expand the product variety at her shop and says, "I would like to sell all the products that my customers demand. I also plan to sell coal and firewood at my shop." She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (~910 USD) loan to purchase rice, flour, and other grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, and other grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Roel

texts.es: El Sr. Roel C. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de adobe junto a su esposa y su menor hija en el Caserío  San Antonio. Se dedica a labores de campo en una empresa Agrícola de la zona, además su esposa lo apoya laborando de forma informal en parcelas de sus vecinos dedicándose además a crianza de animales. Su casa es de adobe y caña por lo cual se vieron afectados por el terremoto con lo cual han solicitado ayuda y han accedido al beneficio de la construcción de un módulo de vivienda para lo cual necesitan de un financiamiento para concluir con el techado y demás acabados. Son personas muy trabajadoras cuyo sueño principal es lograr tener su casa construida para gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le podamos brindar para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
30-year old Roel C., his wife, and youngest daughter live in their own adobe house in Caserío San Antonio. He works as a farm labourer in an agricultural business while his wife helps out by working as a casual labourer on their neighbours’ land. She also raises animals. As their house is made of adobe and reeds, they are often affected by earthquakes. They asked for help with the house and a new home has been built. Now they need a loan for roofing etc so they can finish the house. They are very hardworking people whose dream is to have their house completed so they can enjoy a better quality of life. They are both grateful for the financial help that enables them to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to complete his home

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 28 years old, is single, and takes care of two relatives. He lives in Rwamagana, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

Ignace runs a well-known cosmetics shop in Rwamagana which he has operated successfully for three years. He opted to do business in cosmetics because it is a very productive business. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Ignace is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He plans to use the loan to buy more cosmetics product in order to satisfy his customers’ growing demands and to attract more customers. He also plans to use a portion of the loan to buy a computer that will help him in the smooth running of his business.

If his plan works out, Ignace hopes to realize more profits than before, which he will reinvest in his business and better support his brothers by providing food and other basic requirements. He will also buy more computers for his growing business to facilitate quick and better services for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and a computer for his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are in primary school. Her eldest child is 11 years old. Grace and her family live in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a civil servant.

Grace sells groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for three years. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Grace is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel C. B. se dedica a vender abarrotes al mayoreo y menudeo desde hace 5 años. Este negocio es llamado “Distribuidora de abarrotes el mago Feliz” lo que hace es ir por los negocios pequeños a surtirles de mercancía dependiendo de cómo necesiten el articulo, el se traslada en una camioneta grande donde carga la mercancía y así distribuye su mercancía. En este momento el pide del apoyo para mejor el negocio y poner nuevos artículos para así vender mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniel has been selling groceries wholesale and to the retail trade for 5 years. His business is called "Happy Wizard Grocery Distributor" and what he does is go to small businesses and supply them with goods depending on their needs. He gets around in a large van that he fills with his goods, and in this way he distributes his supplies. At the moment, he requests support to improve his business and add new items so that he can offer his customers more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his business

loans.name: Okari

texts.en: Okari is 29 years old, married, and blessed with two children who attend school.  He operates a retail shop where he sells cosmetics.  He also earns extra income from his temporary rental houses.  Okari has learned how to manage his money and business through his field partner, Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to strengthen his business, and for this reason he has requested 50,000 KES to add items such as lotions, face cream and nail polish to his stock.  Okari dreams of being financially stable, owning more business premises and having more sources of income.  He describes himself as hardworking, understanding and honest.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such lotion, face cream and nail polish

loans.name: Irene Mae

texts.en:
Irene Mae R. is from the village of Purok Makugihon, Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Irene Mae is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene Mae owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Irene Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene Mae is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Irene Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a diligent man who has been operating a butcher shop for five years in Dandora, Nairobi. He has also been able to open up a cafeteria next to his butcher shop through Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva.  He hopes to improve the standards of his cafeteria, hence he has requested for a KES 80,000 loan.  He also wants to use part of this loan to buy meat to stock his butcher shop. He has employed one person in his butcher and he dreams of employing more people in the future.  David is married and has three children.

loans.use: Improve cafe and add stock of meat.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion P. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Concepcion is married and has 1 school-aged child. Concepcion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food & daily use products. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her range of products. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Concepcion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product range

loans.name: María Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora María Gregoria G. C. es casada de profesión profesora de primaria desde hace once años en el colegio Efraín Tijerino Mazariego, vive en la colonia Santa Ana tiene cinco hijos dos viven bajo su responsabilidad los otros ya se casaron.

La señora María Gregoria G. C. tiene dos años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación, pero necesita cambiar unas laminas de zinc por que se le pasa el agua, la señora Maria Gregoria ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maria Gregoria G. C. lives in the Santa Ana neighborhood. She is married and has five children. Two of the children are under her care, and the others are already married. For eleven years, Maria Gregoria has been an elementary school teacher in the Efraín Tijerino Mazariego school. Maria Gregoria has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She used the previous loan to make improvements to her home, and now she needs to change some of the leaky roofing sheets. Maria Gregoria has shown that she is very responsible in meeting her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (metal roofing sheets, nails, labor)

loans.name: Sarl

texts.en: Mrs. Sarl S., 29 years old, is a widow with a child who is a student in a local school. She is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy-ID village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarl S. is a cloth seller who earns a small income to support herself. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more cloth to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika G. y su esposo el señor Héctor Garcia son padres de familia ya tiene varios años que se viven en Nuevo Laredo, toda su familia se quedo en el sur de la ciudad.
Tiene un problema que la mama del señor Héctor Garcia necesita urgentemente una operación, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario. Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder mandarle el dinero a la señora y así la puedan operar antes de que sea más complicado. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene la señora Erika G. de su trabajo en una fábrica en el departamento de producción. 
Con el ingreso del señor Héctor Garcia que obtiene de su trabaja que tiene en una fabrica  será para los gastos familiares
texts.en:
Erika G. and her husband Héctor Garcia are parents who have lived for several years in Nuevo Laredo. All of their family members are in the south of the city. They currently have a problem: Héctor Garcia's mother urgently needs an operation, but she does not have the necessary funds. For this reason, they are requesting a loan so that they can send her the money and she can receive the operation before her condition becomes worse. They plan to repay the loan with the income Erika G. receives from her work in the production department of a factory. The income Héctor Garcia obtains from his work, also in a factory, will be used for the family's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: H. Félicienne est née vers 1968 au BENIN et est mariéé à AGUINDE Samuel un chauffeur. Félicienne vit à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-kpodji depuis onze ans. Félicienne est mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés dont cinq sont à sa charge. Félicienne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Félicienne mène comme activité la vente de fournitures scolaires (bic, cahier, ardoise, crayon, chiffon, craie etc.)et des sachets au marché de son quartier depuis vingt deux ans. Félicienne s'approvisionne au grand marché international du Benin qu'est Dantokpa. Félicienne a déja bénéficié quatre fois de concours financiers auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. Pour renforcer toujours son activité et pour faire face aux besoins existants de sa clientèle, Félicienne souhaite renouveller un nouveau Prêt.
texts.en:
Félicienne H. was born in 1968 in Benin and is married to Samuel Aguinde, a driver. Félicienne has lived in Sekandji in the Seme-kpodji community for 11 years. Félicienne is married and mother of seven children, all of whom are educated. Five of them are still under her care. Félicienne never went to school. To help her husband, Félicienne has sold school supplies (pens, notebooks, slates, pencils, erasers, chalk, etc.) and bags at the market in her quarter for 20 years. She buys her supplies at the international market of Bénin in Dantokpa. Félicienne has already benefited from four ALIDé loans which she has repaid. In order to continue to strengthen her business and meet the existing needs of her clients, Félicienne wishes to receive a new loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies (notebooks, pens, pencils, slates, erasers, etc) and bags

loans.name: Las Gardeneas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  las Gardenias les gusto el nombre porque dicen que ellas son como las flores de bonitas,  son 6 integrantes: la Sra. Ma. Magdalena Aragón Vázquez  se dedica a la venta de antojitos, la Sra. Milia B. R. a la venta de paletas  de hielo, la Sra. Petra T. B. se dedica a la venta de queso y crema, la Sra. Berenice V. Méndez a la venta de raspados, la Sra. Azucena Rojas F. va a iniciar la venta de zapatos, la Sra. Nancy V. Vázquez también va a iniciar una actividad, la venta de dulces.
Ma. Magdalena es la representante del grupo ella es madre soltera por que  se separo de su esposo hace 5 años a pesar de eso, ella no se dejo caer en la depresión y decidió salir adelante y trabajar para sus hijos: Leticia de 17 años, Gabriela de 16 años, Ricardo de 13 años. Ella empezó trabajando en el parque industrial de Cuautla, era cocinera y su horario era de 8:00 a 6:00 de la tarde por tal motivo descuidaba mucho a sus hijos es por eso que decidió poner un negocio en su casa para ya no abandonarlos tanto tiempo y este fue la venta de antojitos, este negocio le permite disfrutar más a sus hijos porque lo atiende de 8:00 a 12:00 del día,  lleva 1 año con él y le va muy bien
Con el crédito quiere surtirse de mercancía para elaborar los alimentos que ella prepara como son: las quesadillas, sopes y tacos. Su meta para el futuro es construir un local especial para su negocio ya que por el momento vende en la calle afuera de su casa.
Ma. Magdalena dice que está muy contenta de que Fundación Realidad les dé la oportunidad de darles un préstamo a ella y su grupo: las gardenias. Está segura de que no les fallarán. También les agradece a las personas de KIVA porque están dispuestos a ayudar a la gente que más lo necesita y así pueden sacar adelante tanto a sus negocios como a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Gardenias" (The Gardenias). They like the name because they say that they are like those beautiful flowers. There are 6 members: Magdalena Aragón Vázquez sells snacks, Milia B. R. sells popcicles, Petra T. B. sells cheese and cream, Sra. Berenice V. Méndez sells raspados (shaved ice treats), Azucena Rojas F. is going to start a shoe business, and Nancy V. Vázquez will also start a business selling sweets. Magdalena is the representative of the group. She is a single mother, because she separated from her husband 5 years ago. In spite of this, she did not let herself fall into depression; she decided to push ahead and work for her children: Leticia, who is 17; Gabriela, who is 16; and Ricardo, who is 13 years old. She started working in the industrial park of Cuautla; she was a cook and she worked from 8am until 6 in the evening. This schedule did not allow her to care for her children, and for this reason she decided to start a business in her house making snacks so she would not have to leave them for so much time. This business has allowed her to enjoy her children more, because she attends to the business from 8am until noon. She has had this business for a year, and it is going very well. With the loan she wants to stock up on merchandise to make the food that she prepares, such as: quesadillas, sopes and tacos. Her goal for the future is to build a special place for her business, since at the moment she sells in the street outside her house. Magdalena says that she is very content with the Fundación Realidad. They have given her and her group (The Gardenias) the opportunity to take loans. She is sure that they are going to succeed. Also, she is grateful to the people from Kiva because they are willing to help the people who need it most, and in this way help them get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food

loans.name: Neli Antonio

texts.pt:
Neli António T. vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente. Também Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra está num estado bastante avançado, falta algumas coberturas e acabamentos. Na sua vida melhorou condição de habitabilidade. O presente empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros) para concluir a obra da sua casa. 
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo reformar a sua residência. Pretende solicitar mais crédito para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Neli António lives in Boane, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. With her last loan she was able to buy all the materials needed and it has been enough to fulfill it. She was also able to pay her loan according to the established timeline. Her construction is in a very advanced stage, some roofing and finishings are missing. In her life, the living conditions have improved. The current loan, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, is intended to buy construction materials (cement, stones, sand, bricks and others) to finish the construction of her house. She is very pleased with the loan, she is managing to renovate her house. She intends to request more loans to finish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, sand, bricks and others)

loans.name: Kanyansheko Abamwe, Ibanda Group

texts.en: Three years ago K. Rose started up her banana selling business in Kanyansheko, Ibanda in western Uganda. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet albeit with some long drawn out seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets. With a strong work ethic, the 29 year old married mother of one child has kept her business on a path of consolidated growth. In a month, she makes close to 80,000 Ugandan shillings. Her business has gained ground over these years and her family has benefited. Her business plan of action for the forthcoming future is to be able to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market. With this loan, she envisages purchasing manure and fertilizers for the banana plantation in order to improve the output.

loans.use: buying agricultural materials like manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn S. is from the village of Usocan. She is 38 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Genelyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Genelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah, the wife of M. N., resides in Kasur, a Pakistani city famous for its sweetmeat and dairy businesses. This 43-year-old caring lady lives with her family and in-laws in a three-room house, taking care of all of their needs.

Misbah's husband, a goldsmith who learned his skill from his father, a famous jeweler of his time, makes jewelry sets, gold bangles and earrings. He started doing this work independently before his marriage in a shop located in the busiest part of the market. Dealing with many customers in a day and fulfilling their requirements, he faces tough competition from other jewelry shops. To compete with them, he keeps current with the new trends and designs of jewelry sets.

Misbah is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business so that he can diversify his products by adding silver jewelry sets and beautiful gem sets. With the loan he will buy the gems and silver and use them to make new jewelry sets so that lower-income people can also approach him easily. Misbah is hopeful that this investment will help her husband diversify his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase silver and gems for jewelry business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 27 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marites joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques N., née à Kamonyi, ancien préfecture de Gitarama, aujourd’hui il se trouve en province de la ville de Kiali-Rwanda, il est marié, il a 46 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est primaire.  Il a 6 enfants, le premier a 17 ans et le cadet a un mois, quatre des ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il habite en district de Nyarugenge, Nyamirambo en province de la ville de Kigali. Il est éleveur des poules,  il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour acheter les petits poussins afin d’augmenter le nombre des ses bétails. Ses épargnes lui ont permis de pouvoir élever les poules pour commercialiser les viandes des poulets et les œufs provenant de son élevage, grâce a ces épargnes il a pu payer le minerval des ses enfants. Dans l’avenir il veut continuer à mieux payer son prêt  afin de pouvoir bien tenir sa famille aisément et de stabiliser son économie.
texts.en:
Mr Jacques N., born in Kamonyi, which was previously in the district of Gitarama, and is currently near the city of Kiali-Rwanda. He is married, 46 years old, and completed primary education. He has six children between the ages of 17 and one month old, four of whom are currently attending school. He lives in the district of Nyarugenge, Nyamirambo, near the city of Kigali. He raises chickens, and recently acquired a loan from Amasezerano in order to purchase baby chicks to increase his stock of chickens. His savings allowed him to raise the chickens and sell both chicken meat and eggs. His savings also allowed me to pay the school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to continue to repay his loan on time in order to take care of his family's needs and to stabilize his economic situation.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby chicks to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita C. is from the village of Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Esterlita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, instant noodles, detergents, bath soaps and shampoo in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City, Bukidnon

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 25 years and employs five farmhands. His mixed farm produces tea, milk and maize which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his shop which he operates in the same region. His biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough animal feed.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his child in school. In the future he would like to purchase more agricultural land to expand his farm.

Peter is 54 years old. He is married with seven children who are between the ages of 26 and 35. His youngest child is currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transportation.

He has operated a barber shop for over three months. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Charles faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During week days, he experiences low customer turn out because of work inconveniences while, during the weekends, he experiences high customer turn out.   

He decided to join Yehu to get loans to change his business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase mirrors and a hair-cutting machine.

loans.use: To purchase mirrors and a hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edda Patricia; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de repostería, ella hace mermeladas de todos los sabores como naranja, fresa, manzana y duraznos, la socia también prepara tortas y pasteles, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender la mermelada y tortas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para preparar las mermeladas y tortas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edda Patricia belongs to the “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

She is 46 years old, divorced, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her confectionery business.  She makes jam in all flavors such as orange, strawberry, apple and peach.  She also makes cakes.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her jams and cakes.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making jam and cakes.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by helping to fund her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making jams and cakes

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon P. is from the village of Mapuroc San Mateo. She is 28 years old. Sharon is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sharon owns and operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport. Sharon has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sharon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Sharon is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the first loan taken by Sharon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: The man in the picture is Kuch R., 32, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around river in his community. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his regular customers who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Eang Hor; she is 30 and assists him in the same business. The couple is blessed with two young kids who are still enrolled in school. Kuch R. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so he can catch more fish.

loans.name: Gladys De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Gladys B., trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (UNI), ubicada en la oficina de servicios administrativos, tiene 10 años de laborar como cocinera.
Es madre soltera, su hijo está en edad escolar, ella ya ha pagado 5 créditos en CEPRODEL, los que han pagado puntualmente, los ha utilizado para mejora de su vivienda. Este crédito lo quiere para reparar su vivienda, y para los gastos de la colegiatura de su hijo, ya que en febrero inicia el año escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Bustamente works at the National University of Engineering.  She has worked as a cook fo 10 years in the administrative services building.

She is a single mother and has one school-aged son.  She has taken out 5 loans through CEPRODEL all of which have been paid back on time.  She used the money for home improvement.  She plans to use this loan to make repairs around the house and to pay for school expenses for her son who begins the school year in February.

loans.use: To repair her home and pay for school expenses for her son

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 28 years old and married. He graduated from primary school. He has a garage and he is balances tires on various automobiles. 

The borrower will use this loan to develop his garage which is located in an industrial area. He will purchase equipment that he will use in his business. The borrower offers excellent services to his clients. He has a good reputation  in the industrial area despite his young age. He charges reasonable fees for his service.

loans.use: For purchasing equipment

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita ives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a dried fish vending business and a jewelry business.  Her common-law husband Pablito,  who is 60 years old, works as a dried dish vendor to earn his living.  Emelita has 10 children who are between 16 and 40 years old. Emelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use as funds for her business operations to continue to save up for future expansion of her business and for family needs. Emelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Ramatu C.. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 3. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they were given to her by her in-law.  

In 2006, Ramatu started selling food like bulgur, rice, corn meal and oil. She began her business because she learned it from her mother. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy bags of bulgur, rice and salt. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 360,000 SLL. 

In the future, Ramatu plans to get a house of her own, and she is very excited as she knows the loan will help. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of bulgur rice and salt

loans.name: Goussi Afi Mawussé

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Madame Afi est mariée et a un enfant.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de céréales. Elle a commencé  en 2005 cette activité et s’approvisionne au marché local d’akodessewa. Ensuite elle revend à son domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs  de mil et 3 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Mrs. Afi is 38 years old and married with one child. To help meet household needs, she sells cereals. She started this business in 2005, and gets her supplies at the local market in Akodessewa. She then resells at her home. She's seeking a loan to purchase 5 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of millet, and 3 sacks of bean.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of millet, and 3 sacks of bean

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
KIA B. fait le commerce de légumes dans ce groupe de femmes BENKADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  3 sacs de 100kg de concombres, 6 sacs de 100kg d’oignons, 4 paniers de tomates fraiches,  3 sacs de 100kg de choux pommés. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et environnants. Elle les revend au marché de Mancourani I dans la ville de Sikasso, à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI solidarity group are married women who average 36 years of age and two children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Mancourani I, a popular district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
This is their ninth loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Previous loans were correctly repaid.

KIA B. is a Benkadi group member who sells vegetables. With her loan, she plans to buy three 100 kg bags of cucumbers, six 100 kg bags of onions, four baskets of fresh tomatoes, and three 100 kg bags of cabbage. She buys her stock in the city of Sikasso and surrounding areas. She conducts her sales at the Mancourani I market in Sikasso, at a fixed location, and also from her home. She sells for cash to a clientele composed of both men and women.
