She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan, pay the interest, and boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es chofer, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de un motor nuevo para su movilidad de transporte de pasajeros; con los ingresos que obtiene cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en la casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La P.. Es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron y pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: David is a driver. He needs this loan to purchase a new engine for his passenger transport business.  He covers his family’s expenses with the income he earns through this business.  He owns a home in the neighborhood of Tembladerani in the city of La P..  He is married and has four children.  David is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to him, as they have helped him to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his passenger transport business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia, vive en la zona de chacacollo , es casada tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Claudia se dedica a la venta de comida,  la actividad que realiza es de hace 5 años realiza el preparado de chank´a de pollo y pescado a la parrilla los días viernes, sábado, domingo, por lo que es muy conocido en su zona por las riquísimas comidas que prepara ,el préstamo lo invertirá para la refacción y reparación de  su rockola ya que esta en mal estado, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy luchadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Claudia lives in the Chacacollo zone is married and has two children who are students.  She sells food, an activity she’s been doing for the past five years.  She prepares chank’a de pollo (typical dish from Cochabamba) and grilled fish on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  She is very well known in her area for the delicious dishes she prepares.  She will use the loan to repair her jukebox which is in bad shape.  She is a very hard working, tenacious person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair her jukebox.

loans.name: Sidra Sehar

texts.en:
Sidra Sehar is a very supportive lady who provides full financial support to her husband by doing embroidery work. She receives orders from her community clients and fills them on time to earn profit. She is also a very good housewife and fulfills her responsibilities very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan in buying embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk that will allow her to complete the orders on time and earn better profits. 

She has been doing this business for the past seven years and is hopeful that this loan investment will be a profitable one for her business and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her family as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

She comes from Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its tannery industry. Her home is situated in Azher colony and contains 2 rooms. She has been living there with her family for many years.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 44 years old. He is married to Aziza and has four children. He started a food business 16 years ago by building a restaurant. His restaurant basically provides traditional food like hummus, falafel, and sandwiches. After getting a lot of customers, he added a section for making different types of barbecue, Kabab, grilled chicken, steaks, etc. Because of his delicious food, good service and his generosity, people didn’t mind that he did not have a good seating area at the restaurant. They used to make take away orders so they wouldn't miss eating his food. Since it is better to eat steaks and grilled chicken when it is warm, Ashraf decided to apply for a loan to redecorate his seating area to give his customer the chance to eat the food while it is warm.

loans.use: To redecorate the seating area of his restaurant

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes, vive en la ribera Morelia, municipio de Coapilla, ella es casada con el señor jais y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes dos ya están casados y tres aun vive con ella, y son: baltazaretti  de diesi seis años de edad, marco Antonio  de doce años  y la ultima es estrella yuriana de cinco años de edad,


     Ella se de doca a la elaboración de  dulce, como son: dulces de nuégado, chilacayote, como también elabora tamales  de hoja de guineo para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes de cada una de sus actividades, en este trabajo lleva  cuatro años y siete meses en la que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello obtiene ingresos para su hogar.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por si sola ya que también quiere apoyar a su espeso con lo ingresos  ya si juntos sacar adelante a su familia  dándole lo más necesario en su educación.

   Lo que desea es que la sigan poyando con el crédito para continuar trabajando so su pequeña actividad que es con lo que se poya para tener ingresos y de eso mismo los apoya para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is married to Jais and they live on the shore of the Morelia, town of Coapilla.  They have four sons and daughters, two who are married, and three that still live with them.  They are: Baltazaretti, sixteen, Marco Antonio, twelve, and the youngest, Estrella Yuriana, five.

She makes sweets such as walnut and chilacayote (a tropical fruit) candies, and also prepares tamales in banana leaves (wrapped corn dough with other foods) to sell in the same stand.  She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for each of these foods.  Maria has been doing this work for four years and six months and she says that it’s going well and gives her earnings for her household.

She was inspired to start this work for herself and also she wanted to help her husband with the income.  She wants to improve the life of her family by giving them what is the most necessary, education.

She wants to continue and the loan will help her keep working in her little business that gives her some money and lets her children go on in their schooling.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales (corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) with mole (sauce of many ingredients) and walnut and chilacayote (a tropical fruit) sweets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. Erlinda is 77 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Erlinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. 

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta has a vegetable shop that sells a variety of vegetables. She has had this business for six years. Marieta is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers for her vegetable plants. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizes for her vegetable plants.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
This is Mirasol, 39, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and has two children.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mirasol is a fish vendor. She has a stall located in the community market.  She earns income by buying fish from the wholesaler and selling it per kilo in the community market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional fish stock to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mirasol hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fish she needs for her store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 25, is a hardworking and honest businessman. He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last two years, he has been meeting the needs of his family by selling fish. He wants in the next five years to have penetrated larger markets so that he is able to realize his dream of becoming a landlord in as short a time as possible. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him economically.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives in Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). Tereza has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Tereza sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She also generates additional income through renting rooms and selling piped water. The main business challenges for Tereza include increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to start selling charcoal to the villages of Luwero. Tereza lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for electricity, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Susan has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for 8 years.         

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business. Susan is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing capital in her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Graciela Yolanda

texts.es:
Graciela Yolanda tiene 41 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 18 y 10 años,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Graciela se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y la venta de los pollos. Enfreta desafios como la edad y la salud. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir sembrando y comprar una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela Yolanda is 41 years old. She is married and lives with her two children 18 and 10, respectively. They live in the town of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. 

The name of the community bank is El Placer, and it is located in Chillanes in the San Jose del Tambo parrish. There are 24 members who work in agriculture growing plantains, rice, yucca, cocoa, soy beans, and oranges. They also raise animals.

Graciela works growing rice, corn, oranges, soy beans, and plantains. She raises chickens to sell as well. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and makes her sales at the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural products, fertilizer, and chicken feed. The loan will help her improve her crops and her chicken sales. The . Her dream is to purchase more land, so that she can continue growing crops and eventually buy a house. 

In her free time she likes to go for walks with her children.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies, fertilizers, and chicken feed

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Angeles tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la Aldea el Papalon de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ahi vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta de granos de maíz y plátanos.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, atiende a sus clientes de lunes a domingo, sus clientes son personas que trabajan en las compañias meloneras y cañeras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia de uso personal, desea tener mas surtido su negocio.

su meta es tener su negocio bien surtido para la navidad.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles is 36 years old, she lives in El Papalon, a community of the town of San Lorenzo. She lives there with her 4 children and her husband, who engages in selling maize grains and plantains.
Maria engages in selling everyday products. She runs a corner shop in her house, and she tends to her customers Mondays to Sundays. Her customers are employed by the melons and sugarcane farms.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy personal use products, as she wishes to better supply her shop.

Her goal is to have her shop well stocked up by Christmas.

loans.use: To buy soap, condicioner, hair gel, baby oil, deodorants, skin and face creams, nail polishes, nail varnish removers, threads, safety pins and water.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one school going child. Her husband, who is a caretaker at a nearby institution, also provides for their family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees for her child. 

She has operated a tea leaves selling business for the past two years and her potential clients are the neighbors and retail operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, sometimes you may get low quality tea leaves because of lack of rain. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more tea leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it’s committed to helping low income earners through giving of loans to uplift their business.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a married man with no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and he works and continues his studies at the same time. 

Fadi wants to pay his university fees to complete his studies and get the first university degree, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. He needs to take a loan of $1,200 from FATEN. 

When Fadi gets the loan he will be able to pay the university fees and continue his study to get the first university degree. This will change his life positively because he will have a better standard of living and be able take up a good position in his society. 

Fadi is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин занимается на протяжении многих лет выращиванием зерновых культур виноградоводством и садоводством. Он также занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Жена вместе с детьми помогают мужу по бизнесу. После реорганизации колхозов в Дехканские хозяйства они вместе с женой стали членами дехканских хозяйств. Иметь троих детей это значит иметь большую семью. Чтобы содержать семью надо много работать. Они стараются получать хороший урожай, обрабатывают землю сеют лучшие семена. Они также занимаются садоводством и выращиванием на мясо крупного рогатого скота. Он приобрел земельный участок. Зайниддин хочет построить новый дом. Для постройки нового дома ему нужны средства. Он хочет получить займ и начать закладывать фундамент нового дома. Он надеется, что добрые люди поддержат его и помогут в строительстве дома. На полученный займ он купит стройматериалы: цемент, гравий и камни. Он ждет поддержки. Спасибо!
texts.en:
For many years Zainiddin has grown grain crops and been generally involved in horticulture. Additionally, he breeds large cattle. Zainiddin's family helps him run the business. 
After the reorganization of the collective farm (kolhoz) system into dekhan farms, Zainiddin and his wife became the owners of such a farm. 
Having three children means a lot of responsibility and one must work hard to support them. Together, Zainiddin and his wife develop the land, plant the best seeds and try to gather the most bountiful harvest. Also, they tend an orchard and breed large cattle. 
Zainiddin bought a plot of land that he wants to build a house on. To accomplish that, he needs some funds. He hopes to receive the loan and begin laying the foundation for his new home. He hopes that kind people will support him in his endeavor. He's asking for the loan in order to purchase building materials, such as: cement, gravel and stone. He's asking for your support. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel and stone needed to build a house.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix aprendió este negocio desde muy joven, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy contento al seguir trabajando con Fundación. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de reparación aparatos eléctricos. La mayoría de sus clientes saben que el ofrece un buen servicio y además realiza sus trabajo a precio favorable. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar aceite, alambres, alicates, toma corrientes, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Félix learned this business when he was very young and this is not the first time he has requested loans so that he feels very pleased to continue working with Fundación. He provides a service repairing electrical appliances. The majority of his customers know that he offers good service and does so, as well, at a reasonable price. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy oil, wire, pliers and outlets, among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, wire, pliers and outlets among other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” cuenta con 12 integrantes todas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, se conformaron recientemente como un comité,  pero la mayoría ya había participado en otros grupos. Todas se muestran muy alegres y con ganas de salir adelante y como son todas vecinas se comprometen a realizar actividades para juntar más dinero para cualquier emergencia que se presente.
Una de ellas es la señora Laura, quien gracias a la venta de perfumes que hace puede ayudar en la casa y cubrir los gastos diarios. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y muy emprendedora, gracias a sus esfuerzos está pudiendo salir adelante y seguir sus sueños.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de fragancias, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, para que de esa manera pueda abastecerse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras (“Hardworking Women”) Committee is composed of 12 people, all coming from the town of Villa Elisa. Even though they have been recently come together to form a committee, the majority of them had already formed part of other groups. All of them are very cheerful and wish to get on in life. As they are neighbors they commit to engaging in activities to earn more money to face any emergency that may present itself.
Laura is one of them. Thanks to her perfumes sale she is able to help her family and to pay for family expenses. She considers herself to be a very hardworking, tenacious and resourceful woman, and thanks to her efforts she is succeeding in getting on in life and in following her dreams.
She is requesting a loan to buy both male and female fragrances in order to have enough products to satisfy her customers’ requests.

loans.use: To buy male and female perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 35 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 5 and 7. His business is well organized. He has a boutique where he sells cooking oil, rice, soap, sugar, salt, etc. Jean Paul has five years of experience and employs one person to help him.

Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sugar, soap, and so on to sell. With the profits he earns as a result of this loan, Jean Paul will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, soap, and sugar, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 33, is a single mother of one child who attends school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rent is their greatest monthly expense.

Dorcas operates a green grocery business at the market, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Dorcas dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 30,000, Dorcas wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to sell. She joined Yehu to access financial services.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Callistus

texts.en:
Callistus is 50 years old, married, and a father of four children. He is a livestock farmer and has been in the business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 12,000, with which he plans to buy additional livestock such as goats and ducks. The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family.

 In the future, this gentleman hopes to grow his business into large scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Twisununure Group

texts.fr:
Antoinette fait partie du groupe Twisununure.  Elle habite à Gitega, elle a 48 ans. Elle est mariée à Venant un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants qui ont terminé l’école primaire.

Elle est  commerçante de boisson locale depuis 3ans.

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit avec Turame.Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient,elle va augmenter son capital,en achetant une grande quantité de litres de boisson locale à revendre pour gagner plus.

Avec les benefices, elle pourra améliorer sa situation familiale : achat des habits de la famille, améliorer la ration alimentaire,…
texts.en:
Antoinette is part of the Twisununure group. She is 48 and lives in Gitega. She is married to Venant, a tailor. They have 6 children, who finished primary school.

She's been selling a local drink for 3 years.

This is her fourth loan with Turame. With this loan she is getting from KIVA, she will increase her capital, by buying a large quantity of the local drink which she will resell to earn more.

With the profits, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family by buying clothes, serving bigger portions of food, etc.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of the local drink which she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. In the past 3 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her small business which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Pauline hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pauline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yémalo Adrienne

texts.fr: Yémalo Adrienne  âgée de 42 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Yémalo Adrienne est une veuve, mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yémalo Adrienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Yémalo Adrienne vend depuis seize ans à son domicile, des lubrifiants et des produits GSM. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Yémalo Adrienne achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Yémalo Adrienne sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter  des lubrifiants et des produits GSM.

loans.name: Vic Bryan

texts.en:
Vic Bryan is very grateful for the loan assistance that was granted to him as he was able to purchase quantities of raw materials, particularly Capiz shells, needed for his business. His earnings were a big help to the personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for him to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed for his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his family’s daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Vic Bryan dreams of giving his family a good life and he wants to hire more workers who specialized in handcrafts. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam.She is married and has four children.Three are in primary school,one in secondary school.Mary runs a tailoring business in a rented premise near her residence.She has been in this business for five years now.Mary is planning to increase the stock of sewing and tailoring materials.She recently get a lot of orders from customers who prepare themselves for the coming Christmas.The stock of sewing materials she currently has cannot meet the orders.She is in need of USD 550 to have the right quantity of stock.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF SEWING MATERIALS

loans.name: Alexis Yovany

texts.en:
For four years now I have framed photographs, diplomas, etc. I attend to my business personally, and my clients are market vendors who sell mirrors and decorative picture frames, as well as single clients who desire to have photographs and diplomas framed. My business has generated enough revenue to sustain my family. However, I want to purchase material to expand my business now that I have begun to remodel my house. This new capital will help finalize construction.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cuatro anos me dedico al enmarcado de cuadros, fotografias, diplomas y otros. Mi negocio lo atiendo personalmente y mis clientes son vendedores de mercado que venden espejos y cuadros decorativos, tambien a personas particulares que enmarcan fotografias y diplomas. Mi negocio me ha generado ingresos para mantener a mi familia, quiero comprar material para hacer mas trabajos ya que comence a remodelar mis casa y necesito capital para finalizar la obra.

loans.use: Purchase wood, glue, special cardboard, and glass.
